original: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @1b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: ko sa la aa lam k'a ra ya tattva sam gra ha t'i k'a /
analyzed: ko sa la aa lam k'a ra ya tattva sam gra ha t'i k'a /
translated: Kosalālamkāra-yatattvasaṅgrahaṭīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgya cher bshad pa ko sa la'i rgyan /
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa'i rgya cher bshad pa ko sa la'i rgyan /
translated: The Kosala Ornament, an Extensive Explanation of the Compendium of Principles

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal kun du bzang po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dpal kun du bzang po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Śrī Samantabhadra.

original: rgyud bdag dang ni rgyal bzhi dang po'i sems dpa' dang // rgyal sras lhag ma rnams dang rigs kyi yum rnams dang // rab mchog las mdzad mchod pa bzhi dang phyag rgya dang // rgyud dang snying po rig bcas de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rgyud bdag dang ni rgyal bzhi dang po'i sems dpa' dang // rgyal sras lhag ma rnams dang rigs kyi yum rnams dang // rab mchog las mdzad mchod pa bzhi dang phyag rgya dang // rgyud dang snying po rig bcas de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: The continuum, the four victors, the first mind, the remaining victors’ sons, the mother of the family, the supreme, the one who performs deeds, the four offerings, the seal, the tantra, the essence, and the knowledge—homage to that.

original: chos tshul zab mo'i rgya mtshor shin tu zhugs gyur cing //
analyzed: chos tshul zab mo'i rgya mtshor shin tu zhugs gyur cing //
translated: Having thoroughly entered the ocean of the profound Dharma way,

original: ye shes mtsho chen de nyid ma lus bdag po mdzad //
analyzed: ye shes mtsho chen de nyid ma lus bdag po mdzad //
translated: the lord of the entire ocean of pristine awareness,

original: shes rab bdud rtsi las byung dri med byis pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: shes rab bdud rtsi las byung dri med byis pa'i gzugs //
translated: the stainless form of a child arisen from the nectar of wisdom,

original: bde gshegs sras po 'jam pa'i dbyangs la'ang bdag phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: bde gshegs sras po 'jam pa'i dbyangs la'ang bdag phyag 'tshal //
translated: I also pay homage to Mañjughoṣa, the son of the sugatas.

original: rgyal rnams 'dus las bka' thob rnam par rgyal bar ldan //
analyzed: rgyal rnams 'dus las bka' thob rnam par rgyal bar ldan //
translated: Having received the command from the assembly of victors, he became the Victorious One.

original: 'gro la phan phyir 'jig rten gsum las rnam rgyal mdzad //
analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir 'jig rten gsum las rnam rgyal mdzad //
translated: In order to benefit beings, he conquered the three worlds.

original: lha mi rnams la rgyud ston bcom ldan gang yin pa //
analyzed: lha mi rnams la rgyud ston bcom ldan gang yin pa //
translated: The one who taught the tantra to gods and humans, the Bhagavān,

original: rgyal dbang rdo rje 'dzin pa de la'ang rab tu 'dud //
analyzed: rgyal dbang rdo rje 'dzin pa de la'ang rab tu 'dud //
translated: I also bow to him, the victorious Vajradhara.

original: grong khyer bzang por sangs rgyas sde zhes grags thob gang //🔽bla @2a * //
analyzed: grong khyer bzang por sangs rgyas sde zhes grags thob gang // bla @2a * //
translated: The one who attained the name Buddha-senā in the city of Bhadra,

original: ma'i mchog de dang por rab dad mnyes byas te //
analyzed: ma'i mchog de dang por rab dad mnyes byas te //
translated: The supreme guru, first pleased him with faith.

original: gnang ba mnos shing cho gas dam tshig thob nas ni //
analyzed: gnang ba mnos shing cho gas dam tshig thob nas ni //
translated: Having received permission and attained the commitments through the ritual,

original: de la shin tu mang thos mang du rnam par dpyad //🔽kong ka nir ni dra mi da dang dbang phyug dpal 'dus dang // chos sde chos kyi 'byung gnas dga' bas bsnyen bkur byas //
analyzed: de la shin tu mang thos mang du rnam par dpyad // kong ka nir ni dra mi da dang dbang phyug dpal 'dus dang // chos sde chos kyi 'byung gnas dga' bas bsnyen bkur byas //
translated: He studied and analyzed extensively with him.🔽In Koṅkana, he served Draminada and Śrīśiva,🔽And in Dharmākara, he served the Dharma-born Dhana.🔽In Sahya, he served Dhvajavajra, who was given that name,

original: sa h+yer chos kyi rdo rje mchog tu mtshan gsol dang // gtsug tor rdo rje'ang mang du legs par bsnyen bkur byas //
analyzed: sa h+yer chos kyi rdo rje mchog tu mtshan gsol dang // gtsug tor rdo rje'ang mang du legs par bsnyen bkur byas //
translated: And also served Uṣṇīṣavajra well.

original: yon tan 'byung gnas byang phyogs au rgyan yul bgrod de //
analyzed: yon tan 'byung gnas byang phyogs au rgyan yul bgrod de //
translated: I went to the northern land of Oḍḍiyāna, the source of good qualities,

original: rgyud don de nyid 'dzin rgyal aindra bh'u ti bsnyen //
analyzed: rgyud don de nyid 'dzin rgyal aindra bh'u ti bsnyen //
translated: And served the king of tantra holders, Indrabhūti, with devotion.

original: tag kyer grong khyer ka sha la yi slob dpon ni //
analyzed: tag kyer grong khyer ka sha la yi slob dpon ni //
translated: In the city of Takṣaśilā, I relied on the master

original: blo brtan blo gros 'byung gnas tshul mkhas gus pas bsten //
analyzed: blo brtan blo gros 'byung gnas tshul mkhas gus pas bsten //
translated: Vīryabhadra, the source of wisdom, with respect.

original: bla ma'i zhal nas yang dag man ngag gang las ni //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal nas yang dag man ngag gang las ni //
translated: From the mouth of the guru, I received the true esoteric instructions,

original: cung zad bdag gis ci rtogs dag pa'i lung gi tshul //🔽'jig rten rnal 'byor cho gas slob dpon bzhin rim gyis //
analyzed: cung zad bdag gis ci rtogs dag pa'i lung gi tshul // 'jig rten rnal 'byor cho gas slob dpon bzhin rim gyis //
translated: And I understood a little of the pure scriptural tradition.

original: 'di ni yun ring gnas phyir bdag gis rnam par bsams //
analyzed: 'di ni yun ring gnas phyir bdag gis rnam par bsams //
translated: In order for this to remain for a long time, I thought🔽In accordance with the ritual of worldly yoga, like a master.🔽For the sake of benefiting those people

original: 'gro ngan bdag pas blo dman mi rnams gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'gro ngan bdag pas blo dman mi rnams gang yin pa //
translated: Who are of inferior intelligence due to their bad karma,

original: de la phan gdags phyir ni rang gi stobs bskyed de //
analyzed: de la phan gdags phyir ni rang gi stobs bskyed de //
translated: I will generate my own strength

original: gang du de nyid don bsdus tshul ni rnam ston pa'i //
analyzed: gang du de nyid don bsdus tshul ni rnam ston pa'i //
translated: And explain the way of condensing the meaning of reality.

original: de nyid bsdus te bdag gis gus pas rnam par dbye //
analyzed: de nyid bsdus te bdag gis gus pas rnam par dbye //
translated: I will respectfully analyze The Compendium of Reality.

original: rgyud 'dir rgyud kyi bdag po rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug dpal ldan rnam par snang mdzad @2b kyi yon tan gyi gleng gzhi ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir rgyud kyi bdag po rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug dpal ldan rnam par snang mdzad @2b kyi yon tan gyi gleng gzhi ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In this tantra, the introductory basis of the qualities of the glorious Vairocana, the lord of yogins, is taught from the beginning of the chapter on the vajra empowerment of all tathāgatas,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin ston pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin ston pa'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: up to the teaching on the samādhi that generates Vajrasattva.

original: de nas gzhan yang rdo rje sems dpa'i rgyud nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rdo rje sems dpa'i rgyud nas brtsams te /
translated: Then, beginning with the Vajrasattva Tantra,

original: de skad ces bka' stsal zhes bya ba'i bar ni rgyud do //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal zhes bya ba'i bar ni rgyud do //
translated: up to the phrase thus he spoke, is the tantra.

original: rgyud 'di la yang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par sdud par byed pas mngon sum du thos par ston to //
analyzed: rgyud 'di la yang 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yang dag par sdud par byed pas mngon sum du thos par ston to //
translated: In this tantra, the phrase thus have I heard and so forth is taught by the compiler as if he directly heard it.

original: de yang 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: de yang 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is also taught as follows:

original: bdag nyid kyis thos kyi gzhan dag las brgyud de thos pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis thos kyi gzhan dag las brgyud de thos pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: I myself heard it, not from others by hearsay.

original: khyod kyis dus gang gi tshe thos she na /
analyzed: khyod kyis dus gang gi tshe thos she na /
translated: When did you hear it?

original: dus gcig na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: At one time is stated.

original: lan cig gi dus tshod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lan cig gi dus tshod na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means at one time.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi ston to //
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi ston to //
translated: Now, beginning with the Blessed One, the nidana is taught.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bcom pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das te nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na yi ge bsgyur ba byas na phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bcom pa dang ldan pas na bcom ldan 'das te nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na yi ge bsgyur ba byas na phung po dang / 'chi bdag dang / nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu'i bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: There, the Blessed One is the Blessed One because of being endowed with destruction; in the manner of a verbal root, the syllables are transformed: he has destroyed the aggregates, the Lord of Death, the afflictions, and the Mara of the sons of the gods.

original: gang gis rgyud 'di ston par mdzad pa'i rgyud kyi bdag po bcom ldan 'das 'di yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis rgyud 'di ston par mdzad pa'i rgyud kyi bdag po bcom ldan 'das 'di yon tan ji lta bu dang ldan zhe na /
translated: If one asks, By what cause is this Blessed One, the lord of the tantra who teaches this tantra, endowed with what kind of qualities?

original: de nas gzhan yang de'i yon tan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang de'i yon tan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: Then, his qualities are taught beginning with also, the vajra empowerment of all tathagatas and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: Since he is a tathagata and also all, he is all tathagatas.

original: de yang ji ltar gnas pa'i don de thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar gnas pa'i don de thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bshad de /
translated: Moreover, since he has realized and awakened to the meaning of the way things are, he is called the Tathagata.

original: rtogs pa'i don thams cad ni gshegs pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don thams cad ni gshegs pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all meanings of realization are the meaning of going.

original: 'dir thams cad kyi sgra ni mtha' thug pa med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: 'dir thams cad kyi sgra ni mtha' thug pa med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: Here, the word all is a word of unlimited extent.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It shows the buddhas and bodhisattvas of the mandala.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid rdo rje yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid rdo rje yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ste /
translated: Since all the Tathagatas themselves are vajras, they are the vajras of all the Tathagatas.

original: mi phyed pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad kyi don 'byed pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa nyid kyis dngos po thams cad kyi don 'byed pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: Since they are indivisible, they are vajras because they penetrate the meaning of all things.

original: de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs ni sprul pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs ni sprul pa ste /
translated: Their blessings are emanations.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs te /
translated: That is the vajra blessing of all the Tathagatas.

original: snying po dang dam tshig dang phyag rgya dang sems dpa'i @3a * //
analyzed: snying po dang dam tshig dang phyag rgya dang sems dpa'i @3a * //
translated: The essence, the commitment, the seal, and the being

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rdzogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The mandala and so forth are completed.

original: 'di nyid ni dam tshig yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs dang dam tshig ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni dam tshig yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs dang dam tshig ces bya ste /
translated: Since this is a commitment, it is called the Vajra Empowerment and Commitment of All Tathagatas.

original: tshul de ltar rnam par gnas shing dkyil 'khor chen po mthong ba la gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin par gnang ba'i phyir de dag thams cad kyang dam tshig gi sgra nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: tshul de ltar rnam par gnas shing dkyil 'khor chen po mthong ba la gsang sngags rjes su 'dzin par gnang ba'i phyir de dag thams cad kyang dam tshig gi sgra nyid du bshad do //
translated: Since they are established in that way and are permitted to hold the mantra after seeing the great mandala, all of them are explained with the very word “commitment.”

original: de lta bu'i dam tshig mkhyen pa la ni dam tshig gi ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dam tshig mkhyen pa la ni dam tshig gi ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: Knowledge of such a commitment is called “knowledge of commitment.”

original: dam tshig la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig la mkhas pa'o //
translated: It is skill in commitment.

original: de'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni khyad par rnam pa du ma ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni khyad par rnam pa du ma ste /
translated: Its various aspects are its many different kinds.

original: rigs dang rtog pa dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i dbye bas shin tu yang rnam pa tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: rigs dang rtog pa dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i dbye bas shin tu yang rnam pa tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is also very different in kind due to the divisions of family, thought, mandala, and so forth.

original: de rnams dang ldan pa ni bcas pa yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs dang / dam tshig gi ye shes rnam pa sna tshogs kyi khyad par dang ldan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams dang ldan pa ni bcas pa yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs dang / dam tshig gi ye shes rnam pa sna tshogs kyi khyad par dang ldan zhes bya ste /
translated: Since he is endowed with those, he is the one who is blessed by the vajra of all the Tathagatas, and is endowed with the special varieties of the pristine wisdom of the commitments.

original: rgyud las gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi las la mchog tu mkhas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyud las gsungs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi las la mchog tu mkhas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is supremely skilled in the mandala rites taught in the tantras.

original: tshig 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de mchog tu yang dam tshig la mkhas par ston to //
analyzed: tshig 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de mchog tu yang dam tshig la mkhas par ston to //
translated: This verse shows that the Lord is supremely skilled in the commitments.🔽Even if he is skilled in the commitments, it is not proper to give and take the mantras without the consecration. In order to show this, the text states:

original: gal te dam tshig shes pa yin du zin kyang dbang bskur ba med par sngags sbyin pa dang gzung ba la sogs pa bya bar mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i dbu rgyan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pa'i gzhung nye bar dgod par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te dam tshig shes pa yin du zin kyang dbang bskur ba med par sngags sbyin pa dang gzung ba la sogs pa bya bar mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i dbu rgyan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs🔽pa'i gzhung nye bar dgod par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: He is the one who is consecrated with the precious crown of all the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid rin po che yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid rin po che yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che ste /
translated: Since all the transcendent lords are jewels, they are the jewels of all transcendent lords.

original: rnyed par dka' ba'i don dang / rin che ba'i don dang / don chen po nyid du gyur pa dang / rab tu snang ba'i don gyis na rin po che dang 'dra bas na rin po che ste /
analyzed: rnyed par dka' ba'i don dang / rin che ba'i don dang / don chen po nyid du gyur pa dang / rab tu snang ba'i don gyis na rin po che dang 'dra bas na rin po che ste /
translated: They are like jewels because they are difficult to acquire, valuable, have great meaning and are very radiant.

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba ni au dumw'ar  dang 'dra bas na rnyed par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba ni au dumw'ar  dang 'dra bas na rnyed par dka' ba ste /
translated: The appearance of the buddhas is like the udumbara flower, therefore, they are difficult to acquire.

original: dus dpag tu med par sbyangs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus dpag tu med par sbyangs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the result of training over immeasurable time.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs tshad med pa'i rin gyis rnyed pas na rin che ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs tshad med pa'i rin gyis rnyed pas na rin che ba'o //
translated: They are valuable because they are acquired through the price of immeasurable collections of merit and wisdom.

original: 'khor ba thams cad kyi dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par gcod par byed pa'i don dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba shin tu rnam par dag ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i don gyis na don chen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad kyi dbul ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par gcod par byed pa'i don dang / 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba dang yid bde ba shin tu rnam par dag ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i don gyis na don chen por gyur pa'o //
translated: It is of great value because it completely cuts off the suffering of poverty and so forth of all transmigrators, and because it is the basis of the extremely pure mundane and supramundane happiness and mental happiness.

original: phyi dang nang gi mun pa sel ba'i don gyis na rab tu snang ba ste /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi mun pa sel ba'i don gyis na rab tu snang ba ste /
translated: It is a great light because it removes the darkness of the internal and external.

original: de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa @3b lnga po de rnams kyi rin po che'i bye brag las bsgrubs pa'i dbu rgyan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i dbu rgyan no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i de bzhin gshegs pa @3b lnga po de rnams kyi rin po che'i bye brag las bsgrubs pa'i dbu rgyan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i dbu rgyan no //
translated: The crown of the Tathagatas is the crown of all the Tathagatas, which is made of various jewels.

original: khams gsum ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: khams gsum ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te /
translated: The three realms are the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: khams gsum po na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnams spangs pas shin tu yang dri ma med par gyur pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs ma lus pa dang ldan pa'i bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po'i chos kyi mdzod brnyes par gyur pas
analyzed: khams gsum po na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnams spangs pas shin tu yang dri ma med par gyur pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs ma lus pa dang ldan pa'i bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po'i chos kyi mdzod brnyes par gyur pas
translated: Since he has abandoned the afflictions that are experienced in the three realms together with their imprints, he has become utterly stainless and has attained the treasury of the Dharma of the unsurpassed Dharma king, endowed with all the accumulations of good qualities.

original: na khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal po ste bdag po'o //
analyzed: na khams gsum pa'i chos kyi rgyal po ste bdag po'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the Dharma king of the three realms, the lord.

original: des na de'i rtags su rin po che'i cod pan des dbang bskur ba de brnyes par na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i dbu rgyan gyis khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal po'i dbang bskur ba brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: des na de'i rtags su rin po che'i cod pan des dbang bskur ba de brnyes par na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i dbu rgyan gyis khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal po'i dbang bskur ba brnyes pa'o //
translated: Since he has attained the consecration of the crown jewel that is the sign of that, he has attained the consecration of the Dharma king of the three realms with the crown jewel of all the tathāgatas.

original: dbang bskur ba thob tu zin kyang rnal 'byor bsgom pa la dbang ma thob na sems can gyi don bya ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba thob tu zin kyang rnal 'byor bsgom pa la dbang ma thob na sems can gyi don bya ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: Even though he has attained consecration, if he has not attained mastery in the practice of yoga, he will not be able to benefit sentient beings.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is called the omniscient wisdom of all the Tathagatas.

original: thams cad ni shes bya ma lus pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni shes bya ma lus pa ste /
translated: All means all objects of knowledge without exception.

original: rtag par thams cad mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par thams cad mkhyen pas na thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Since it always knows all, it is omniscient.

original: de'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Its wisdom is omniscient wisdom.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de nyid ni rnal 'byor chen po'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes de nyid ni rnal 'byor chen po'o //
translated: That omniscient wisdom itself is the great yoga.

original: de yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam yin te /
analyzed: de yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel bar 'jug pa'i lam yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the path of the union of shamatha and vipashyana.

original: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin la sems pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: zhi gnas ni ting nge 'dzin la sems pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Shamatha has the characteristic of the mind being focused on samadhi.

original: sems gang dmigs par bya ba gcig la rab tu 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: sems gang dmigs par bya ba gcig la rab tu 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is the mind that is fully placed on a single object of focus.

original: lhag mthong ni shes rab ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong ni shes rab ste /
translated: Vipashyana is prajna.

original: de yang sems las byung ba chos rab tu rnams par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can te mnyam par 'jog pa'i sems kyis 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sems las byung ba chos rab tu rnams par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can te mnyam par 'jog pa'i sems kyis 'di ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It also has the characteristic of the mental factor that fully discerns phenomena. With a mind in equipoise, it knows, “This is contaminated.

original: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: This is uncontaminated.

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: This is defilement.

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba'o zhes rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: This is purification.

original: zhi gnas shas che na ni sems rmugs pa'i nye bar g-yeng bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhi gnas shas che na ni sems rmugs pa'i nye bar g-yeng bar 'gyur la /
translated: When serenity predominates, the hindrance of lethargy-and-drowsiness occurs.

original: lhag mthong shas che na ni rgod pa'i nye bar g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong shas che na ni rgod pa'i nye bar g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When insight predominates, the hindrance of sensual-desire and resistance occur.

original: de bas na rim bzhin du snang ba yid la byed pa dang / mi rtag pa yid la byed pas kyang nye bar g-yeng ba'i dngos po gnyis bzlog nas bsam par bya ba'i dngos po de la zung du 'jug par gnas la /🔽dran pa'i thag pas gang dang gang du zhi gnas dang @4a * //
analyzed: de bas na rim bzhin du snang ba yid la byed pa dang / mi rtag pa yid la byed pas kyang nye bar g-yeng ba'i dngos po gnyis bzlog nas bsam par bya ba'i dngos po de la zung du 'jug par gnas la / dran pa'i thag pas gang dang gang du zhi gnas dang @4a * //
translated: Therefore, when the two hindrances are removed by the two attentions to light and impermanence, respectively, one should abide in the union of serenity and insight with regard to the object under consideration.

original: lhag mthong gi tshul de lta bu gang las nyams pa las blo bzlog ste yang dag pa la sbyar ba ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi tshul de lta bu gang las nyams pa las blo bzlog ste yang dag pa la sbyar ba ni zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: By the rope of mindfulness, one should turn the mind away from whatever causes serenity and insight to deteriorate, and one should apply it to what is correct.🔽This is the union of serenity and insight.

original: zung du 'jug pa nyid kyis na rnam pa 'dis 'jug pa'i ngang tshul can ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa nyid kyis na rnam pa 'dis 'jug pa'i ngang tshul can ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By being a union, it is the nature of engaging in this way, which means that it engages without manifest conceptualization.

original: thabs nges mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du gyur pas na zung du 'jug pa ni lam mo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: thabs nges mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam du gyur pas na zung du 'jug pa ni lam mo zhes bshad do //
translated: Since it is the method that is ascertained as the path to nirvana, the union is explained as the path.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa bzhi'i chos mi 'dzin pas ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba la dbang thob cing /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa bzhi'i chos mi 'dzin pas ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba la dbang thob cing /
translated: Since it does not apprehend the phenomena of the four types of meditative concentration, it obtains power over birth in accordance with one's wishes.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i dus la ji ltar 'dod par 'jug pa 'di ni thams cad kyi mchog ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i dus la ji ltar 'dod par 'jug pa 'di ni thams cad kyi mchog ste /
translated: Engaging in the unconditioned at will, this is the supreme of all.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po zhes bshad la /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po zhes bshad la /
translated: It is explained as the great yoga of omniscient wisdom.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po ste /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po ste /
translated: That which possesses that is the great yoga of omniscient wisdom of all tathāgatas.

original: de la yang 'di dbang phyug yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de la yang 'di dbang phyug yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor chen po'i dbang phyug go //
translated: Since he is the lord of that, he is the lord of great yoga, the omniscient gnosis of all tathāgatas.

original: rnal 'byor la dbang thob tu zin kyang gal te rang sangs rgyas ltar gzhan gyi don la btang snyoms mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di bzlog par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor la dbang thob tu zin kyang gal te rang sangs rgyas ltar gzhan gyi don la btang snyoms mdzad par 'gyur ro zhes pa 'di bzlog par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: Even though he has attained mastery over yoga, if he were to be indifferent to the welfare of others like a pratyekabuddha, this would be refuted by teaching “the seal of all tathāgatas” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgra ni 'dir dkyil 'khor ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgra ni 'dir dkyil 'khor ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga dang byang chub sems dpa' bcu drug yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the “sound of all tathāgatas” refers to the five tathāgatas of the maṇḍala and the sixteen bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyi phyag rgya thams cad kyi phyag rgya chen po dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang las kyi phyag rgya dang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyag rgya thams cad kyi phyag rgya chen po dang dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang chos kyi phyag rgya dang las kyi phyag rgya dang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Their “seals” are the four types: the great seal, the pledge seal, the doctrine seal, and the action seal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya de dag thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ni mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya de dag thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid ni mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The sameness of all those seals of all tathāgatas is sameness.

original: dbyer mi phyed pa nyid kyis na rdo rje ste sku ji lta ba bzhin du thugs kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: dbyer mi phyed pa nyid kyis na rdo rje ste sku ji lta ba bzhin du thugs kyang de bzhin /
translated: Since they are inseparable, they are vajras. Just as the body is so is the mind.

original: phyag rgya yang de bzhin /
analyzed: phyag rgya yang de bzhin /
translated: Just as the body is so is the seal.

original: gsung yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gsung yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as the body is so is the speech.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje mi phyed pa nyid kyis thams cad kyi dgos pa yang dag par sgrub par mdzad pas na phyag rgya thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje mi phyed pa nyid kyis thams cad kyi dgos pa yang dag par sgrub par mdzad pas na phyag rgya thams cad mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: Since the vajra body, speech, and mind are inseparable, they accomplish the purpose of all.

original: 'di ni kun rdzob kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: This is the conventional sameness.

original: de yang / sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
analyzed: de yang / sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
translated: Moreover, the vajra of body, speech, and mind

original: bsdus pas khu tshur zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bsdus pas khu tshur zhes bshad do //
translated: is explained as the fist through gathering.

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is said.

original: don dam par ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pas na phyag rgya thams cad mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: don dam par ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pas na phyag rgya thams cad mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Ultimately, since all phenomena are emptiness, all seals are sameness.

original: @4b stong pa nyid so sor rtogs par gyur pa las 'di ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @4b stong pa nyid so sor rtogs par gyur pa las 'di ltar 'gyur te /
translated: From the realization of emptiness, it is like this:🔽Since these things depend on conceptualization, they are engaged and turned away from by the power of the mind.

original: dngos po 'di rnams ni rnam par rtog pa la rag las pa yin pas gang sems kyi dbang gi rab tu 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin no zhes shes nas lus dang ngag dang yid shin tu brtan pas gang byas pa de thams cad 'byung zhing /
analyzed: dngos po 'di rnams ni rnam par rtog pa la rag las pa yin pas gang sems kyi dbang gi rab tu 'jug pa dang ldog pa yin no zhes shes nas lus dang ngag dang yid shin tu brtan pas gang byas pa de thams cad 'byung zhing /
translated: Thus, knowing that, whatever is done with a very stable body, speech, and mind, all of that will occur.

original: gang rnam par bzlog pa de thams cad ldog go //
analyzed: gang rnam par bzlog pa de thams cad ldog go //
translated: Whatever is turned away from, all of that will be stopped.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang yongs su bsgyur ba de yongs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang yongs su bsgyur ba de yongs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever form and so on is transformed, that will be transformed.

original: gang dus kyi mthar 'jog pa de dag ni gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dus kyi mthar 'jog pa de dag ni gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is placed at the end of time, that will remain.

original: de ltar sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs pa thams cad kyi yid la mngon par 'dod pa'i don de'i phyag rgya thams cad mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs pa thams cad kyi yid la mngon par 'dod pa'i don de'i phyag rgya thams cad mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Thus, all the seals of the intended meaning of the various worlds of sentient beings and environments are the same.

original: stong pa nyid so sor rtogs pa dang / de la dbang du gyur pa thob pas kyang sku dang gsung dang thugs shin tu brtan po thugs su chud cing brnyes pas sna tshogs kyi bya ba mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid so sor rtogs pa dang / de la dbang du gyur pa thob pas kyang sku dang gsung dang thugs shin tu brtan po thugs su chud cing brnyes pas sna tshogs kyi bya ba mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa ste /
translated: And by the realization of emptiness and the attainment of mastery over it, he has realized and attained the very firm body, speech, and mind, and so performs the various activities.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa nyid kyis te de'i sna tshogs pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa nyid kyis te de'i sna tshogs pa'i bya ba byed pa nyid de /
translated: This is the performance of all aims, and because it is his very essence, it is by the performance of all aims, by his performance of the various activities.

original: phyag rgya thams cad mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa des thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya thams cad mnyam pa nyid du thugs su chud pa des thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: By his realization of the equality of all seals, he performs all aims.

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams te 'dir ma lus shing lus pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'jig rten pa'i spyi'i sgra ste /
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams te 'dir ma lus shing lus pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'jig rten pa'i spyi'i sgra ste /
translated: Without exception and without remainder means the world systems. Here the words without exception and without remainder are general words for the world.

original: gang gi phyir ma lus pa'i sgra ni thams cad kyi sgra'i rnam grangs yin pas na zad par gyi tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma lus pa'i sgra ni thams cad kyi sgra'i rnam grangs yin pas na zad par gyi tshig go //
translated: Because the word without exception is a synonym for all, it is a word for exhaustion.

original: de la cung zad lus pa nyed kyang srid pas lus pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: de la cung zad lus pa nyed kyang srid pas lus pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
translated: Since it is possible that something remains, the term “without remainder” is stated.

original: de na 'di ltar rnam par gnas par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: de na 'di ltar rnam par gnas par 'gyur te ;
translated: Thus, it is established in this way:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa rnams su zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus shing lus pa med pa rnams su zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: “in all world-realms without exception” means “in all world-realms without remainder.”

original: de'i phyir / 'dir sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'dir sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, here it is said “of the entire realm of sentient beings.”

original: gang du thams cad ces smos pa med pa der gzhan du 'gyur srid pas ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: gang du thams cad ces smos pa med pa der gzhan du 'gyur srid pas ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i sgra smos so //
translated: Where the term “all” is not stated, since it is possible that there is another, the term “without remainder” is stated.

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du re ba zhes pa srid pa yongs su zhen pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas na re ba thams cad yongs su bskang ba'i phrin las mdzad pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad du re ba zhes pa srid pa yongs su zhen pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas na re ba thams cad yongs su bskang ba'i phrin las mdzad pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Since all the hopes of the entire realm of sentient beings are completely fulfilled, it is said that he performs the activity of fulfilling all hopes.

original: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa na /
translated: When all hopes are completely fulfilled,

original: ci'i phyir mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mdzad ce na /
translated: why are they fulfilled?

original: @5a * // thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: @5a * // thugs rje chen po zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The one called Great Compassion is stated.

original: phongs par gyur pa'i sems can rnams skyong bar mdzad pas na thugs rje ste /
analyzed: phongs par gyur pa'i sems can rnams skyong bar mdzad pas na thugs rje ste /
translated: It is compassion because it protects sentient beings who are in distress.

original: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: It is the suffering of others that is the suffering itself.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi yul nas ji srid khams gsum po na spyod pa'i sems can thams cad kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis zin pa de la thugs rje chen pos skyong bar mdzad pa'i thugs rje
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi yul nas ji srid khams gsum po na spyod pa'i sems can thams cad kyang 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis zin pa de la thugs rje chen pos skyong bar mdzad pa'i thugs rje
translated: The great compassion of the one who protects with great compassion the suffering of sentient beings who experience suffering in the desire realm, up to the suffering of all sentient beings who experience the three realms, which is the suffering of conditioned existence,

original: chen po mnga' bas na thugs rje chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po mnga' bas na thugs rje chen po'o //
translated: is great compassion.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams la yang thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o snyam pa la rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams la yang thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o snyam pa la rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: If you think that the lords of the ten bodhisattva stages also have great compassion, then it is said that he is Vairocana.

original: snang ba yin pas na rnam par snang mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba yin pas na rnam par snang mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is Vairocana because he is the appearance.

original: de yang khyad par du snang bar mdzad pa'i phyir na rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: de yang khyad par du snang bar mdzad pa'i phyir na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: And because he manifests in particular, he is Vairocana.

original: 'di 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las shin tu rnam par grol ba'i thugs rje chen po yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las shin tu rnam par grol ba'i thugs rje chen po yin gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin no //
translated: He is the great compassion that is completely liberated from all the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, but he is not a bodhisattva.

original: yun ring por dka' ba brnyes nas re ba thams cad yongs su bskang bar mdzad pa pos kyang 'di lta bur yun ring du bzhugs par mi bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: yun ring por dka' ba brnyes nas re ba thams cad yongs su bskang bar mdzad pa pos kyang 'di lta bur yun ring du bzhugs par mi bya'am zhe na /
translated: Having attained difficulty for a long time, he fulfills all hopes. But he will not remain for a long time in this way?

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The word “permanent” is stated.

original: rtag pa zhes smos pas chos kyi sku la bya ste /
analyzed: rtag pa zhes smos pas chos kyi sku la bya ste /
translated: By stating “permanent,” it refers to the dharma body.

original: mi 'gyur bar rtag pas rtag par yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: mi 'gyur bar rtag pas rtag par yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: It is taken as permanent because it is permanent through being unchanging.

original: ye shes kyi sku yang rnam grangs kyi rtag pas rgyun gyi rtag pa can te gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid du 'khor ba ji srid par rgyun du rjes su 'jug pa yin pas na ye shes kyi sku yang rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku yang rnam grangs kyi rtag pas rgyun gyi rtag pa can te gnas gyur pa'i mtshan nyid du 'khor ba ji srid par rgyun du rjes su 'jug pa yin pas na ye shes kyi sku yang rtag pa yin no //
translated: The body of wisdom is also permanent by way of the permanence of continuity, because it is characterized by transformation, and it continuously follows for as long as cyclic existence lasts. Therefore, the body of wisdom is also permanent.

original: gal te rtag pa yin na ji ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas su brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa yin na ji ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas su brjod ce na /
translated: If it is permanent, how can it be said to be a buddha of the past, future, or present?

original: de'i lan du dus gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i lan du dus gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, the text says, “The three times are merely labels,” and so on.

original: dus ni brda ste kun rdzob tu dus gsum dag tu gzugs kyi sku yang ye shes kyi sku la ltos nas rnam par gnas pa'i sku mnga' bas na dus gsum du rtag par bzhugs pa'i sku zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dus ni brda ste kun rdzob tu dus gsum dag tu gzugs kyi sku yang ye shes kyi sku la ltos nas rnam par gnas pa'i sku mnga' bas na dus gsum du rtag par bzhugs pa'i sku zhes bya ste /
translated: Time is a mere label, a convention. The three times are merely labels. The body of form is also a body that abides in dependence on the body of wisdom. Therefore, it is said to be a body that abides permanently in the three times.

original: sku 'di gnyis ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung bar srid par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sku 'di gnyis ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung bar srid par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because these two bodies are conditioned, they can exist in the past, future, and present.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni rnam par grangs kyi rtag pa nyid du bshad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni rnam par grangs kyi rtag pa nyid du bshad pa kho na'o //
translated: The body of wisdom is explained as permanent in the sense of being a series.

original: gal te skad cig mi rtag pa nyid kyis ye shes @5b kyi sku yang dus gsum du bzung na ni mi rtag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te skad cig mi rtag pa nyid kyis ye shes @5b kyi sku yang dus gsum du bzung na ni mi rtag pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the body of wisdom is grasped as impermanent in the sense of being momentary, then it is impermanent.

original: ci'i phyir gzhan gyis mi shigs pa yin zhes 'di la phyogs snga ma rtog pas de'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs thams cad rdo rje zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzhan gyis mi shigs pa yin zhes 'di la phyogs snga ma rtog pas de'i phyir sku dang gsung dang thugs thams cad rdo rje zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Why is it not destroyed by others? The opponent imagines this, so it is said that the body, speech, and mind are all vajra.

original: rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje ltar mi phyed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are indivisible like a vajra.

original: go rims ji skad du bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ni sgrib pa thams cad las grol bar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir thugs mi phyed pa yin la /
analyzed: go rims ji skad du bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos ni sgrib pa thams cad las grol bar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir thugs mi phyed pa yin la /
translated: The Dharma of the Tathāgata, as explained in order, is the indivisible mind, because it is liberated from all obscurations.

original: de las snang ba'i sku yang de'i dbang las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: de las snang ba'i sku yang de'i dbang las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The body that appears from that is born from its power.

original: sgra yang ji skad bshad pa'i thugs kyi rgyun la rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i khyad par rnams kyis 'gyur ba mi skyed pa dang / srog chags dang srog chags ma yin pa'i 'gyur ba skyed par spyod pas na /
analyzed: sgra yang ji skad bshad pa'i thugs kyi rgyun la rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i khyad par rnams kyis 'gyur ba mi skyed pa dang / srog chags dang srog chags ma yin pa'i 'gyur ba skyed par spyod pas na /
translated: And it is employed to generate the distinctions of living beings and non-living beings.

original: gsum char yang rdo rje lta bur gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: gsum char yang rdo rje lta bur gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, all three are of the nature of being vajra-like.

original: de bas na sku dang gsung dang thugs thams cad rdo rje lta bur gyur ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na sku dang gsung dang thugs thams cad rdo rje lta bur gyur ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said that the Tathāgata is one in whom all body, speech, and mind have become vajra-like.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis ji ltar thugs su chud pa de bzhin du chos nyid thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa ni thugs su chud pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis ji ltar thugs su chud pa de bzhin du chos nyid thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa ni thugs su chud pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha is the Tathāgata because he realizes reality just as it was realized by the Buddhas of the past. The Tathāgata is the one who has realized the meaning of reality.

original: yang na chos rnams ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du ston par mdzad pas na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis yi ge bsgyur ba byas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos rnams ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du ston par mdzad pas na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis yi ge bsgyur ba byas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: Or else, he is the Tathāgata because he teaches things as they are, and he is the Tathāgata because he has transformed the letters by the method of etymological explanation.

original: de dag gis ni dam tshig mkhyen pa la sogs pa chos rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das 'di ni slob dpon gyi mchog tu gyur par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni dam tshig mkhyen pa la sogs pa chos rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pas bcom ldan 'das 'di ni slob dpon gyi mchog tu gyur par bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these, he is shown to be the best of teachers because he possesses the four qualities of knowing the commitments, etc.

original: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das gang na bzhugs zhes 'dir phyogs snga ma rtog pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor gyi gnas kyi nye bar dgod pa mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das gang na bzhugs zhes 'dir phyogs snga ma rtog pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor gyi gnas kyi nye bar dgod pa mdzad pa yin te /
translated: In what place does the Blessed One reside? Here, in order to imagine the opponent, he places the abode of yoga with the words “all the Tathāgatas reside,” etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bzhugs shing zhes bya ba ni bstan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bzhugs shing zhes bya ba ni bstan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “All the Tathāgatas reside” means “are taught.”

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs she na /
translated: Why do all the Tathāgatas reside?

original: gang gi phyir bsngags pa yin pa ste bkra shis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsngags pa yin pa ste bkra shis pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the praise, that is, the auspiciousness, is the meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa 'ba' zhig tu 'ang ma zad kyi bstod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs pa 'ba' zhig tu 'ang ma zad kyi bstod pa yang yin te /
translated: Not only do all the Tathagatas dwell, but they are also praised.

original: bstod pa ni de rnams dang lha gzhan rnams kyis kyang bstod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa ni de rnams dang lha gzhan rnams kyis kyang bstod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The praise is that they are praised by those and other gods.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad @6a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad @6a * //
translated: All the Tathagatas

original: bzhugs shing bsngags pa dang / bstod pa 'ba' zhig tu'ang ma zad kyi nor bu dang rin po che chen pos spras pa yang yin te /
analyzed: bzhugs shing bsngags pa dang / bstod pa 'ba' zhig tu'ang ma zad kyi nor bu dang rin po che chen pos spras pa yang yin te /
translated: dwell and are praised, and not only that, but they are also adorned with jewels and great jewels.

original: nor bu dang rin po che rnams ni nor bu dang rin po che'o //
analyzed: nor bu dang rin po che rnams ni nor bu dang rin po che'o //
translated: The jewels and great jewels are the jewels and great jewels.

original: nor bu dang rin po che yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na nor bu dang rin po che chen po ste /
analyzed: nor bu dang rin po che yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na nor bu dang rin po che chen po ste /
translated: Since they are jewels and great jewels, they are the jewels and great jewels.

original: des spras pa ni brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des spras pa ni brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Adorned with them is the meaning of “ornamented.”

original: nor bu dang rin po che chen pos spras pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi kha dog sna tshogs shing dril bu btags pa dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / rnga ma dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pa dang /
analyzed: nor bu dang rin po che chen pos spras pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi kha dog sna tshogs shing dril bu btags pa dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / rnga ma dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pa dang /
translated: The palace is not only adorned with jewels and precious stones, but also with various colors, with banners, with streamers, with flower garlands, with yak tails, with nets, with half-nets,

original: zla ba rlung gis bskyod pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: zla ba rlung gis bskyod pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa yang yin te /
translated: and with moons moved by the wind.

original: kha dog sna tshogs pa ni tshon sna brgyas spel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshogs pa ni tshon sna brgyas spel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Various colors, because it is variegated with a hundred colors.

original: dril bu ni btags pa'o //
analyzed: dril bu ni btags pa'o //
translated: Banners, because they are hung.

original: me tog gi phreng ba ni me tog brgyus pa las phreng ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: me tog gi phreng ba ni me tog brgyus pa las phreng ba byas pa'o //
translated: Flower garlands, because they are made of strings of flowers.

original: rnga ma ni rnga yab po //🔽dra ba ni mu tig gi chun 'phyang ste mchog dbus na yod pa'o //
analyzed: rnga ma ni rnga yab po // dra ba ni mu tig gi chun 'phyang ste mchog dbus na yod pa'o //
translated: Yak tails, because they are yak tails.🔽Nets, because they are pearl strings, and they are in the middle.

original: dra ba phyed pa ni mchog mtha' na yod pa'o //
analyzed: dra ba phyed pa ni mchog mtha' na yod pa'o //
translated: Half-nets, because they are pearl strings, and they are at the ends.

original: glegs bam la la las ni zla ba zhes smos pa ni me long ste 'di rnams ni gnyis kyis mdor bsdus pas mtshams sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: glegs bam la la las ni zla ba zhes smos pa ni me long ste 'di rnams ni gnyis kyis mdor bsdus pas mtshams sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In some scriptures, “moons” is mentioned, which means mirrors. These are connected in pairs.

original: de dag rlung gis bskyod pa ni rlung gis g-yo bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rlung gis bskyod pa ni rlung gis g-yo bar byas pa ste /
translated: They are moved by the wind, i.e., they are moved by the wind.

original: de rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa ste dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang ; rnga ma dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pa dang / zla ba dag gis nye bar mdzes par byas shing brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa ste dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang ; rnga ma dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pa dang / zla ba dag gis nye bar mdzes par byas shing brgyan pa'o //
translated: They are beautified by them, i.e., they are beautified and adorned by the cloth, banners, flower garlands, tails, nets, half-nets, and moons.

original: de bas na kha dog sna tshogs shing dril bu btags pa dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / rnga ma dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pa dang / zla ba rlung gis bskyod pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na kha dog sna tshogs shing dril bu btags pa dar dang / 'phan dang / me tog gi phreng ba dang / rnga ma dang / dra ba dang / dra ba phyed pa dang / zla ba rlung gis bskyod pa rnams kyis mdzes par byas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be beautified by the various colors, the cloth, banners, flower garlands, tails, nets, half-nets, and moons moved by the wind.

original: de ltar gyur pa gnas gang na bzhugs she na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa gnas gang na bzhugs she na /
translated: In what place do they exist?

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show that, it says in the palace of the king of the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: lha rnams kyi rgyal po yin pas na lha'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: lha rnams kyi rgyal po yin pas na lha'i rgyal po'o //
translated: Because he is the king of the gods, he is the king of the gods.

original: 'og min yang yin la lha'i rgyal po yang yin pas na 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po ste /
analyzed: 'og min yang yin la lha'i rgyal po yang yin pas na 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po ste /
translated: Since he is both Akaniṣṭha and a king of gods, he is the king of gods of Akaniṣṭha.

original: sa 'og min pa'i lha rnams kyi thu bor gyur pas na 'og min te thams cad kyi thu bor gyur pa'i lha'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa 'og min pa'i lha rnams kyi thu bor gyur pas na 'og min te thams cad kyi thu bor gyur pa'i lha'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since he is the chief of the gods of the Akaniṣṭha realm, he is Akaniṣṭha. The meaning is that he is the king of gods who is the chief of all.

original: de'i gnas ni gzhal yas khang ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas ni gzhal yas khang ste /
translated: His abode is the immeasurable palace.

original: khyad par de lta bu'i lha'i rgyal po'i gnas de na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad rnam pa de lta bus @6b bzhugs te gnas par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par de lta bu'i lha'i rgyal po'i gnas de na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad rnam pa de lta bus @6b bzhugs te gnas par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Vairocana abides in that abode of the king of gods, which has such distinctions.

original: tshig de rnams kyis ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de rnams kyis ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these words, the perfection of abode is taught.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang gnas de lta bu na /
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par de lta bu dang gnas de lta bu na /
translated: In such a place, with such qualities,

original: 'khor ji lta bu dang bzhugs zhes 'di ltar phyogs snga ma rtog pa la byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'khor ji lta bu dang bzhugs zhes 'di ltar phyogs snga ma rtog pa la byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: with what kind of retinue does he abide? Thus, in the opponent's view, it is said that there are 990 million bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is shown.

original: bcom ldan 'das de'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ni byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu mnga'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ni byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu mnga'o //
translated: The retinue of that Bhagavat consisted of ninety-nine hundred thousand million bodhisattvas.

original: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de rnams de ltar rgya che ba de ni ci byang chub sems dpa' gtso bor gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod dam /
analyzed: 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de rnams de ltar rgya che ba de ni ci byang chub sems dpa' gtso bor gyur pa 'ga' zhig yod dam /
translated: If that retinue circle is so vast, then is there some chief bodhisattva there?

original: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Or is there not?

original: rtog pa de bsal ba'i phyir 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtog pa de bsal ba'i phyir 'di lta ste /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi, and so on.🔽As for bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang la yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' ste /
translated: one who has that is a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes can yin la der sems dpa' ni yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni zad la mi skye ba'i ye shes can yin la der sems dpa' ni yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Awakening is the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising, and the hero there is mental activity,

original: de thob par 'dun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de thob par 'dun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: which means aspiring to attain that.

original: yang na byang chub dang sems can la dmigs pas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: yang na byang chub dang sems can la dmigs pas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: Or, bodhisattva is because it focuses on awakening and sentient beings.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: byang chub mngon par rtogs nas sems can rnams 'khor ba'i btson ra las gdon par bya'o zhes gang la de lta bu'i sems yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub mngon par rtogs nas sems can rnams 'khor ba'i btson ra las gdon par bya'o zhes gang la de lta bu'i sems yod pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: One who has the thought, “Having realized enlightenment, I will liberate sentient beings from the prison of cyclic existence,” is a bodhisattva.🔽Or,

original: yang na // bdud rtsi thob phyir lam ni 'di ma yin //
analyzed: yang na // bdud rtsi thob phyir lam ni 'di ma yin //
translated: This is not the path to attain immortality.

original: lta ngan spongs la lam la mnos shig ces //
analyzed: lta ngan spongs la lam la mnos shig ces //
translated: Abandon bad views and enter the path.

original: lta ngan sems can mthong nas go 'byed de //
analyzed: lta ngan sems can mthong nas go 'byed de //
translated: Seeing sentient beings with bad views, he opens the way.

original: rgyu des byang chub sems dpa' zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu des byang chub sems dpa' zhes bshad do //
translated: For that reason, he is explained as a bodhisattva.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pas bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained by the verse.

original: phyag na rdo rje mnga' bas na phyag na rdo rje ste /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje mnga' bas na phyag na rdo rje ste /
translated: He is Vajrapāṇi because he holds a vajra.

original: rdo rje ni 'dus byas kyi grong khyer thams cad gzhig par nus pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni 'dus byas kyi grong khyer thams cad gzhig par nus pa'i stong pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The vajra is the wisdom of emptiness, which is able to destroy the city of all conditioned things.

original: de yang 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa'i mdo las /
translated: And that is in the noble Array of Stalks Sūtra.

original: 'phags pa nor bzangs kyis 'phags pa 'jam dpal la gang gsol ba btab pa lta bu /
analyzed: 'phags pa nor bzangs kyis 'phags pa 'jam dpal la gang gsol ba btab pa lta bu /
translated: It is like what the noble Sudhana requested of the noble Mañjuśrī.

original: bskal ba du mar mang du bslabs pa yi //
analyzed: bskal ba du mar mang du bslabs pa yi //
translated: For many eons, you have trained extensively

original: rgyud dang rig pa'i tshul dang sa la mkhas //
analyzed: rgyud dang rig pa'i tshul dang sa la mkhas //
translated: In the ways of tantra, knowledge, and the stages of awakening.

original: gang gis 'du byed grong khyer rnam 'jig pa'i //
analyzed: gang gis 'du byed grong khyer rnam 'jig pa'i //
translated: You who destroy the city of conditioned existence,

original: rdo rje ye shes can de 'phags bdag gsol //
analyzed: rdo rje ye shes can de 'phags bdag gsol //
translated: O Vajra Wisdom, I supplicate you, noble one.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽kun du spyan @7a * //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa lta bu'o // kun du spyan @7a * //
translated: This is stated in verse.🔽Avalokiteśvara

original: ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug dang zhes bya ba la kun du spyan ras gzigs pa ni rtog par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: ras gzigs kyi dbang phyug dang zhes bya ba la kun du spyan ras gzigs pa ni rtog par mdzad pa ste /
translated: means the lord who sees everywhere. He sees by contemplating,

original: sems can rnams smin pa dang grol ba dang / 'dod chags kyi de kho na nyid la gzigs pa dang / chags su zin kyang thugs rje chen po nyid kyi nyes pas ma gos pa dang ; 'jigs pa chen po brgyad kyis nyen pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can gyi khams la gzigs pa ste 'di dag gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams smin pa dang grol ba dang / 'dod chags kyi de kho na nyid la gzigs pa dang / chags su zin kyang thugs rje chen po nyid kyi nyes pas ma gos pa dang ; 'jigs pa chen po brgyad kyis nyen pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sems can gyi khams la gzigs pa ste 'di dag gzigs pa'o //
translated: seeing sentient beings to be ripened and liberated, seeing the reality of attachment, seeing that even when attached, one is not tainted by the faults of great compassion, and seeing the realm of sentient beings who are afflicted by the eight great fears.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di la dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di la dbang phyug ste /
translated: He is the lord of this samādhi.

original: gtso bo de dang bdag por gyur pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ste de dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' nyid kyi snying po yod pa ste /
analyzed: gtso bo de dang bdag por gyur pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ste de dang / nam mkha'i snying po dang zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' nyid kyi snying po yod pa ste /
translated: Akasa-garbha, because he has the essence of space itself.

original: snying po ni skye ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: snying po ni skye ba'i gnas so //
translated: Essence means the place of birth.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / mngal gyi gnas las rgyab tu phyogs par smon lam gyi dbang gis nam mkha'i phyogs na kun du spyod pa'i rdul phra rab la brten nas rdzus te skyes pa'i lus mngon par sgrub pas na nam mkha'i snying po'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / mngal gyi gnas las rgyab tu phyogs par smon lam gyi dbang gis nam mkha'i phyogs na kun du spyod pa'i rdul phra rab la brten nas rdzus te skyes pa'i lus mngon par sgrub pas na nam mkha'i snying po'o //
translated: Because of the extreme purity of morality and the power of the vow to turn away from the womb, he manifests a body born by spontaneous generation in the realm of space, based on subtle particles of the realm of space.

original: gang yang nam mkha' las byung ba'i nor bu rin po che las /
analyzed: gang yang nam mkha' las byung ba'i nor bu rin po che las /
translated: And also, from the precious jewel that arises from space,

original: rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis skyes pa de'i mtshan nyid ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //🔽rdo rje khu tshur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi stobs kyis skyes pa de'i mtshan nyid ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o // rdo rje khu tshur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the characteristics of that which is born by the power of yoga will be explained below.🔽Vajra-hasta,

original: sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje rnams //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs ni rdo rje rnams //
translated: the vajra of body, speech, and mind,

original: bsdus pas khu tshur zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bsdus pas khu tshur zhes bshad do //
translated: It is called the vajra fist because it is a fist that is not dispersed.

original: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gang rab tu grags pa de ni rdo rje khu tshur zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gang rab tu grags pa de ni rdo rje khu tshur zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is renowned for having cultivated the meditative absorption called the vajra fist is called the vajra fist.

original: sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'i rjes thogs la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir dang / legs par bsgoms pas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dkyil 'khor ston par mdzad de spyod pa'i thugs gang la mnga' ba de ni sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa'i rjes thogs la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir dang / legs par bsgoms pas ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i dkyil 'khor ston par mdzad de spyod pa'i thugs gang la mnga' ba de ni sems bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: The one who is called the dharmacakravartin because he has the nature of turning the wheel of the Dharma immediately after generating the mind of enlightenment and because he displays the maṇḍala as desired through proper cultivation is the one who has the mind of conduct. He is called the dharmacakravartin because he generates the mind of enlightenment.

original: nam mkha'i mdzod dang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang ; sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa rnams nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs par mdzad pas na gang gis de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom par byas pa de ni nam mkha' mdzod do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mdzod dang zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang ; sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa rnams nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs par mdzad pas na gang gis de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom par byas pa de ni nam mkha' mdzod do //
translated: The one called “Akasa-garbha” is so called because he fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings and perfects the offerings to the Buddhas by means of the “Akasa-garbha” concentration.🔽Akasa is the “garbha” or “womb” because it is the container of all things.

original: nam mkha' nyid mdzod yin pas na nam mkha' mdzod de /🔽nam mkha' ni go 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid mdzod yin pas na nam mkha' mdzod de / nam mkha' ni go 'byed pa'o //
translated: Akasa is the container of all things.

original: mdzod ni rdzas kyi @7b gnas so //
analyzed: mdzod ni rdzas kyi @7b gnas so //
translated: The “garbha” is the place of the accumulation of things.

original: bdud kyi stobs thams cad rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi stobs thams cad rab tu 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one called “Destroyer of all the power of Mara” is so called because he has the nature of utterly destroying and annihilating all the power of Mara.

original: bdud kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na bdud thams cad do //
analyzed: bdud kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na bdud thams cad do //
translated: Mara is the same as all, thus it is all Mara.

original: de rnams kyi stobs ni bdud thams cad kyi stobs so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi stobs ni bdud thams cad kyi stobs so //
translated: The power of that is the power of all Mara.

original: de shin tu 'joms shing tshar gcod pa'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na bdud thams cad kyi stobs rab tu 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: de shin tu 'joms shing tshar gcod pa'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na bdud thams cad kyi stobs rab tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: He utterly destroys that, thus he is the destroyer of all the power of Mara.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa nyid de ltar snang ba yin no snyam du shes nas stong pa nyid so sor rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad nges par bzlog par nus pa'i thabs dang yang dag par ldan pa'i rdo rje khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin de
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa nyid de ltar snang ba yin no snyam du shes nas stong pa nyid so sor rtogs pas rnam par rtog pa thams cad nges par bzlog par nus pa'i thabs dang yang dag par ldan pa'i rdo rje khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin de
translated: That vajra wrathful meditative stabilization, which is endowed with the method of thoroughly cultivating suchness,

original: lta bu gang gis shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa de ni bdud thams cad kyi stobs rab tu 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: lta bu gang gis shin tu yongs su bsgoms pa de ni bdud thams cad kyi stobs rab tu 'joms pa'o //
translated: is the one that completely conquers the power of all demons.🔽Those beginning with them refers to those bodhisattvas who are beginning with them.

original: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de rnams ni de dag la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa de rnams ni de dag la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those bodhisattvas are the ones beginning with them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bye ba phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu rnams kyis so //
translated: Those beginning with them are the ninety-nine times ten million bodhisattvas.

original: ci byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gis yongs su bskor nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de na bzhugs sam 'on te gzhan dag gis kyang yongs su bskor zhes rtog pa la gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang zhes bya🔽ba smos te /
analyzed: ci byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gis yongs su bskor nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de na bzhugs sam 'on te gzhan dag gis kyang yongs su bskor zhes rtog pa la gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says, “He is surrounded by tathagatas equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River.”

original: gang+g'a dang klung ni gang+g'a'i klung ste /
analyzed: gang+g'a dang klung ni gang+g'a'i klung ste /
translated: The Ganges River is the river Ganges.

original: de rnams kyi bye ma ni gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi bye ma ni gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma ste /
translated: The grains of sand in it are the grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: de snyed kyi zhes pa grangs de snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bskor ba ste /
analyzed: de snyed kyi zhes pa grangs de snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pas yongs su bskor ba ste /
translated: He is surrounded by tathagatas equal to that number.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas su /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas su /
translated: In the yoga of Vairochana,

original: der gang 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed pa'ang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: der gang 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed pa'ang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: all the tathagatas of the past have fully become buddhas.

original: de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid mtshungs pa nyid dang / don gyi bya ba gcig mdzad pas der gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skus 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad ngo bo nyid mtshungs pa nyid dang / don gyi bya ba gcig mdzad pas der gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skus 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs so //
translated: All of them are the same in their nature, and they abide as long as cyclic existence lasts with a body that has the characteristic of a complete transformation, since they perform the same benefit.

original: ji skad du /🔽skra tsam khyon la sangs rgyas mang po ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / skra tsam khyon la sangs rgyas mang po ni //
translated: As it is said:🔽Many buddhas, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,

original: gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa //
analyzed: gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed pa //
translated: in the space of a single hair’s breadth,

original: rgyal ba de rnams zhing yang de snyed kyi //
analyzed: rgyal ba de rnams zhing yang de snyed kyi //
translated: those victors and their realms,

original: de yang mtshan nyid skal pa mi mnyam bcas //
analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid skal pa mi mnyam bcas //
translated: all of the same character, are not the same in fortune.

original: skra tsam khyon 'dir 'gro ba lngar gtogs pa //
analyzed: skra tsam khyon 'dir 'gro ba lngar gtogs pa //
translated: In the space of a single hair’s breadth, all five types of beings,🔽hell beings, animals,

original: dmyal ba rnams dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba dang // gshin rje'i 'jig rten lha dang mi rnams kyang //
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams dang dud 'gro'i 'gro ba dang // gshin rje'i 'jig rten lha dang mi rnams kyang //
translated: the world of Yama, gods, and humans,

original: dogs pa dag dang nye ba 'dzer ba'ang med //
analyzed: dogs pa dag dang nye ba 'dzer ba'ang med //
translated: are without doubt and without confusion.

original: de ltar rgyal ba'i chos ni bsam mi khyab //🔽ces gsungs pa'i @8a * //
analyzed: de ltar rgyal ba'i chos ni bsam mi khyab // ces gsungs pa'i @8a * //
translated: Thus the Dharma of the victors is inconceivable.

original: phyir ro // gang+g'a'i klung smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zad de /
analyzed: phyir ro // gang+g'a'i klung smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zad de /
translated: The mention of the Ganges is just an illustration.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pas bskor bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pas bskor bar snang ngo //
translated: In it, the Tathagatas appear surrounded by countless ones like themselves.

original: 'og min gyi gnas de de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyis yongs su gang ba ji lta bur snang zhes phyogs snga ma rtog pa la dpe bstan pa'i phyir de yang 'di ltar 'dzam bu'i gling na til gyi gang bu bzhin du kun du gang bar snang ngo
analyzed: 'og min gyi gnas de de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyis yongs su gang ba ji lta bur snang zhes phyogs snga ma rtog pa la dpe bstan pa'i phyir de yang 'di ltar 'dzam bu'i gling na til gyi gang bu bzhin du kun du gang bar snang ngo
translated: In that Akanistha realm, the Tathagatas appear to be completely filled, like a bamboo grove or a millet field.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
