analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to illustrate this, it is said:🔽“It appears as if the realm of Akanistha is completely filled with them, like a bamboo grove or a millet field.”

original: ci de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams 'ba' zhig gis yongs su gang bar kun du snang ngam /
analyzed: ci de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams 'ba' zhig gis yongs su gang bar kun du snang ngam /
translated: Do those Tathagatas appear to be completely filled with themselves alone?

original: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it not so?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi sku re re las kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med cing grangs med pa dag rnal 'byor pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams kyi sku re re las kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med cing grangs med pa dag rnal 'byor pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: “From each of the bodies of those Tathagatas, countless and limitless Buddha-fields appear to the yogis and Bodhisattvas.”

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang dang gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang yongs su sbyangs pa de dang de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku la sangs rgyas kyi zhing de so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang dang gang gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang yongs su sbyangs pa de dang de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku la sangs rgyas kyi zhing de so sor snang ngo //
translated: In the body of that Tathagata appears the Buddha-field which he purified when he practiced the Bodhisattva-conduct.

original: gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i tshul 'di nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang der 'di dag thams cad 'chad do //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i tshul 'di nyid kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dang der 'di dag thams cad 'chad do //
translated: And in that Buddha-field, he teaches this very method of Mantra practice.

original: de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i tshul 'di rjes su gnang ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang sngags kyi spyod pa'i tshul 'di rjes su gnang ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: They show that this method of Mantra practice of all the Tathagatas is approved.

original: de ltar re zhig bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na ji skad bshad pa'i 'khor gyi khyad par dang ldan par bzhugs pa yin no zhes shes so /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa'i 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na ji skad bshad pa'i 'khor gyi khyad par dang ldan par bzhugs pa yin no zhes shes so /
translated: Thus, the Lord Vairocana, endowed with such qualities, resides in the abode of the Akanishtha king of gods, together with the special retinue as explained above.

original: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po gang na bzhugs zhes rnam par rtog pa la /
analyzed: // / de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po gang na bzhugs zhes rnam par rtog pa la /
translated: Then, in order to think about where the Bhagavat Mahāvairocana resides,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis ston pa yin no //
translated: the remaining text teaches, “Then the Bhagavat Mahāvairocana resides in the heart of all tathāgatas.”

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag pa'o //
translated: The word “then” means immediately after.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The Bhagavat has been explained.

original: rnam par snang mdzad dang rnam par snang mdzad chen po la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod pa mi shes pas de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad dang rnam par snang mdzad chen po la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod pa mi shes pas de brjod par bya ste /
translated: Since it is not known what the difference is between Vairocana and Mahāvairocana, that should be stated.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ni gzugs kyi sku ste /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ni gzugs kyi sku ste /
translated: Vairocana is the form body.

original: rgyu mthun pa gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can du 'og min lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na de lha'i rigs @8b kyi nang du skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos kyi longs spyod kyi dga' ba nyams su myang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par byang🔽chub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rim gyis rnam par smin pa'i sku brjes nas rgyu mthun pa'i ye shes yongs su dag pa so sor snang ba'i mtshan nyid can gnas de nyid na yongs su bskor bar ston pa gad yin pa de la ni rnam par snang mdzad
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can du 'og min lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na de lha'i rigs @8b kyi nang du skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos kyi longs spyod kyi dga' ba nyams su myang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par byang chub pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rim gyis rnam par smin pa'i sku brjes nas rgyu mthun pa'i ye shes yongs su dag pa so sor snang ba'i mtshan nyid can gnas de nyid na yongs su bskor bar ston pa gad yin pa de la ni rnam par snang mdzad
translated: The enjoyment body has the characteristic of being the natural outflow of the transformation of the basis and in Akaniṣhṭha, the abode of the king of the gods, it is taught that in order for bodhisattvas born in the class of gods to experience the joy of the enjoyment of Dharma, the enjoyment body🔽manifests through the concentration of enlightenment.

original: ces bya ba'i sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i sgrar bshad de /
translated: The enjoyment body is explained to be Vairochana.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: gtsang ma gnas ni rnam spangs shing //
analyzed: gtsang ma gnas ni rnam spangs shing //
translated: Abandoning the abode of purity,

original: 'og min gnas ni nyams dga' bar //
analyzed: 'og min gnas ni nyams dga' bar //
translated: in the delightful abode of Akaniṣhṭha,

original: yang dag sangs rgyas der sangs rgyas //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas der sangs rgyas //
translated: the perfect Buddha became a Buddha.

original: sprul pa dag ni 'dir sangs rgyas //
analyzed: sprul pa dag ni 'dir sangs rgyas //
translated: The emanations became Buddhas here.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus he speaks in verse.

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni ye shes kyi rang bzhin can te /
translated: Mahāvairocana is of the nature of intuition,

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las shin tu rnam par grol ba dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin so sor snang ba yang dag par ston par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las shin tu rnam par grol ba dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin so sor snang ba yang dag par ston par spyod pa'o //
translated: and is completely liberated from the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to the knowable. He manifests the individual appearances of the nature of all things.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las ji ltar na dngos po thams cad ston par spyod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid las ji ltar na dngos po thams cad ston par spyod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does this Bhagavat, from the nature of reality itself, manifest the nature of all things?

original: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad bzhin du rtag par bzhugs shing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad bzhin du rtag par bzhugs shing /
translated: Because he always abides like the realm of space,

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and because his body, speech, and mind are like vajras.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad ces bya ba ni nam mkha'i gtos ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad ces bya ba ni nam mkha'i gtos ma lus pa'o //
translated: The realm of space means the entire expanse of space.

original: der rtag par bzhugs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: der rtag par bzhugs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje gang yin pa ste /
translated: He always abides there with a body, speech, and mind that are like vajras.

original: stong pa nyid so sor thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid so sor thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: It is the realization of emptiness.

original: de yang gang gi phyir sa dang po la kun du 'gro ba'i stong pa nyid so sor rtogs te /
analyzed: de yang gang gi phyir sa dang po la kun du 'gro ba'i stong pa nyid so sor rtogs te /
translated: And that is because on the first stage, one realizes the all-pervading emptiness.

original: des na der gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis bzhugs pas so //
analyzed: des na der gzugs brnyan gyi tshul gyis bzhugs pas so //
translated: Therefore, he abides there in the manner of a reflection.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid de rgyu de nyid kyis na sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i de kho na nyid kyang tshad med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid de rgyu de nyid kyis na sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i de kho na nyid kyang tshad med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Likewise, this yogi is the very same as all the Tathagatas. For that very reason, the reality of the vajra body, speech, and mind is immeasurable.

original: 'dis kyang rtag tu bzhugs pa nyid du ston pa yin no /🔽// / da ni 'di de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig gi ngo bo nyid yin par ma zad kyi gzhan du na rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa
analyzed: 'dis kyang rtag tu bzhugs pa nyid du ston pa yin no / // / da ni 'di de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig gi ngo bo nyid yin par ma zad kyi gzhan du na rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa
translated: This also shows that he always abides.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: Now, in order to show that he is not only the nature of the Tathagatas, but also the nature of Vajrasattva, [the Bhagavān] declares, “entering into the sameness of all the Tathagatas,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //🔽de yang de bzhin gshegs pa @9a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor las gsungs pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so // de yang de bzhin gshegs pa @9a * //
translated: All tathāgatas are the buddhas and bodhisattvas taught in the Vajra Realm Mandala.

original: thams cad la kun nas snang ba'i tshul gyis 'jug cing song bas na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: thams cad la kun nas snang ba'i tshul gyis 'jug cing song bas na / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, since they engage and enter all tathāgatas in the manner of illuminating them,🔽they are the entry into the sameness of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa des de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya yang dag par thugs su chud pas rdo rje dbyings thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ye shes sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa des de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phyag rgya yang dag par thugs su chud pas rdo rje dbyings thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ye shes sems dpa' ste /
translated: Since they enter the sameness of all tathāgatas, they are the gnosis beings who comprehend the mudrā of all tathāgatas and the vajra realm of all tathāgatas.

original: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad sprul par spyod pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad sprul par spyod pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi sems dpa' ni rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “Vajrasattva” is that he is the being who is the essence of the gnosis that acts to emanate all the maṇḍalas of the vajra realm.

original: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po mchog tu dam tshig mkhyen pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po mchog tu dam tshig mkhyen pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This also shows that the Blessed One Mahāvairocana is the one who knows the supreme commitments.

original: rdo rje dbyings zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings zhes smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The term “vajra realm” is merely a term that illustrates.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'di ni shes bya'i dkyil 'khor ma lus par ston par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'di ni shes bya'i dkyil 'khor ma lus par ston par spyod pa yin te /
translated: This Blessed Vajrasattva is the one who acts to reveal the entire maṇḍala of objects of knowledge.

original: 'di yang 'og nas bshad pa'i gzhung gis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang 'og nas bshad pa'i gzhung gis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be shown by the text that will be explained below.

original: da ni 'di ni rdo rje rin chen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni 'di ni rdo rje rin chen gyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to show that he is also the essence of Vajraratna, [the Bhagavān] declares, “the entire realm of space,” and so on.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad do ;
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad do ;
translated: Since it is the realm of space and also everything, it is the entire realm of space.

original: / nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad de na rdul phra mo ji snyed yod pa de rnams kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs ni nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra mo'i rdo rje'i byin rlabs te /
analyzed: / nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad de na rdul phra mo ji snyed yod pa de rnams kyi rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs ni nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra mo'i rdo rje'i byin rlabs te /
translated: The blessing of the vajras in all the atoms in the entire realm of space is the blessing of the vajras in all the atoms of the entire realm of space.

original: re re zhing rdo rje'i gzugs su yongs su bsgyur ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: re re zhing rdo rje'i gzugs su yongs su bsgyur ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: The transformation of each into the form of a vajra is the blessing.

original: de las byung ba'i ye shes gang yin pa'i ye shes de ni nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra mo'i rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs las byung ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i ye shes gang yin pa'i ye shes de ni nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra mo'i rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs las byung ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The pristine consciousness that arises from that is the pristine consciousness that arises from the blessing of the vajras in all the atoms of the entire realm of space.

original: de nyid ni snying po ste skyed pa'i gnas gang yin pa de la nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra mo'i rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs las byung ba'i ye shes kyi snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni snying po ste skyed pa'i gnas gang yin pa de la nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra mo'i rdo rje'i byin gyi rlabs las byung ba'i ye shes kyi snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: That is the essence, the place of origin. That is called the essence of the wisdom born from the blessing of the atoms of all the realms of space.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de'i 'byung ba'i gnas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das de'i 'byung ba'i gnas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the place of origin of that Blessed One.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings la gnas pa'i rdul phra rab de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rdo rje gcig tu gyur la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings la gnas pa'i rdul phra rab de rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis rdo rje gcig tu gyur la /
translated: Those atoms located in the realm of space, by the blessing of the Blessed One Mahāvairocana, become one vajra.

original: de las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtha' yas pa'o //
analyzed: de las de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtha' yas pa'o //
translated: From that, there are infinite bodies of the Tathāgatas.

original: de rnams @9b kyang rdo rje rin po che 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de rnams @9b kyang rdo rje rin po che 'byung ngo //
translated: Those become the vajra jewels.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mtha' yas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mtha' yas pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said “by the infinity of all the Tathāgatas.”

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che las byung bas na rdo rje rin po che zhes bya ba ste 'dis kyang 'di'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che las byung bas na rdo rje rin po che zhes bya ba ste 'dis kyang 'di'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since it arises from the jewel of all the tathāgatas, it is called the vajra jewel. This also teaches its essence.

original: de ci'i phyir 'byung zhes phyogs snga ma rtog pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'byung zhes phyogs snga ma rtog pa la /
translated: Why does it arise?

original: rdo rje chen po'i ye shes dbang bskur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje chen po'i ye shes dbang bskur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to the former position, it is said, “because of the consecration of the gnosis of the great vajra.”

original: rdo rje yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na rdo rje chen po ste /
analyzed: rdo rje yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na rdo rje chen po ste /
translated: Since it is a vajra and it is great, it is the great vajra.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the great vajra because it pervades all things.

original: de nyid ni ye shes kyang yin pas na rdo rje chen po'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de nyid ni ye shes kyang yin pas na rdo rje chen po'i ye shes te /
translated: Since it is that and it is gnosis, it is the gnosis of the great vajra.

original: gang btags pa tsam du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi ye shes de ni rdo rje chen po'i ye shes te /
analyzed: gang btags pa tsam du rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi ye shes de ni rdo rje chen po'i ye shes te /
translated: The gnosis of emptiness that has the characteristic of realizing that all things are mere imputations is the gnosis of the great vajra.

original: de yod pa dang rdo rje chen po'i ye shes kyis dbang bskur bas na rdo rje chen po'i ye shes dbang bskur ba yin la de'i phyir rin po che yin pas na rdo rje chen po'i ye shes dbang bskur ba'i rin po che ste ;
analyzed: de yod pa dang rdo rje chen po'i ye shes kyis dbang bskur bas na rdo rje chen po'i ye shes dbang bskur ba yin la de'i phyir rin po che yin pas na rdo rje chen po'i ye shes dbang bskur ba'i rin po che ste ;
translated: Since he exists and is empowered by the gnosis of the great vajra, he is the empowerment of the gnosis of the great vajra.🔽Since he is a jewel, he is the jewel of the empowerment of the gnosis of the great vajra.

original: rdo rje chen po'i ye shes dbang bskur ba'i rin po che zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: rdo rje chen po'i ye shes dbang bskur ba'i rin po che zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: The term “jewel of the empowerment of the gnosis of the great vajra”

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rin chen nyid la bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rin chen nyid la bya bar bshad do //
translated: is explained as referring to the Bhagavān Vajraratna himself.

original: des na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi phyag rgyas khams gsum par chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba stsol bar mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: des na mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nyid kyi phyag rgyas khams gsum par chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba stsol bar mdzad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the tathāgatas who are fully, perfectly enlightened bestow the empowerment of the Dharma king of the three realms with their own seal.

original: 'dis kyang de'i phrin las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang de'i phrin las bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches his activity.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ji ltar rdo rje rin chen gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du rdo rje chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin no zhes gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das 'di ji ltar rdo rje rin chen gyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de bzhin du rdo rje chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin no zhes gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: Now, the remaining passages show that just as the Bhagavat is the nature of the vajra gem, so he is also the nature of the vajra Dharma.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyas pa ni khyab pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyas pa ni khyab pa ste /
translated: Pervading all realms of space is all-pervading.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: de bzhin nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis so //
translated: By suchness.

original: de bas na nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyas pa'i de bzhin nyid de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de bas na nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyas pa'i de bzhin nyid de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba'i stong pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Therefore, the suchness pervading all realms of space is emptiness free from apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: de'i ye shes yin pas na nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i ye shes yin pas na nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du rgyas pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Since that is the exalted wisdom, it is the exalted wisdom of suchness pervading all realms of space.

original: de nyid ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: That itself is the state of manifest, perfect buddhahood,

original: thugs su chud par bya ba yin la de'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: thugs su chud par bya ba yin la de'i mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par gyur pa ste /
translated: which is to be realized, and he has attained that manifest, perfect enlightenment.

original: de bas na 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje chos de'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin no //🔽da ni ngo bo nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la @10a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje chos de'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa yin no // da ni ngo bo nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la @10a * //
translated: Therefore, this shows the nature of the cause of that Blessed Vajradharma.

original: sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature, he says, “the purity of the nature of all tathāgatas,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid yin la /
translated: The nature of all tathāgatas is tathāgatahood.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri mas ma gos pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dri mas ma gos pa ste /
translated: Its purity is the absence of defilement by the stains of subject and object.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rnam par dag pa'i phyir te ;
translated: Since it is the nature of that, it is the purity of the nature of all tathāgatas.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pas na chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pas na chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of that, all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das de'i phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad kun kyang shin tu yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das de'i phyi dang nang gi chos thams cad kun kyang shin tu yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: All phenomena, both internal and external, of that Blessed One are completely pure.

original: de ltar de'i ngo bo nyid bstan nas de'i phrin las bstan par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i khams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar de'i ngo bo nyid bstan nas de'i phrin las bstan par bya ba'i phyir nam mkha'i khams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having thus taught its essence, in order to teach its activity, he says, knowing the display of all forms pervading the entire realm of space.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du khyab pa'i ngang tshul 'di la mnga' bas nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du khyab pa'i ngang tshul 'di la mnga' bas nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pa'o //
translated: Since he has mastery over the state of pervading the entire realm of space, he pervades the entire realm of space.

original: nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pa yang yin zhing gzugs thams cad ston pa po yang yin pa de mkhyen pas nam mkha'i khams thams cad du khyab pa'i gzugs thams cad du yang dag par bstan pa mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab pa yang yin zhing gzugs thams cad ston pa po yang yin pa de mkhyen pas nam mkha'i khams thams cad du khyab pa'i gzugs thams cad du yang dag par bstan pa mkhyen pa ste /
translated: Since he pervades the entire realm of space and is the one who displays all forms, he knows the display of all forms pervading the entire realm of space.

original: de'i ye shes des 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa rnams su sems can gyi khams lus pa med pa rnams 'dul ba ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du lung dang rigs pa la rab tu 'jog par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ye shes des 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa rnams su sems can gyi khams lus pa med pa rnams 'dul ba ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du lung dang rigs pa la rab tu 'jog par mdzad pa'o //
translated: By that knowledge, he disciplines the entire realm of sentient beings without exception in all the worlds without exception, establishing them in scripture and reasoning according to their fortune.

original: de nyid ni spyod pa yin pas na 'dul ba'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni spyod pa yin pas na 'dul ba'i spyod pa'o //
translated: Since that itself is conduct, it is the conduct of discipline.

original: de'i mchog ni gtso bo ste zla med pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: de'i mchog ni gtso bo ste zla med pa zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The best of those is the chief, which means “without a rival.”🔽Not only is this the reality of Vajradharma, but it is also the reality of Vajrakarma.

original: // /'di ni rdo rje chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan du na rdo rje las kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: // /'di ni rdo rje chos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan du na rdo rje las kyi ngo bo nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach this, he says, “all tathāgatas,” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' zhes bya ba lung don yod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' zhes bya ba lung don yod pa ste /
translated: The “word of all tathāgatas” is the meaningful scripture.

original: 'bras bu yod pa de byed pa'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' don yod par mdzad pa yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa de byed pa'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' don yod par mdzad pa yin la /
translated: Since he has the nature of producing that, which has a result, he is the one who makes the word of all tathāgatas meaningful.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' don yod par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' don yod par mdzad pa ste /
translated: His reality is the one who makes the word of all tathāgatas meaningful.

original: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ngo bo nyid ston to //
translated: This teaches his essence.

original: da ni thams cad dang mnyam pa med ces bya ba la sogs pas phrin las ston te /
analyzed: da ni thams cad dang mnyam pa med ces bya ba la sogs pas phrin las ston te /
translated: Now, in order to teach his activity, he says, “equal to all,” and so on.

original: thams cad ni 'gro ba rnams dang mtshungs pa med pas mnyam pa med pa'i de nyid kyis na 'di'i gong na yod pa ma yin pas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni 'gro ba rnams dang mtshungs pa med pas mnyam pa med pa'i de nyid kyis na 'di'i gong na yod pa ma yin pas bla na med pa'o //
translated: Since all are without equal to sentient beings, they are unequaled. Since there is nothing higher than that reality, it is unsurpassed.

original: thams cad de 'jig rten ma lus pa'i las phran tshegs @10b la sogs pa'i phrin las mdzad pas na thams cad mnyam pa med cing bla na med pa'i phrin las mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad de 'jig rten ma lus pa'i las phran tshegs @10b la sogs pa'i phrin las mdzad pas na thams cad mnyam pa med cing bla na med pa'i phrin las mdzad pa'o //
translated: All means that since all worlds perform the activity of minor deeds and so on, all perform unequaled and unsurpassed activity.

original: de ltar rtog pa'i khyad par gyis 'khor los sgyur ba bstan par mdzad nas /
analyzed: de ltar rtog pa'i khyad par gyis 'khor los sgyur ba bstan par mdzad nas /
translated: Having thus taught the cakravartin through the distinctions of the concepts,

original: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pas na rdo rje dbyings thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ye shes sems dpa' zhes ji skad du bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa byang chub kyi
analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pas na rdo rje dbyings thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ye shes sems dpa' zhes ji skad du bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa byang chub kyi
translated: now, since all vajra realms are penetrated by the gnosis being who is the mind of all tathāgatas, the entry into sameness with all tathāgatas is the bodhicitta of all tathāgatas.

original: sems kyi ngo bo nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub chen por sems brtan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo nyid de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub chen por sems brtan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The essence of mind is taught by “the firm thought of great enlightenment of all the Tathagatas” and so forth.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la ltos na byang chub chen po yin pas na byang chub chen po'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la ltos na byang chub chen po yin pas na byang chub chen po'o //
translated: It is great enlightenment because it is compared to the enlightenment of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la sems dpa' brtan pa ni bsam pa brtan pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems dpa' brtan pa ni bsam pa brtan pa ste /
translated: The firm thought is the firm intention.

original: de ni byang chub chen por sems dpa' brtan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub chen por sems dpa' brtan pa ste /
translated: It is the firm thought of great enlightenment.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means “Vajrasattva.”

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i sems so //
translated: This is the mind that is the place of birth in the Tathagata family.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la byang chub chen por sems dpa' brten pa yang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub chen por sems dpa' brten pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la byang chub chen por sems dpa' brten pa yang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub chen por sems dpa' brten pa ste /
translated: It is the firm thought of great enlightenment of all the Tathagatas because it is both all the Tathagatas and the firm thought of great enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bshad de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bshad de /
translated: Since it is the very essence of the minds of all tathāgatas, it is called “all tathāgatas.”

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the completely pure mind of enlightenment.

original: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa'i sngags kyi don bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje sems dpa'i sngags kyi don bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the meaning of the mantra of Vajrasattva,

original: rdo rje rgyal po'i sngags kyi don bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drangs pa'i dam tshig dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po'i sngags kyi don bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drangs pa'i dam tshig dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: in order to teach the meaning of the mantra of Vajrarāja, [the Bhagavān] declares, the pledge of inviting all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drang ba'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan pas spyan 'dren pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drang ba'i dam tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drang ba'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan pas spyan 'dren pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drang ba'i dam tshig ste /
translated: The pledge of inviting all tathāgatas is the invitation endowed with the mantra and the seal of inviting all tathāgatas.

original: dam tshig ni brda'i tshul lo //
analyzed: dam tshig ni brda'i tshul lo //
translated: A pledge is a symbolic method.

original: 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdu ba dang / byin gyis brlab par bya'i /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bsdu ba dang / byin gyis brlab par bya'i /
translated: By this alone, all tathāgatas are summoned and blessed,

original: gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no ;
translated: but not by others.

original: /'dis ni rdo rje rgyal po'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: /'dis ni rdo rje rgyal po'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of Vajrarāja.

original: bsdus shing byin gyis brlabs pas spyan drangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par bya ba ni dgyes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsdus shing byin gyis brlabs pas spyan drangs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par bya ba ni dgyes par bya ba ste /
translated: The worship of all the tathāgatas who are invited and absorbed and blessed is the worship of all the tathāgatas.

original: de'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa'i ye shes @11a * //
analyzed: de'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa'i ye shes @11a * //
translated: The gnosis that is that is the gnosis that pleases all the tathāgatas.

original: so ; / de'i dbang phyug ni bdag por gyur cing mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don te de la ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa'i ye shes kyi dbang phyug ces bya'o //
analyzed: so ; / de'i dbang phyug ni bdag por gyur cing mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don te de la ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyes par byed pa'i ye shes kyi dbang phyug ces bya'o //
translated: The lord of that is the master, which means the expert. That is called the lord of the gnosis that pleases all the tathāgatas.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje chags pa'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje chags pa'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of Vajrarāga.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drangs shing mnyes par byas nas kyang byang chub kyi sems de legs so zhes bya ba'i rnam pas yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis legs so zhes bya ba dang zhes bya
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad spyan drangs shing mnyes par byas nas kyang byang chub kyi sems de legs so zhes bya ba'i rnam pas yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis legs so zhes bya ba dang zhes bya
translated: , it is said, “all the tathāgatas exclaim ‘Excellent!’”

original: ste / 'dis ni rdo rje legs pa'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ste / 'dis ni rdo rje legs pa'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of Vajra Sādhu.

original: rab tu mnyes par yang bstan cing legs so zhes yang dag par dga' bar byas nas byang chub kyi sems de chos kyi rgyal po rdo rje chen po'i ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba bla na med pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la stsol bar mdzad do
analyzed: rab tu mnyes par yang bstan cing legs so zhes yang dag par dga' bar byas nas byang chub kyi sems de chos kyi rgyal po rdo rje chen po'i ye shes kyi dbang bskur ba bla na med pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la stsol bar mdzad do
translated: In order to teach that it is also delighted and, having been delighted, it bestows the unsurpassable consecration of the gnosis of the great vajra of the Dharma King, the bodhicitta, upon all the tathāgatas,

original: zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rin po che'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, “all the tathāgatas’ jewel,” and so on.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad nyid 'ba' zhig gzung gi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad nyid 'ba' zhig gzung gi byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the term “all tathāgatas” refers only to the totality of tathāgatas, not to the bodhisattvas.

original: de bas na chen po zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chen po zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the term “great” is mentioned.

original: dbang chen po bskur ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa chen po bzhis gang dbang chen po bskur ba stsal ba de ni dbang chen po bskur ba'o //
analyzed: dbang chen po bskur ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa chen po bzhis gang dbang chen po bskur ba stsal ba de ni dbang chen po bskur ba'o //
translated: “Great consecration” means that which is conferred by the four great tathāgatas who are fully enlightened, and that is the great consecration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba yang 'di nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba yang 'di nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin te /
translated: The consecration of the bodhisattvas with the diadem of the five tathāgatas is also included in this.

original: rgyal po 'ong ngo zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar gtso bo smos pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po 'ong ngo zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar gtso bo smos pa yin te /
translated: Like saying “the king is coming,” the principal one is mentioned.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje rin chen gyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje rin chen gyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of the Vajra Jewel.

original: rgyal po'i bu dbang bskur ba thob pa dang 'dra bar gzi byin bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyi ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu dbang bskur ba thob pa dang 'dra bar gzi byin bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyi ma'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate the splendor of the consecration of a king's son, the phrase the sun of all the Tathagatas is stated.

original: 'dir yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig gzung ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba'i sgra ni de bzhin gshegs pa 'ba' zhig gzung ste /
translated: Here, the term all the Tathagatas refers only to the Tathagatas.🔽The sun of those is like the orb of the sun, which illuminates all things by its own light.

original: de rnams kyi nyi ma'i ngo bo nyid ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bur rang gi ye shes nyid kyis dngos po'i don thams cad gsal bar mdzad pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang 'dra bas na de bzhin @11b gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyi ma'i 'od kyi dkyil
analyzed: de rnams kyi nyi ma'i ngo bo nyid ni nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bur rang gi ye shes nyid kyis dngos po'i don thams cad gsal bar mdzad pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang 'dra bas na de bzhin @11b gshegs pa thams cad kyi nyi ma'i 'od kyi dkyil
translated: The orb of the sun of all the Tathagatas is like that.

original: 'khor te / 'di nyid kyis ni rdo rje gzi brjid kyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor te / 'di nyid kyis ni rdo rje gzi brjid kyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This very [phrase] teaches the meaning of the mantra of Vajra Tejas.

original: dbang bskur ba dang gzi byin thob pa ni nges par na rgyal po'i mtshan mas gnas par bya dgos pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba dang gzi byin thob pa ni nges par na rgyal po'i mtshan mas gnas par bya dgos pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “the wish-fulfilling jewel of all the tathagatas,” and so on.

original: gzi byin thob pa rnams ni bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po'i mtshan ma yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng bar bya ba yin pas na de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gzi byin thob pa rnams ni bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po'i mtshan ma yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng bar bya ba yin pas na de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those who obtain splendor are raised up with the insignia of the unsurpassed Dharma king, the banner of the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: bsam pa'i rgyal po yin pas na yid bzhin gyi rgyal po ste bsams pa tsam gyis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa'i rgyal po yin pas na yid bzhin gyi rgyal po ste bsams pa tsam gyis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Since it is the king of wishes, it is the wish-fulfilling king. Since it fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings merely by being wished for, it is called that.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po yang yin la rin po che yang yin pas na de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal po yang yin la rin po che yang yin pas na de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Since it is the king of wish-fulfilling jewels and also a jewel, it is called that.

original: des nye bar mtshon pa'i dpal gyi mtshan ma ni yid bzhin nor bu'i rgyal po'i rin po che'i dpal zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des nye bar mtshon pa'i dpal gyi mtshan ma ni yid bzhin nor bu'i rgyal po'i rin po che'i dpal zhes bya ste /
translated: The glory sign illustrated by that is called the glory of the jewel king of wish-fulfilling gems.

original: 'dis ni rin chen dpal gyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rin chen dpal gyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of Ratnaprabha.

original: rgyal po'i mtshan ma bsgreng na chos kyi rgyal po de nyid kyi chos rnams la mnga' brnyes shing rab tu dga' ba'i khyad par shin tu yang skye ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i mtshan ma bsgreng na chos kyi rgyal po de nyid kyi chos rnams la mnga' brnyes shing rab tu dga' ba'i khyad par shin tu yang skye ste /
translated: When the king’s sign is raised, the Dharma King himself attains mastery over his own Dharma and gives rise to a special joy.

original: de bas na nyid kyi chos kyi yul la dgyes par yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhad mo bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na nyid kyi chos kyi yul la dgyes par yang dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bzhad mo bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate his delight in his own Dharma realm, the text says “the laughter of all the Tathāgatas” and so on.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje bzhad pa'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje bzhad pa'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of Vajrahasita.

original: dga' ba rgyas shing mnyam par bzhag pa'i dbang gis chos thams cad la lta ba shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dag pa'i chos chen po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dga' ba rgyas shing mnyam par bzhag pa'i dbang gis chos thams cad la lta ba shin tu rnam par dag par gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dag pa'i chos chen po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since the view of all phenomena becomes completely pure by the power of meditative equipoise with expansive joy, it is called the great pure Dharma of all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la dag pa'i chos kyang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la dag pa'i chos kyang yin te /
translated: All tathāgatas are also pure Dharma,

original: zab cing rgya che ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos chen po la mnyam par gzhag pa'i dbang gis dri ma med par 'gyur ba'i phyir dag pa'i chos chen po dang zhes bshad de /
analyzed: zab cing rgya che ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos chen po la mnyam par gzhag pa'i dbang gis dri ma med par 'gyur ba'i phyir dag pa'i chos chen po dang zhes bshad de /
translated: because the great Dharma of profound and vast nature becomes stainless by the power of meditative equipoise.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje chos kyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje chos kyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This explains the meaning of the mantra of Vajradharma.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab che zhing de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes chen po thogs pa med par 'jug pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab chen po'i ye shes dang zhes🔽bya ba @12a * //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid shes rab che zhing de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i ye shes chen po thogs pa med par 'jug pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi shes rab chen po'i ye shes dang zhes bya ba @12a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the great wisdom intuition of all the Tathāgatas.”

original: smos so // shes rab dang ye shes ni shes rab ye shes te /
analyzed: smos so // shes rab dang ye shes ni shes rab ye shes te /
translated: Wisdom and intuition are wisdom intuition.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje rnon po'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje rnon po'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of the Vajra Sharpness.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi ye shes kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chud nas 'di dag ni rnam par rtog pa tsam la rag las so snyam ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi ye shes kyis chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med par thugs su chud nas 'di dag ni rnam par rtog pa tsam la rag las so snyam ste /
translated: By the intuition of the mind of meditative equipoise, having realized that all phenomena are essenceless, thinking that they are dependent on mere conceptualization,🔽he emits the emanation of the wheel of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi 'khor lo sprul pa 'byin par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'khor lo sprul pa 'byin par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the wheel of all the Tathāgatas.”

original: 'dis ni rdo rje rgyu'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje rgyu'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of the Vajra Cause.

original: de ltar 'khor lo'i sprul pa byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor lo'i sprul pa byas nas /
translated: Having thus emanated the wheel,🔽in order to explain the emanation as an esoteric instruction, it says

original: ji ltar sprul pa man ngag tu bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dgongs pa 'chad pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa man ngag tu bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dgongs pa 'chad pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the explanation of the transcendent state of all tathāgatas.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i gdul bya'i skye bo rnams kyi phyir /
translated: Thus, for the sake of the beings to be tamed who are taught in that way,

original: bkri ba'i don gyi tshig ni /
analyzed: bkri ba'i don gyi tshig ni /
translated: the words of provisional meaning

original: dgongs pa 'chad pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'chad pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad de /
translated: are explained with the term explanation of the transcendent state.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje smra ba'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje smra ba'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This explains the meaning of the mantra of Vajra Speech.

original: de ltar chos rnam par dag pa'i las rnam par dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnam par dag pa'i las rnam par dag par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In that way, in order to teach the pure activity of pure phenomena,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdon mi za bar thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdon mi za bar thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it says the activity of all tathāgatas that is definitely necessary for all.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdon mi za zhing don yod pa thams cad de sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa'i dgos pa sgrub par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdon mi za bar thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba ste
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdon mi za zhing don yod pa thams cad de sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa'i dgos pa sgrub par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdon mi za bar thams cad kyi dgos pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba ste
translated: Since he accomplishes the aims of all, the various aspects of all the Tathagatas' unfailing and meaningful activities, he is called the one who accomplishes the aims of all the Tathagatas without fail.

original: / 'dis ni rdo rje las kyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / 'dis ni rdo rje las kyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows the meaning of the mantra of Vajra Karma.

original: las la rab tu zhugs pa rnams la le los kyang bar du gcod pa'i gnod pa byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las la rab tu zhugs pa rnams la le los kyang bar du gcod pa'i gnod pa byed par 'gyur te /
translated: For those who are engaged in activities, laziness also creates obstacles and harms them.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus chen po'i go cha shin tu brtan po dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus chen po'i go cha shin tu brtan po dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, the great armor of the diligence of all the Tathagatas is very firm.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus chen po ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la spro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus chen po ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la spro ba'o //
translated: The great diligence of all the Tathagatas is the enthusiasm for accomplishing the perfection of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: 'di nyid ni shin tu brtan pa'i go cha yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus chen po'i go cha shin tu brtan po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni shin tu brtan pa'i go cha yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi brtson 'grus chen po'i go cha shin tu brtan po zhes bya ste /
translated: Since this is the armor of great stability, it is called the armor of great effort of all the tathagatas, which is very stable.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje bsrung ba'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje bsrung ba'i sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of Vajravarada.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la yongs su zhugs pa'i sems can @12b rnams la rang gi rgyud las tha dad pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gis kyang bar du gcod par byed cing mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pas gnod par byed pa dag kyang yod pas🔽de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis srung zhing skyob pa'i gnod sbyin dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la yongs su zhugs pa'i sems can @12b rnams la rang gi rgyud las tha dad pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gis kyang bar du gcod par byed cing mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pas gnod par byed pa dag kyang yod pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis srung zhing skyob pa'i gnod sbyin dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: There are sentient beings who have entered the accumulations of merit and wisdom, but they are harmed by obstacles and adverse conditions, even by some difference in their own mindstreams.🔽Therefore, it says, “the yakshas who protect and guard all the tathagatas.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis srung ba yin pas na srung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis srung ba yin pas na srung ba ste /
translated: Since they are protected by all the tathagatas, they are protectors.

original: rgyud tha dad pa las byung ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba bzlog cing srung ba dang / rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba bzlog pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgo nas kyang de'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan pas sems can thams cad srung zhing yongs su skyong ba ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi
analyzed: rgyud tha dad pa las byung ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba bzlog cing srung ba dang / rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i nye bar 'tshe ba bzlog pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgo nas kyang de'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan pas sems can thams cad srung zhing yongs su skyong ba ni mi phyed pas na rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi
translated: The protection and guarding of all sentient beings by all the Tathagatas through the mantra and seal of Vajrayaksa is for the sake of warding off the harm that arises from different continua and for the sake of warding off the harm that arises from one’s own continuum.

original: dam tshig gi ngo bo nyid kyi sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi ngo bo nyid kyi sems dpa' ste /
translated: The being who is the essence of the commitment is Vajrayaksa,

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bsrung zhing skyob pa ste gnod sbyin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bsrung zhing skyob pa ste gnod sbyin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: because he is the one who protects and guards the Bhagavat himself through all the Tathagatas, and is called Yaksa.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This explains the meaning of the mantra of Vajrayaksa.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid ni mi phyed pa yin pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs nyid ni mi phyed pa yin pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: Vajra is the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas, because they are indivisible.

original: de bcings pa ni rdo rje khu tshur yin la de nyid ni phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de bcings pa ni rdo rje khu tshur yin la de nyid ni phyag rgya ste /
translated: The vajra fist is the binding of that, and that is the seal.

original: de'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the knowledge.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: las kyi khyad par ji skad du bshad pa so sor grub pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs gcig tu bya ba ni khu tshur te /
analyzed: las kyi khyad par ji skad du bshad pa so sor grub pa'i phyir sku gsung thugs gcig tu bya ba ni khu tshur te /
translated: The body, speech, and mind are made into one by the fist, because the special activities are accomplished individually, as explained.

original: gang gis khu tshur 'di yongs su shes pa de'i dgos pa thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis khu tshur 'di yongs su shes pa de'i dgos pa thams cad grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who knows this fist will accomplish all needs.

original: de bas na rdo rje khu tshur gyis phyag rgya thams cad sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje khu tshur gyis phyag rgya thams cad sdud pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the vajra fist gathers all seals.

original: 'dis ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdo rje khu tshur gyi sngags kyi don bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the meaning of the mantra of the vajra fist.

original: da ni 'di sngags kyi gzugs su snang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sems dpa'i gzugs su yang snang ngo zhes gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir kun bzang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: da ni 'di sngags kyi gzugs su snang ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sems dpa'i gzugs su yang snang ngo zhes gzhung lhag ma rnams kyis bstan pa'i phyir kun bzang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: Now, in order to teach that this [vajra fist] appears not only in the form of a mantra, but also in the form of a being, the remaining text teaches with [the line], Samantabhadra, etc.

original: sems dpa' rnams kyi sems dpa' dang po ni kun du bzang po ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' rnams kyi sems dpa' dang po ni kun du bzang po ste /
translated: The first being of the beings is Samantabhadra.

original: gang gis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la spyod par bstan du zin kyang bsam pa rnam par dag pas kun nas bzang ba nyid de /
analyzed: gang gis 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la spyod par bstan du zin kyang bsam pa rnam par dag pas kun nas bzang ba nyid de /
translated: He is called Samantabhadra because he is the pure intention of the Buddhas, who, although they teach the practice of passion, hatred, and folly to beings who practice passion, hatred, and folly, are themselves completely pure in their intention.

original: de bas na kun du bzang po'o //
analyzed: de bas na kun du bzang po'o //
translated: Therefore, he is Samantabhadra.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid ni kun du bzang po yin pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid ni kun du bzang po yin pa nyid kyis na /
translated: The Bhagavat himself is Samantabhadra,

original: de'i bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlab pa ni don yod cing shin tu @13a * //
analyzed: de'i bsdu ba dang byin gyis brlab pa ni don yod cing shin tu @13a * //
translated: and his gathering and blessing are meaningful and

original: yang kun nas gdon mi za bas na gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: yang kun nas gdon mi za bas na gdon mi za'o //
translated: also certain, therefore he is called Akasagarbhe.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: rdo rje rgyal po'i ngo bo nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das de nyid yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po'i ngo bo nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das de nyid yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat himself is the essence of the Vajra King.

original: gsod pa'i phyir bdud ces bya ste byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams la mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis drangs pa'am /
analyzed: gsod pa'i phyir bdud ces bya ste byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnams la mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis drangs pa'am /
translated: He is called Mara because he kills, and he is the one who leads those who have generated the thought of enlightenment to the spiritual teacher of nonvirtue.

original: chos zab mos skrag ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sems shing de'i theg pa la zhugs pa de nyid ni 'tsho ba yin la /
analyzed: chos zab mos skrag ste nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sems shing de'i theg pa la zhugs pa de nyid ni 'tsho ba yin la /
translated: Life is the thought of the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, out of fear of the profound Dharma, and the engagement in those vehicles.

original: de'i sems bzlog pas de rnams kyi bsad pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i sems bzlog pas de rnams kyi bsad pa yin te /
translated: Killing is the reversal of that thought.

original: de bas na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sems bzlog cing gsod pas na rdo rje chags pa ni bdud kyi bdag nyid can yin pas ne bdud ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i sems bzlog cing gsod pas na rdo rje chags pa ni bdud kyi bdag nyid can yin pas ne bdud ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because it reverses and kills the thought of the levels of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, Vajra Passion is called “the demon” because it has the nature of a demon.

original: bdud kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de nyid yin la rab dgyes gtso bo yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: bdud kyi ngo bo nyid kyang de nyid yin la rab dgyes gtso bo yang de nyid yin te /
translated: It is the very nature of a demon, and it is the chief of the ecstatic.

original: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las bzlog cing theg pa chen po'i chos la rab tu zhugs pa rnams la der chos kyi dga' ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las bzlog cing theg pa chen po'i chos la rab tu zhugs pa rnams la der chos kyi dga' ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, in order to generate the joy of Dharma in those who have reversed from the activities of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas and are engaged in the Dharma of the Mahāyāna,

original: gang gi gtso bo thob cing dgyes par mdzad cing legs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi gtso bo thob cing dgyes par mdzad cing legs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the chief of the ecstatic is pleased and gives his approval.

original: de bas na rab dgyes gtso bo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rab dgyes gtso bo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “the chief of the ecstatic.”

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rab tu dgyes pa'i gtso bor gyur cing rab tu dgyes pa thob par mdzad pa ji lta ba nyid yin pa de rnams la de'i rjes thogs su dbang bskur ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir mkha' skyes🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni yang dag par zhugs pa rnams kyi rab tu dgyes pa'i gtso bor gyur cing rab tu dgyes pa thob par mdzad pa ji lta ba nyid yin pa de rnams la de'i rjes thogs su dbang bskur ba yin par bstan pa'i phyir mkha' skyes zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The Bhagavān, in order to teach that the consecration that follows those is the consecration of those who have entered reality, the principal delight, and the attainment of delight, says, “born from space.”

original: nam mkha' ni go 'byed pa ste de nyid skye gnas yin pas nam mkha' skyes so //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni go 'byed pa ste de nyid skye gnas yin pas nam mkha' skyes so //
translated: Space is the provider of room, and that itself is the place of birth, so he is born from space.

original: de yang nam mkha' las 'od rnams su gyur pas rin po che bskyed la rin po che de las sems dpa' skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nam mkha' las 'od rnams su gyur pas rin po che bskyed la rin po che de las sems dpa' skyes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since light becomes from space, it generates the jewel, and the being is born from that jewel.

original: de ltar dbang bskur bar gyur nas de nyid 'jig rten gsum du rab tu snang bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dbang bskur bar gyur nas de nyid 'jig rten gsum du rab tu snang bar mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: Having become consecrated in that way, in order to teach that he himself illuminates the three worlds,

original: shin tu gzi chen dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: shin tu gzi chen dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “very majestic.”

original: thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term is: the light-circle of the nature of the wisdom of the extremely pure hearing, contemplation, and meditation.

original: shin tu gzi brjid che bar gyur nas de nyid sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul du bstan pa'i phyir rin chen dpal zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: shin tu gzi brjid che bar gyur nas de nyid sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul du bstan pa'i phyir rin chen dpal zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Having become extremely resplendent, he is called Ratnaśrī, in order to demonstrate just that as the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas thams cad kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa nyid kyis na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas thams cad kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa nyid kyis na yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: Since the perfection of generosity fulfills all hopes, it is like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: de nyid ni dpal te theg pa chen pos bgrod pa'i mtshan ma ste de'i ngo bo nyid kyi sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni dpal te theg pa chen pos bgrod pa'i mtshan ma ste de'i ngo bo nyid kyi sems dpa'o //
translated: That itself is glory, the sign of the journey on the Great Vehicle, and the spiritual warrior who is of that nature.

original: de nyid de las @13b skyes shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyams su blangs pa de'i 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i mtshan nyid can ni theg pa chen po'i chos la shin tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur bas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dzum pa che zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid de las @13b skyes shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa nyams su blangs pa de'i 'bras bu la nye bar longs spyod pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i mtshan nyid can ni theg pa chen po'i chos la shin tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur bas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dzum pa che zhes smos so //
translated: He is the one who is born from that, who enjoys the fruit of the practice of the perfection of generosity, and who is characterized by the maturation and natural outflow of that. He is the one who generates the great delight in the Mahayana Dharma. In order to teach that, he is called “the great smile.”

original: de'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i sems dpa' yang de nyid yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang ldan pa'i sems dpa' yang de nyid yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: He is the one who is endowed with the mantra and the seal of that.

original: 'dod chags kyi chos kyi mthu la gzigs pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu'i 'dab ma la gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi chos kyi mthu la gzigs pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi 'bras bu'i 'dab ma la gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
translated: He is Avalokita because he sees the power of the Dharma of passion and because he sees the leaves that are the fruit of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de la mnga' ba che bas na dbang che ste kun du gzigs pa'i dbang chen dang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mnga' ba che bas na dbang che ste kun du gzigs pa'i dbang chen dang zhes bya ste /
translated: He is the great lord because he possesses that. He is called “the great lord of all-seeing.”

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid do //
translated: He is the Blessed One himself.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri mas ma gos pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi yid 'phrog pa dang / shes rab dang ye shes rab tu bsgom pa'i mthus 'jam zhing mnyen la dpal dang ldan pa'i byis pa'i gzugs kyis bcom ldan 'das de nyid 'gro ba rnams yongs su smin par mdzad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'jam dpal zhes bya ba smos so //🔽bcom ldan 'das de nyid sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i dkyil 'khor rgyud las bstan pa thams cad bsdus pa'i tshul gyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis de la lhag par mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir de'i gzugs su ston
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri mas ma gos pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi yid 'phrog pa dang / shes rab dang ye shes rab tu bsgom pa'i mthus 'jam zhing mnyen la dpal dang ldan pa'i byis pa'i gzugs kyis bcom ldan 'das de nyid 'gro ba rnams yongs su smin par mdzad par bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'jam dpal zhes bya ba smos so // bcom ldan 'das de nyid sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i dkyil 'khor rgyud las bstan pa thams cad bsdus pa'i tshul gyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis de la lhag par mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pa'i phyir de'i gzugs su ston
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Bhagavat himself, by the power of his practice of wisdom and knowledge, in the form of a glorious youth, gentle and tender, in order to bring beings to maturity, teaches the Dharma in the form of Mañjuśrī, who is not sullied by the stains of afflictions such as desire, and who captivates the minds of all beings, he says Mañjuśrī.

original: pas na dkyil 'khor thams cad dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: pas na dkyil 'khor thams cad dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the Bhagavat himself, by the method of condensing all the teachings of the maṇḍala tantra for bringing beings to maturity, in the form of a universal monarch, acts for the benefit of those beings who aspire to that form, he says all maṇḍalas.

original: tshig gi nyes pa myur ba dang bar ma dang thog ma yongs su spangs nas mi gsung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzlas brjod kyi dus su sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pas na de nyid la mi gsung ba zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: tshig gi nyes pa myur ba dang bar ma dang thog ma yongs su spangs nas mi gsung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bzlas brjod kyi dus su sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pas na de nyid la mi gsung ba zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: Having abandoned the faults of speech, namely, quickness, middling [speed], and slowness, he recites the mantra with the nature of silence. He accomplishes the aims of sentient beings at the time of recitation. Therefore, it is also explained as silence.

original: sngags pa bzlas brjod la 'jug pa rnams sangs rgyas la mchod pa ma byas na dngos grub rnams mngon du 'phags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngags pa bzlas brjod la 'jug pa rnams sangs rgyas la mchod pa ma byas na dngos grub rnams mngon du 'phags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: When the mantra practitioner engages in recitation, if he does not make offerings to the Buddha, the accomplishments will not manifest.

original: de bas na sna tshogs pa dang yangs shing rgya che ba'i mchod pa'i tshul thams cad kun du bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na sna tshogs pa dang yangs shing rgya che ba'i mchod pa'i tshul thams cad kun du bstan te /
translated: Therefore, all the methods of various, vast, and extensive offerings are fully explained.

original: de bas na thams cad las zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad las zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is also explained as everything.

original: de gnyi ga la yang le lo can rnams la mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga la yang le lo can rnams la mi 'byung ste /
translated: For both of those, the lazy will not attain [accomplishments].

original: de bas na brtson 'grus zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na brtson 'grus zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, effort is mentioned.

original: rang bzhin 'jam pa rnams kyis ni ci dang cis bsdigs kyang gal te dge ba'i phyogs rnams la bar du gcod @14a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'jam pa rnams kyis ni ci dang cis bsdigs kyang gal te dge ba'i phyogs rnams la bar du gcod @14a * //
translated: Even if those who are naturally gentle are threatened in any way, if they are obstructed in virtuous activities,

original: par 'gyur ba srid pas de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ma rungs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: par 'gyur ba srid pas de bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ma rungs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to prevent that, he says, do not be afraid.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje las gang yang rung ba ma tshang bar gyur pas kyang ji skad du bshad pa'i don la gal te zhum par 'gyur ba dag kyang srid de /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje las gang yang rung ba ma tshang bar gyur pas kyang ji skad du bshad pa'i don la gal te zhum par 'gyur ba dag kyang srid de /
translated: Even if there is a deficiency in any of the vajra body, speech, or mind, it is possible that there will be timidity with regard to the meaning that has been explained.

original: de bas na dam du gzung zhes bya pa smos te sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du des pa'i sems dpa' yang de nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dam du gzung zhes bya pa smos te sku gsung thugs rdo rje rnams kyi ngo bo nyid du des pa'i sems dpa' yang de nyid yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, he says, hold fast, indicating that the bodhisattva is the very essence of the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das de sngags dang sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo nyid du yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de sngags dang sems dpa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi phyag rgya'i ngo bo nyid du yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Not only is the Blessed One the essence of mantra and bodhisattva, but he should also be known as the essence of the seal. Therefore, he says vajra, and so on.

original: mi phyed cing 'byed par byed pas rdo rje'o //
analyzed: mi phyed cing 'byed par byed pas rdo rje'o //
translated: It is a vajra because it is indivisible and divides.

original: 'dren pa'i don gyis na lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: 'dren pa'i don gyis na lcags kyu'o //
translated: It is a hook in the sense of drawing.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'bigs pa'i don gyis na mda'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs 'bigs pa'i don gyis na mda'o //
translated: It is an arrow because it pierces the mass of mind and mental functions.

original: dga' ba'i don gyis na ma gu ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i don gyis na ma gu ba'o //
translated: It is a banner because it delights.

original: zhen par byed pa'i don gyis na rin po che'o //
analyzed: zhen par byed pa'i don gyis na rin po che'o //
translated: It is a jewel because it is cherished.

original: 'od zer gyi snang bas ma rig pa'i mun nag gis bsgribs pa rnams la dngos po thams cad ston pas na nyi ma ste /
analyzed: 'od zer gyi snang bas ma rig pa'i mun nag gis bsgribs pa rnams la dngos po thams cad ston pas na nyi ma ste /
translated: It is the sun because it illuminates all things for those obscured by the darkness of nescience.

original: gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is a lamp because it illuminates.

original: sems can thams cad kyi dbul ba'i sdug bsngal skye bzhin pa 'jig par byed pas na rgyal mtshan no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dbul ba'i sdug bsngal skye bzhin pa 'jig par byed pas na rgyal mtshan no //
translated: It is a victory banner because it destroys the poverty of all sentient beings.

original: sems can shin tu yid mi bde ba rnams kyang chos kyi dga' ba'i ro myang na ngo mtshar skyed par byed pas na 'dzum pa'o //
analyzed: sems can shin tu yid mi bde ba rnams kyang chos kyi dga' ba'i ro myang na ngo mtshar skyed par byed pas na 'dzum pa'o //
translated: It is a smile because it causes wonder in those who are very unhappy, when they taste the joy of the Dharma.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshes la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i sems can rnams la yang 'jig rten pha rol rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'dul bar mdzad pas na padma'o //
