analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshes la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i sems can rnams la yang 'jig rten pha rol rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir thabs rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'dul bar mdzad pas na padma'o //
translated: He is a lotus because he disciplines those beings who turn their backs on the Mahayana, by means of various skillful means, in order to purify their future worlds.

original: sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams kyang shes rab kyi ral gris tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa la rab tu 'jog par mdzad pas na ral gri'o //
analyzed: sems can tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams kyang shes rab kyi ral gris tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa la rab tu 'jog par mdzad pas na ral gri'o //
translated: He is a sword because he establishes those beings who are immoral in the perfection of morality, by means of the sword of wisdom.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi rgyud la 'pho bar mdzad pas na 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi rgyud la 'pho bar mdzad pas na 'khor lo'o //
translated: He is a wheel because he sets in motion the stream of consciousness of those who are to be disciplined.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don gsung pa'i don gyis na gsung ngo //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don gsung pa'i don gyis na gsung ngo //
translated: He is a speech because he speaks the meaning that is desired.

original: 'dod pa'i phyir las te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i phyir las te /
translated: The meaning of the word “karoti” is “to do” or “to make.”

original: byed pa po shin tu 'dod pa'i las so zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa po shin tu 'dod pa'i las so zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, “The agent is the one who does the action that is very much desired.”

original: yid rdo rjer gyur par byed pas na go cha'o //
analyzed: yid rdo rjer gyur par byed pas na go cha'o //
translated: He is armor because he makes the mind become vajra.

original: ma rungs pa thams cad la mngon sum du gyur pa nyid kyis 'jigs par mdzad pas na 'jigs byed do //
analyzed: ma rungs pa thams cad la mngon sum du gyur pa nyid kyis 'jigs par mdzad pas na 'jigs byed do //
translated: He is Bhairava because he terrifies all evildoers by becoming manifest to them.

original: sku gsung thugs bsdus pas phyag rgya thams cad 'dzin pas na bcangs pa ste de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das @14b yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs bsdus pas phyag rgya thams cad 'dzin pas na bcangs pa ste de nyid ni bcom ldan 'das @14b yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: He is the Bhagavān because he holds all the seals by condensing the body, speech, and mind.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das 'di ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa yin na de'i thog ma ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das 'di ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis sems can gyi don mdzad pa yin na de'i thog ma ni gang zhig yin /
translated: If the Bhagavān acts for the welfare of sentient beings in the manner described, then what is his beginning?

original: de'i tha ma ni nam zhig yin zhes rnam par rtog pa la /
analyzed: de'i tha ma ni nam zhig yin zhes rnam par rtog pa la /
translated: What is his end?🔽Therefore, he says, “He is without beginning or end.”

original: de'i phyir thog ma tha ma med ces bya ba smos te thog ma ni dang por skye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma tha ma med ces bya ba smos te thog ma ni dang por skye ba'o //
translated: His beginning is his initial birth.

original: tha ma ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba med par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba med par 'jig pa'o //
translated: His end is his destruction without a subsequent rebirth.

original: gang la de dag gnyi ga med pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la de dag gnyi ga med pa de ni thog ma dang tha ma med pa ste /
translated: He who is without both of these is without beginning and end.

original: rgyun gyi tshul gyis rtag tu gnas so zhes ston to //
analyzed: rgyun gyi tshul gyis rtag tu gnas so zhes ston to //
translated: He is taught to always exist in a continuous series.

original: yongs su ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na yang sems can gyi rgyun la thog ma med pa nas thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag pa'i gnas skabs na yang sems can gyi rgyun la thog ma med pa nas thog ma med pa'o //
translated: Even in the impure stage, he is without beginning and end in the series of sentient beings.

original: yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs na yang gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'khor ba na bzhugs pas na tha ma med do //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs na yang gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu mthun pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis 'khor ba na bzhugs pas na tha ma med do //
translated: And even in the state of complete purity, he remains in cyclic existence by the essential nature of the natural outcome of the defining characteristic of the transmutation of the basis, and so he is without end.

original: gal te 'di 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs na /
analyzed: gal te 'di 'khor ba ji srid par bzhugs na /
translated: If he remains for as long as cyclic existence exists,

original: de lta ni ma zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa la zhi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta ni ma zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes rtog pa la zhi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then he would not be peaceful, one might think. To forestall this line of thought, he says, “peaceful.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bas na zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bas na zhi ba'o //
translated: He is peaceful because he is liberated from the obscurations of the mental afflictions.

original: gal te zhi ba ma yin na ni zhi ba'i gzugs kyis gdug cing gtum pa rnams ji ltar 'dul bar mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gal te zhi ba ma yin na ni zhi ba'i gzugs kyis gdug cing gtum pa rnams ji ltar 'dul bar mdzad ce na /
translated: If he were not peaceful, then how could he tame those who are wild and fierce by means of his peaceful form?

original: ma rungs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma rungs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, “fierce.

original: 'di skad ston te 'di ni zhi ba yin du zin kyang gdul ba'i sems can gyi dbang gis ma rungs pa nyid du yang ston pa yin no//
analyzed: 'di skad ston te 'di ni zhi ba yin du zin kyang gdul ba'i sems can gyi dbang gis ma rungs pa nyid du yang ston pa yin no//
translated: This is what is being taught: Even though he is peaceful, he also displays fierceness in accordance with the beings who are to be trained.

original: gal te gzugs ngan pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pa thams cad smod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs ngan pa nyid kyis 'jig rten pa thams cad smod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one were to think, “He would be despised by all the world because of his ugly form,”

original: lan du khro ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan du khro ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “wrathful.

original: 'di ni khro ba dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i tshul nyid gzung gi ma rungs pa gzhan dag la bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni khro ba dang bcas pa'i dpa' bo'i tshul nyid gzung gi ma rungs pa gzhan dag la bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the very nature of a hero who is angry, not of other wicked people.

original: gal te khro bo nyid yin na de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te khro bo nyid yin na de lta na ni /
translated: If he is angry, then

original: bzod pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: bzod pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: he would be without patience.

original: de'i lan du bzod pa che zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du bzod pa che zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated: “great patience.”

original: bzod pa chen po mnga' bas na bzod pa che'o //
analyzed: bzod pa chen po mnga' bas na bzod pa che'o //
translated: Because he possesses great patience, he is “greatly patient.”

original: nyon mongs pa rnams zad par mdzad pas na gnod sbyin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams zad par mdzad pas na gnod sbyin no //
translated: Because he causes the afflictions to be exhausted, he is a yakṣa.

original: srin po'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba rnams kyi phyir srin po dam pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: srin po'i gzugs kyis 'dul ba rnams kyi phyir srin po dam pa zhes smos te /
translated: For the sake of those to be trained by the form of a rākṣasa, he is called “best of rākṣasas.”

original: srin po bzang po ni srin po dam pa'o //
analyzed: srin po bzang po ni srin po dam pa'o //
translated: A good rākṣasa is a best of rākṣasas.

original: de rnams la mi zad pa'i gzugs bstan pas ji ltar 'jigs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams la mi zad pa'i gzugs bstan pas ji ltar 'jigs par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that they are not frightened by his display of an inexhaustible form?

original: de'i lan du bstan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i lan du bstan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is stated: “display.”

original: bstan pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Display is unshakable.

original: sems can gang gzi brjid dang ldan pa de rnams kyi nang na gzi chen te gzi brjid dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ston pa yin no //🔽dpa' bo mngon pa'i @15a * //
analyzed: sems can gang gzi brjid dang ldan pa de rnams kyi nang na gzi chen te gzi brjid dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ston pa yin no // dpa' bo mngon pa'i @15a * //
translated: Among those sentient beings who are powerful, he is the most powerful, up to he is the most powerful among those who are powerful.

original: nga rgyal dang ldan pa de tshar gcod par mdzad pas na dpa' bo'o //🔽rnal 'byor pa rnams sam /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang ldan pa de tshar gcod par mdzad pas na dpa' bo'o // rnal 'byor pa rnams sam /
translated: He is a hero because he subdues those who are arrogant heroes.

original: lha'i khyad par 'ga' zhig bdag po nyid du nye bar ston pas bdag nyid rlom sems su byed pa de rnams la de gdul bar bya ba'i phyir dpa' bo che zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lha'i khyad par 'ga' zhig bdag po nyid du nye bar ston pas bdag nyid rlom sems su byed pa de rnams la de gdul bar bya ba'i phyir dpa' bo che zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Those who are arrogant heroes are yogis or some special gods who are arrogant about their own status, thinking I am the lord. In order to subdue them, he is called the great hero.

original: thams cad du ston pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad du ston pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is the teacher of all.

original: dbang phyug chen po yang chung ma'i stobs kyis nga ni au ma'i bdag po nyid do zhes shin tu rlom sems te /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po yang chung ma'i stobs kyis nga ni au ma'i bdag po nyid do zhes shin tu rlom sems te /
translated: Maheśvara is also very arrogant, thinking, I am the lord of Umā because of the power of his wife.

original: de bas na de'i nga rgyal bsal ba'i phyir au ma'i bdag po nyid du yang ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: de bas na de'i nga rgyal bsal ba'i phyir au ma'i bdag po nyid du yang ston par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, in order to remove his pride, he is also shown to be the lord of Umā.

original: de'i phyir au ma'i bdag po zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir au ma'i bdag po zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he is called the lord of Umā.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis so sor rab tu skye bas skye dgu ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis so sor rab tu skye bas skye dgu ste /
translated: since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.

original: de rnams kyi mgon po yin pas na skye dgu'i mgon no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mgon po yin pas na skye dgu'i mgon no //
translated: He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,

original: de yang skyabs dang mi 'jigs pa stsol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang skyabs dang mi 'jigs pa stsol ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor la gnas pa la 'dir dngos po thams cad la 'jug par mdzad pa'am /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor la gnas pa la 'dir dngos po thams cad la 'jug par mdzad pa'am /
translated: He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.

original: thams cad de la 'jug par mdzad pas na gtogs 'dod ces bya ba'am yang na de la dad pa rnams la de'i gzugs su ston par mdzad pas na gtogs 'dod khyab 'jug ces kyang de nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad de la 'jug par mdzad pas na gtogs 'dod ces bya ba'am yang na de la dad pa rnams la de'i gzugs su ston par mdzad pas na gtogs 'dod khyab 'jug ces kyang de nyid la bya'o //
translated: He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.

original: rgyal bas mngon par khengs pa rnams la shin tu rgyal bar bzhed cing rgyal po'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na rgyal 'dod kyang 'di nyid do //
analyzed: rgyal bas mngon par khengs pa rnams la shin tu rgyal bar bzhed cing rgyal po'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na rgyal 'dod kyang 'di nyid do //
translated: He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,🔽since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa ste /
translated: since he is born individually through the power of karma and affliction.🔽He is the lord of all beings because he is the protector of all beings,

original: de rnams kyi nang na shin tu mchog tu gyur pas thub pa che zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang na shin tu mchog tu gyur pas thub pa che zhes bshad do //
translated: He is called the Great Sage because he is the most excellent among them.

original: 'jig pas na 'jig rten te sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig rten te sems can gyi 'jig rten dang / snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The world is that which is destroyed, i.e., the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment.

original: de gnyi ga skyong bar mdzad pas na 'jig rten skyong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga skyong bar mdzad pas na 'jig rten skyong zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called the Protector of the World because he protects both of them,

original: lha ma yin gdug pa rnams sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnam par 'jig pa las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha ma yin gdug pa rnams sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rnam par 'jig pa las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he turns back the violent titans from destroying the earth and so on.

original: gal te snod kyi 'jig rten skyong ba de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snod kyi 'jig rten skyong ba de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If he is not the protector of the world, then the world would be destroyed.

original: nam mkha' zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha' zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He is called space because

original: ril sogs pas bsgribs pa'i phyogs na yang ma bsgribs pa nyid du ston pas dngos po gzugs can du mi 'gyur bas na nam mkha'o //
analyzed: ril sogs pas bsgribs pa'i phyogs na yang ma bsgribs pa nyid du ston pas dngos po gzugs can du mi 'gyur bas na nam mkha'o //
translated: he shows that even the direction covered by earth and so on is unobscured. Since he is not an entity with form, he is space.

original: nam mkha'i phyogs su yang sa'i dkyil 'khor ston pas na sa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i phyogs su yang sa'i dkyil 'khor ston pas na sa'o //
translated: He is called earth because he shows the circle of the earth in the direction of space.

original: sen mo'i sbubs la sogs par yang 'jig rten gsum po ston par mdzad pas na 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ba yang de nyid @15b yin te /
analyzed: sen mo'i sbubs la sogs par yang 'jig rten gsum po ston par mdzad pas na 'jig rten gsum zhes bya ba yang de nyid @15b yin te /
translated: Since he displays the three worlds in the space under his nails and so forth, he is the three worlds.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is according to worldly convention.

original: khams gsum pa zhes bya ba yang ba sbu'i khung bu re re bzhin yang khams gsum rab tu ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa zhes bya ba yang ba sbu'i khung bu re re bzhin yang khams gsum rab tu ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Since he displays the three worlds in each pore of his body, he is the three realms.

original: zad par gyi skye mched bsgoms pa las 'byung ba chen po bzhi yongs su gyur par ston par mdzad pas na 'byung chen no //
analyzed: zad par gyi skye mched bsgoms pa las 'byung ba chen po bzhi yongs su gyur par ston par mdzad pas na 'byung chen no //
translated: Since he displays the transformation of the four great elements through the cultivation of the bases of mastery, he is the great elements.

original: shin tu yang sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pas na sems can don rab mdzad ces bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu yang sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pas na sems can don rab mdzad ces bya'o //
translated: Since he acts for the welfare of sentient beings in a very great way, he is the one who acts for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma lus par ston par mdzad pas na thams cad do //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid ma lus par ston par mdzad pas na thams cad do //
translated: Since he displays the nature of all things without exception, he is all.

original: dgongs pa'i dbang gis des 'dul ba rnams la de'i gzugs su'ang ston par mdzad pas na gu lang ste /
analyzed: dgongs pa'i dbang gis des 'dul ba rnams la de'i gzugs su'ang ston par mdzad pas na gu lang ste /
translated: Since he displays the form of that god to those who are to be tamed by that god through the power of his intention, he is Shiva.

original: lha chen po'i gzugs su'o //
analyzed: lha chen po'i gzugs su'o //
translated: This is the form of Mahesvara.

original: tshangs pa ni tshangs pa zhes 'jig rten na grags pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni tshangs pa zhes 'jig rten na grags pa ste /
translated: Brahma is the one renowned in the world as Brahma.

original: des 'dul ba rnams la de'i gzugs su ston par mdzad pas na tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: des 'dul ba rnams la de'i gzugs su ston par mdzad pas na tshangs pa'o //
translated: He is Brahma because he manifests in the form of Brahma for those who are to be trained by Brahma.

original: dngos po thams cad 'jug pa'i tshul du bdag nyid ston par mdzad pas na 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad 'jug pa'i tshul du bdag nyid ston par mdzad pas na 'khor ba'o //
translated: He is samsara because he manifests himself in the manner of engaging in all things.

original: de rnams nyid ldog pa'i tshul ston par mdzad pas na mya ngan las 'das pa'o ;
analyzed: de rnams nyid ldog pa'i tshul ston par mdzad pas na mya ngan las 'das pa'o ;
translated: He is nirvana because he manifests in the manner of turning away from those very things.

original: / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis na rtag pa ste /
analyzed: / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid kyis na rtag pa ste /
translated: He is permanent because he is by nature nirvana.

original: don dam par ni de'i ngo bos rtag tu bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni de'i ngo bos rtag tu bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the ultimate sense, he is permanent because he always abides in his essence.

original: spyod pa skyon med par ston par mdzad pas na yang dag 'tsho zhes bshad do //
analyzed: spyod pa skyon med par ston par mdzad pas na yang dag 'tsho zhes bshad do //
translated: He is said to be the one with perfect conduct because he manifests faultless conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab par ston par mdzad pa'i dus su mchod pa che zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa nam mkha'i khams thams cad khyab par ston par mdzad pa'i dus su mchod pa che zhes bya ste /
translated: He is the great offering because he manifests the offering of all the tathagatas that pervades the entire realm of space.

original: 'di ma h'a'i sgra ni mchod pa yin par bshad pas che ba'i mchod pa ni mchod pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ma h'a'i sgra ni mchod pa yin par bshad pas che ba'i mchod pa ni mchod pa chen po'o //
translated: Since the term mahat means “worship,” great worship is great worship.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi don gyi de kho na nyid thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi don gyi de kho na nyid thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
translated: A buddha is one who has realized the reality of the meaning of all things.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams dang shin tu bral bas na dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rnams dang shin tu bral bas na dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is completely free from the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable.

original: 'dis 'gro ba na theg pa ste byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rgyud dang 'bras bur bcas pa ni bcu gnyis te sa bcu gnyis la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'gro ba na theg pa ste byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu rgyud dang 'bras bur bcas pa ni bcu gnyis te sa bcu gnyis la theg pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The vehicle is that by which one goes, namely, the ten bodhisattva stages, together with their continua and their results, which are called the “great vehicle.”

original: mos pa spyod pa'i sa rnams ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: mos pa spyod pa'i sa rnams ni rgyu yin la /
translated: The stages of devoted interest are the cause.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du bzang po ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa kun du bzang po ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The buddha stage of Perfect Joy is the result.

original: 'di thams cad ni theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni theg pa chen po'o //
translated: All of these are the great vehicle.

original: 'di'i don ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs la yang theg pa chen po'i sgrar bshad de sgra'i don gyi gzugs su snang bas na de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs la yang theg pa chen po'i sgrar bshad de sgra'i don gyi gzugs su snang bas na de'i phyir theg pa chen po'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: The collection of scriptures that reveal the meaning of this is also called the Mahayana because it appears in the form of the meaning of the word. Therefore, it is called the Mahayana.

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The existence of the desire realm is the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi srid pa ni gzugs kyi khams so /
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pa ni gzugs kyi khams so /
translated: The existence of the form realm is the form realm.

original: @16a * // gzugs med pa'i srid pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams te /
analyzed: @16a * // gzugs med pa'i srid pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams te /
translated: The existence of the formless realm is the formless realm.

original: 'byung ba'i phyir na srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i phyir na srid pa'o //
translated: Because they arise, they are existence.

original: srid pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyang de nyid yin te /
translated: That is also the nature of the three existences.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa zhes dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa zhes dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As explained in the Madhyāntavibhāga, the dependent nature is the mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: la lar rga ba dang 'chi ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston par mdzad pas na rtag pa yang de yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: la lar rga ba dang 'chi ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ston par mdzad pas na rtag pa yang de yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: In some places, it is taught to have the nature of being without aging and death, so it is also said to be permanent.

original: sa 'og gi 'jig rten dang sa steng gi 'jig rten dang / mtho ris kyi 'jig rten ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
analyzed: sa 'og gi 'jig rten dang sa steng gi 'jig rten dang / mtho ris kyi 'jig rten ni 'jig rten gsum mo //
translated: The three worlds are the underworld, the earth, and the heavens.

original: de las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum rgyal te /
analyzed: de las rnam par rgyal ba'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum rgyal te /
translated: Since he has the nature of being victorious over the three worlds, he is the conqueror of the three worlds.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi gzugs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi gzugs can zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the name of the Blessed One is “he who has the form of Vajra Humkara.”

original: bde ba la spyod par mdzad pas na bde spyod de sham zhes bya ba ni bde ba la bya bar bshad la /
analyzed: bde ba la spyod par mdzad pas na bde spyod de sham zhes bya ba ni bde ba la bya bar bshad la /
translated: Since he acts for the enjoyment of bliss, he is the enjoyer of bliss.

original: de stsol bas skyong bar mdzad pa'i phyir bde spyod de nyid kyi rang bzhin dang gzhan rnams skyong bar mdzad pas na bde spyod mgon no //
analyzed: de stsol bas skyong bar mdzad pa'i phyir bde spyod de nyid kyi rang bzhin dang gzhan rnams skyong bar mdzad pas na bde spyod mgon no //
translated: Since he protects the nature of the enjoyer of bliss and the others, he is the protector of the enjoyer of bliss.

original: gdul bar dka' ba thams cad shin tu yang 'dul bar mdzad pas na rab dul mdzad do //
analyzed: gdul bar dka' ba thams cad shin tu yang 'dul bar mdzad pas na rab dul mdzad do //
translated: Since he tames even the most difficult to tame, he is the tamer of the difficult to tame.

original: rdo rje ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad de /
analyzed: rdo rje ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad de /
translated: Vajra means all the Bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyi gtso bo mdzad pas na rdo rje gtso dang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gtso bo mdzad pas na rdo rje gtso dang zhes bya ste /
translated: Since he acts as their chief, he is the chief of the vajra.

original: dbugs 'byin par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who gives relief.

original: sa bzang po ni sa rab mchog ste ye shes kyis yongs su bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu'o //
analyzed: sa bzang po ni sa rab mchog ste ye shes kyis yongs su bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu'o //
translated: The good ground is the excellent ground, the supreme ground, the ten bodhisattva stages, which are the nature of the discernment of intuition.

original: de dag gi mchog ni kun du bzang po ste /
analyzed: de dag gi mchog ni kun du bzang po ste /
translated: The supreme of those is the stage of Universal Radiance,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: which is the nature of the stage of Buddhahood.

original: don thams cad phyin ci ma log par yongs su gcod pas na de nyid ni yin ye shes so //
analyzed: don thams cad phyin ci ma log par yongs su gcod pas na de nyid ni yin ye shes so //
translated: It is intuition because it discerns all meanings without error.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad sdud pa la 'jug pas na pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad sdud pa la 'jug pas na pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul lo //
translated: It is the method of the perfections because it engages in the collection of all the perfections.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' ste sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sems yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' ste sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sems yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is the bodhisattva. The word sattva should be taken as referring to mind.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na rnam par thar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par thar pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na rnam par thar zhes bya'o //
translated: It is liberation because it is the nature of the liberation of emptiness and so on.

original: spyod par spyod pa'i don gyis na spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyod par spyod pa'i don gyis na spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is conduct because it has the meaning of engaging in conduct.

original: byang chub 'thob pa'i spyod pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rjes su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub 'thob pa'i spyod pa ji skad bstan pa bzhin du rjes su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the very essence of the accomplishment of the practice as it has been taught for the attainment of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhes bya ba ni rang nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang tha mi dad par bzhugs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun @16b no ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun zhes bya ba ni rang nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang tha mi dad par bzhugs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa kun @16b no ;
translated: All Tathagatas means that he himself abides undifferentiated from all Tathagatas.

original: / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni sangs rgyas don no //
analyzed: / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni sangs rgyas don no //
translated: The meaning of the word Buddha is the meaning of enlightened.

original: sangs rgyas thugs zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi dgongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thugs zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyi dgongs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind of the Buddhas means that he is the very essence of their intention.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gsum bsdus pa'i don gyis na byang chub kun no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gsum bsdus pa'i don gyis na byang chub kun no //
translated: The enlightenment of all Bodhisattvas means that he is the very essence of the three groups of Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di'i gong na yod pa ma yin pas na bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gong na yod pa ma yin pas na bla na med pa'o //
translated: It is unsurpassed because there is nothing higher than it.

original: 'og min lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs par bstan pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de rnam par snang mdzad chen po 'di nyid kyi so sor snang ba tshad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'og min lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs par bstan pa ni rnam par snang mdzad de rnam par snang mdzad chen po 'di nyid kyi so sor snang ba tshad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The teaching that he abides in the Akanistha abode of the king of gods means that he is Vairocana, the very essence of the great Vairocana, the one who appears in a limited way.

original: rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dis sdig pa dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams las rgyal bar mdzad pas na rgyal ba zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dis sdig pa dang mi dge ba'i chos rnams las rgyal bar mdzad pas na rgyal ba zhes bshad de /
translated: The Victorious One is so called because he has conquered evil and nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: sdig pa'i chos la nga rgyal bas ;🔽/ nyer 'gro de phyir nga rgyal ba //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos la nga rgyal bas ; / nyer 'gro de phyir nga rgyal ba // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: He is the Victorious One because he is victorious over evil dharmas.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa skyob par mdzad pa'i don gyis na mgon po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa skyob par mdzad pa'i don gyis na mgon po'o //
translated: He is the Protector because he protects the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: rang byung bas na rang byung ste /
analyzed: rang byung bas na rang byung ste /
translated: He is the Self-Existent One because he is self-arisen,

original: de nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is fully enlightened by himself.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te mchog sbyin nas byang chub brnyes pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te mchog sbyin nas byang chub brnyes pa ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught: He did not attain enlightenment from the gift of the alms-bowl.

original: gzungs ni don gyi gzungs dang / tshig gi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i gzungs te /
analyzed: gzungs ni don gyi gzungs dang / tshig gi gzungs dang / sngags kyi gzungs dang / mngon par rtogs pa'i gzungs te /
translated: The dhāraṇī is the dhāraṇī of meaning, the dhāraṇī of words, the dhāraṇī of mantras, and the dhāraṇī of realization.

original: dran pa dang shes rab yang dag par ldan pa'i sems la gzungs zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad de /
analyzed: dran pa dang shes rab yang dag par ldan pa'i sems la gzungs zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad de /
translated: The term dhāraṇī is explained as the mind endowed with mindfulness and wisdom.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag kyang 'di yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag kyang 'di yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: These are the four aspects.

original: dran pa dang yang dag par ldan pas dran pa zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: dran pa dang yang dag par ldan pas dran pa zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: He is also called “mindful” because he is endowed with mindfulness.

original: sems dpa' che dang zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don mdzad pas na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' che dang zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don mdzad pas na sems dpa' chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: “ Great being” means that he is called “great being” because he acts for the sake of the great mass of sentient beings.

original: phyag rgya che zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi sku ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du ston pa'i phyir ro //🔽ting 'dzin sangs rgyas phrin las mdzad //
analyzed: phyag rgya che zhes bya ba ni nyid kyi sku ji ltar 'dul ba bzhin du ston pa'i phyir ro // ting 'dzin sangs rgyas phrin las mdzad //
translated: “ Great seal” means that he is the great seal because he displays his own body in whatever way is necessary to tame.

original: ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dang yang dag par ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi phrin las rnams mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par dang yang dag par ldan pas sangs rgyas kyi phrin las rnams mdzad pa'o //
translated: “ He performs the deeds of the buddhas through samādhi” means that he performs the deeds of the buddhas through being endowed with the special samādhi.

original: yang dag pa ni bden pa ste phyin ci ma log ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag pa ni bden pa ste phyin ci ma log ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ Reality” means truth, and it means “non-erroneous.”

original: sangs rgyas kun bdag nyid ces bya ba ni de dag dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun bdag nyid ces bya ba ni de dag dang tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “ The nature of all buddhas” means that he is the nature that is not different from them.

original: rtag tu sems can gyi don la zhen par mdzad pas na sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can gyi don la zhen par mdzad pas na sems dpa'o //
translated: He is a hero because he is always intent on the welfare of sentient beings.

original: rtag don zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi don te /
analyzed: rtag don zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi don te /
translated: The meaning of “eternity” is the meaning of reality.

original: de rtogs par mdzad pas na rtag don rtogs mdzad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rtogs par mdzad pas na rtag don rtogs mdzad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is the one who realizes that, so he is the one who realizes the meaning of eternity.

original: shes rab mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sdong po zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lha @17a * //
analyzed: shes rab mdzad pa zhes bya ba'i don to // sdong po zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lha @17a * //
translated: The meaning is that he is the one who has wisdom.🔽The word “trunk” is explained as referring to the special emanation of Maheśvara.

original: chen po'i sprul pa khyad par can la bya bar bshad la de las kyang ches lhag par gyur pa sdong po chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po'i sprul pa khyad par can la bya bar bshad la de las kyang ches lhag par gyur pa sdong po chen po'o //
translated: And even more than that, he is the great trunk.

original: nag po chen po zhes bya ba yang de'i 'khor tshogs la bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: nag po chen po zhes bya ba yang de'i 'khor tshogs la bya bar bshad de /
translated: “Great Black One” is also explained as referring to the assembly of his retinue.

original: de'i gzugs su yang ston par mdzad pas na nag po zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: de'i gzugs su yang ston par mdzad pas na nag po zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: And because he also manifests in that form, he is also explained as “black.”

original: 'dod chags chen po ni sems can rnams smin pa dang grol ba'i chags pa dang / yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags chen po'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po ni sems can rnams smin pa dang grol ba'i chags pa dang / yang dag par ldan pa'i phyir 'dod chags chen po'o //
translated: “Great passion” is great passion because he is endowed with the passion for ripening and liberating sentient beings.

original: bde ba che zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i rgyal po bde bas mngon par rlom pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba che zhes bya ba ni gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i rgyal po bde bas mngon par rlom pa ste /
translated: Great bliss is the king of the Paranirmitavasavartin gods who is arrogant with bliss.

original: nga dang 'dra bar bde ba gzhan dag yod pa ma yin na zhes bdag nyid bsnyems pa de gdul bar bya ba'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na rol pas 'jug par mdzad pa'i sku la bde ba chen po zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad do //
analyzed: nga dang 'dra bar bde ba gzhan dag yod pa ma yin na zhes bdag nyid bsnyems pa de gdul bar bya ba'i phyir btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na rol pas 'jug par mdzad pa'i sku la bde ba chen po zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad do //
translated: Since he thinks, There is no one else who is as blissful as I am, in order to tame him, the Buddha enters the retinue of his queens and explains the term great bliss to his body.🔽Skillful means is the means for quickly and easily attaining the desired goal.

original: thabs zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don myur du bde bar thob par byed pas na thabs te thabs kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na thabs chen po ste ;
analyzed: thabs zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don myur du bde bar thob par byed pas na thabs te thabs kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas na thabs chen po ste ;
translated: Since it is a means and it is great, it is great means.

original: de dang rab tu ldan pas na thabs chen po zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: de dang rab tu ldan pas na thabs chen po zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: Since it is endowed with that, it is also explained as great means.

original: mchog chen mchog ces bya ba la chen po ni lha rnams kyi spyi la bya /
analyzed: mchog chen mchog ces bya ba la chen po ni lha rnams kyi spyi la bya /
translated: The supreme of the supreme of the great is as follows. Great refers to the general class of gods.

original: mchog ni lha rnams kyi bdag po'o //
analyzed: mchog ni lha rnams kyi bdag po'o //
translated: Supreme refers to the lord of the gods.

original: de rnams kyi yang mchog yin pas mchog chen po'i mchog go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang mchog yin pas mchog chen po'i mchog go //
translated: Since he is the supreme of those, he is the supreme of the supreme of the great.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de rnams kyi yang mchog tu gyur pas kun gyi mchog go //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas de rnams kyi yang mchog tu gyur pas kun gyi mchog go //
translated: and the best of the Hearers and the Solitary Buddhas.

original: de nyid kyis nas thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin pas na gnas dbang po ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis nas thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin pas na gnas dbang po ste /
translated: He is the Lord of the Abode, because He is the Lord of all,

original: sems can thams cad dang gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because He is of the nature of non-duality with all beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: The Blessed One has been explained.

original: sa dang po la sogs pa la ltos pa'i sems gang zhig skye ba de thams cad la sangs rgyas kyis kun du bzang po la skye ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yin pas byang chub chen po'i thugs zhes bshad do //
analyzed: sa dang po la sogs pa la ltos pa'i sems gang zhig skye ba de thams cad la sangs rgyas kyis kun du bzang po la skye ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni shin tu rnam par dag pa yin pas byang chub chen po'i thugs zhes bshad do //
translated: The mind that arises in relation to the first stage, etc. is all of it. The mind that arises in the Buddha is the mind of universal good, and it is extremely pure. Therefore, it is called the mind of great enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po yang de nyid yin par bshad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po kun du bzang po yang de nyid yin par bshad de /
translated: And that is also explained as the Bodhisattva, the great being, the universal good.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i don dang kun du bzang po'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i don dang kun du bzang po'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of Bodhisattva and the meaning of universal good have been explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gang yin pa gdul bya'i dbang gis so sor snang ba'i thugs kyi gnas de na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gang yin pa gdul bya'i dbang gis so sor snang ba'i thugs kyi gnas de na gnas pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the mind of all tathāgatas” and so on means that the body of all tathāgatas is the abode of the mind that appears individually due to the power of those to be trained.

original: de bas na de na bzhugs zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de bas na de na bzhugs zhes bshad de /
translated: Therefore, it is explained that “he abides there.”

original: zla ba'i @17b dkyil 'khor gyi steng na rdo rje sems dpa'i tshul gyis bzhugs par bshad do //
analyzed: zla ba'i @17b dkyil 'khor gyi steng na rdo rje sems dpa'i tshul gyis bzhugs par bshad do //
translated: It is explained that he abides in the form of Vajrasattva on the moon maṇḍala.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi mtshams sbyar ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi mtshams sbyar ba'i phyir te /
translated: Then, because it is the connection of the occasion,

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs so zhes bshad la /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'og min gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas na bzhugs so zhes bshad la /
translated: it is explained that the Bhagavān Vairocana abides in the abode of the king of the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas so zhes bshad na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs la gnas so zhes bshad na /
translated: It is explained that the Bhagavān Mahāvairocana abides in the mind of all tathāgatas.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gang na zhugs te /
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gang na zhugs te /
translated: Well then, where do all the tathāgatas abide?

original: gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du mdzad pa yin zhe na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir dper na til gyi gong bu bzhin du yongs su gang bar gyur to zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gdul bya ji lta ba bzhin du sprul pa'i sku'i dbang du mdzad pa yin zhe na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir dper na til gyi gong bu bzhin du yongs su gang bar gyur to zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is asked, Why is it done from the perspective of the nirmāṇakāya for the disciples just as they are? it is said, All tathāgatas completely fill this buddhafield like sesame seeds in an opened pod.

original: 'di skad ston te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byung bas sems can gyi khams ji tsam na spyod pa de thams cad na bzhugs pa yin pas gnas kyi nyes pa dris pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byung bas sems can gyi khams ji tsam na spyod pa de thams cad na bzhugs pa yin pas gnas kyi nyes pa dris pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: This is explained as follows: Since the tathāgatas appear for the sake of ripening sentient beings, they abide in all the realms of sentient beings, wherever they may be. Therefore, what is the use of asking about the faults of the abode?

original: ye shes dang chos kyi sku gnyis kyis ni thams cad du khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ma bzhengs su zin kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams thams cad du sems can gyi don mdzad par kun du snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: ye shes dang chos kyi sku gnyis kyis ni thams cad du khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ma bzhengs su zin kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas rnams thams cad du sems can gyi don mdzad par kun du snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Since the two kāyas of pristine consciousness and the dharmakāya pervade everything, even though they do not arise, the power of the strength of the previous aspirations of the buddhas appears to benefit all sentient beings.

original: to // de yang /
analyzed: to // de yang /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:

original: skyob pa mya ngan 'das gyur kyang //
analyzed: skyob pa mya ngan 'das gyur kyang //
translated: Even when the protector has passed into nirvāṇa,

original: 'khor lo 'khor ba'i tshul du ni //
analyzed: 'khor lo 'khor ba'i tshul du ni //
translated: the wheel of Dharma will turn in the manner of a wheel.

original: tshogs kyi shugs kyi mthu yis ni //
analyzed: tshogs kyi shugs kyi mthu yis ni //
translated: By the power of the momentum of the accumulations,

original: sems can don la yang dag 'jug / ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o /🔽// / da ni sngags kyi spyad pa spyod pa'i sems can rnams la sngags kyi spyod pa ni /
analyzed: sems can don la yang dag 'jug / ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o / // / da ni sngags kyi spyad pa spyod pa'i sems can rnams la sngags kyi spyod pa ni /
translated: it will engage in the welfare of sentient beings.

original: slob dpon la rag las kyi rang nyid kyis mtshan ma thugs thub tu gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa sngags kyi tshul gyi sgo nas sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi gdams ngag la byang chub rag
analyzed: slob dpon la rag las kyi rang nyid kyis mtshan ma thugs thub tu gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa sngags kyi tshul gyi sgo nas sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyi gdams ngag la byang chub rag
translated: Now, in order to teach that the mantra conduct of sentient beings who practice the mantra conduct depends on the master, and that they should not grasp the signs on their own, the Blessed One, having accomplished all goals, in order to demonstrate the instruction of the past buddhas through the door of the mantra method,

original: las par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: las par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: demonstrated that enlightenment depends on the master.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bshad zin to //
translated: The word “then” has been explained.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams sems can gyi don mdzad pa ni ci so sor mdzad dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams sems can gyi don mdzad pa ni ci so sor mdzad dam /
translated: Did those buddha bhagavāns each perform the welfare of sentient beings?

original: gal te thabs cig pa nyid du mdzad ce na /
analyzed: gal te thabs cig pa nyid du mdzad ce na /
translated: If they are made to be simultaneous,

original: don mtshungs pa nyid dang / smon lam mtshungs pa nyid dang / gdul bya mtshungs pa nyid kyis lhan cig tu mdzad @18a * //
analyzed: don mtshungs pa nyid dang / smon lam mtshungs pa nyid dang / gdul bya mtshungs pa nyid kyis lhan cig tu mdzad @18a * //
translated: they are made to be simultaneous by similarity of object, similarity of vow, and similarity of disciples.

original: de ; de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de ; de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by “then all the Tathagatas gathered together” and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: They are Tathagatas and all of them, so they are all the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi 'dus pa ni 'du bar mdzad cing chags par mdzad pa'o//
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'dus pa ni 'du bar mdzad cing chags par mdzad pa'o//
translated: Their gathering together is their gathering and their attachment.

original: byang chub la sems dpas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub la sems dpas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: They are Bodhisattvas because they have the mind of enlightenment.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don chen po la rab tu 'jug par mdzad pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don chen po la rab tu 'jug par mdzad pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: They are great beings because they engage in the great purpose of the great mass of sentient beings.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po rdzogs pas don thams cad yongs su grub pa bzhed pa tsam la rag las pas na don thams cad grub pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po rdzogs pas don thams cad yongs su grub pa bzhed pa tsam la rag las pas na don thams cad grub pa'o //
translated: They are the fulfillers of all purposes because they have completed the great accumulations of merit and wisdom, and the accomplishment of all purposes depends on their mere wish.

original: byang chub la snying por gyur pa ni byang chub pa'i snying po ste /
analyzed: byang chub la snying por gyur pa ni byang chub pa'i snying po ste /
translated: The heart of enlightenment is the heart of enlightenment because it is the heart of enlightenment.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of manifest enlightenment.

original: de'i gnas kyi snying po zhes bshad de /
analyzed: de'i gnas kyi snying po zhes bshad de /
translated: It is explained as the heart of its abode.

original: sa thams cad kyi steng na 'dug pas zho'i spris ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sa thams cad kyi steng na 'dug pas zho'i spris ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the cream of yogurt, since it is situated above all the stages.

original: der zhugs pa ni gnas par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: der zhugs pa ni gnas par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The one who enters there is the one who abides there.

original: bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa sh'akya'i rigs su skye ba yongs su bzhes nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das don thams cad grub pa sh'akya'i rigs su skye ba yongs su bzhes nas /
translated: The Lord, having accomplished all aims, having taken birth in the Shakya lineage,🔽having demonstrated the sports of a youth, the learning of crafts, life in the retinue of queens, renunciation, and the going forth, having taught the Dharma, and having demonstrated the great enlightenment,

original: gzhon nu rol pa dang / bzo bstan pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba yang bstan nas sems can sngon yongs su smin par byas pa mir skye ba rnams dang ;
analyzed: gzhon nu rol pa dang / bzo bstan pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par byung ba dang / rab tu byung ba yang bstan nas sems can sngon yongs su smin par byas pa mir skye ba rnams dang ;
translated: having demonstrated the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, and having demonstrated the great parinirvana,

original: sku tshe yang dag par 'brel pa la sogs pas don mdzad pa'i phyir dang / mu stegs kyi lta ba la mngon par zhen cing dka' bar spyod pas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes mngon par rlom pa rnams la mngon pa'i nga rgyal gzhom pa'i phyir dka' bar spyod pa mdzad par yang bstan te /🔽dka' bar spyod pa'i sa nyid la byin gyi rlabs kyis mi'i lus bzhag nas rdzu 'phrul gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas su gshegs te /
analyzed: sku tshe yang dag par 'brel pa la sogs pas don mdzad pa'i phyir dang / mu stegs kyi lta ba la mngon par zhen cing dka' bar spyod pas grol bar 'gyur ro zhes mngon par rlom pa rnams la mngon pa'i nga rgyal gzhom pa'i phyir dka' bar spyod pa mdzad par yang bstan te / dka' bar spyod pa'i sa nyid la byin gyi rlabs kyis mi'i lus bzhag nas rdzu 'phrul gyi lha'i rgyal po'i gnas su gshegs te /
translated: He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to conquer the pride of those who are attached to tīrthika views and who arrogantly claim that they will be liberated by difficult conduct.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to benefit those with pure karmic connections and so on.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to conquer the pride of those who are attached to tīrthika views and who arrogantly claim that they will be liberated by difficult conduct.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to benefit those with pure karmic connections and so on.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to conquer the pride of those who are attached to tīrthika views and who arrogantly claim that they will be liberated by difficult conduct.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to benefit those with pure karmic connections and so on.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin lta bu la snyoms par zhugs nas 'og min gyi gnas🔽na zhugs pa gang na ba der gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin lta bu la snyoms par zhugs nas 'og min gyi gnas🔽na zhugs pa gang na ba der gshegs pa ste /
translated: He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to conquer the pride of those who are attached to tīrthika views and who arrogantly claim that they will be liberated by difficult conduct.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to benefit those with pure karmic connections and so on.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to conquer the pride of those who are attached to tīrthika views and who arrogantly claim that they will be liberated by difficult conduct.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to benefit those with pure karmic connections and so on.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to conquer the pride of those who are attached to tīrthika views and who arrogantly claim that they will be liberated by difficult conduct.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to benefit those with pure karmic connections and so on.🔽He demonstrated difficult conduct in order to conquer the pride of those who are attached to tīrthika views and who arrogantly claim that they will be liberated by difficult conduct.

original: der bzhud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der bzhud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “having gone” is having arrived.🔽Having gone and arrived, he displayed the complete enjoyment body.

original: gshegs te byon nas ched du rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku bstan nas zhes bya ba la rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku ni chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gshegs te byon nas ched du rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku bstan nas zhes bya ba la rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku ni chos kyi longs spyod rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The complete enjoyment body is for the enjoyment of the Dharma.

original: rnam @18b par dag pa rnams la /
analyzed: rnam @18b par dag pa rnams la /
translated: For those who are pure,

original: rnam par dag pa rang gi so sor snang ba bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rang gi so sor snang ba bskyed pa ste /
translated: the pure appearances of each individual are generated.🔽As it is explained:

original: gcig la gcig gi dbang gis na //🔽rnam par rig pa phan tshun nges //
analyzed: gcig la gcig gi dbang gis na // rnam par rig pa phan tshun nges //
translated: By the power of each other,

original: zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: the consciousnesses are mutually ascertained.

original: de yang yongs su dag pa'i slob ma gcig la so sor snang ba gnyis pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don bstan par nus pa'i bla mar snang ba'i rdzogs longs spyod pas yid tshim par mdzad pa'i phyir rdzogs longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang yongs su dag pa'i slob ma gcig la so sor snang ba gnyis pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don bstan par nus pa'i bla mar snang ba'i rdzogs longs spyod pas yid tshim par mdzad pa'i phyir rdzogs longs spyod pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the complete enjoyment body is able to display the desired meaning of the two individual appearances to a single pure disciple, and it satisfies the mind with the appearance of the guru.

original: rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku de'i snang ba bstan nas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku de'i snang ba bstan nas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Having displayed the appearance of that complete enjoyment body, he spoke thus.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mngon par ma rtogs par dka' ba spyad pa thams cad la spro ba bskyed cing /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid mngon par ma rtogs par dka' ba spyad pa thams cad la spro ba bskyed cing /
translated: Son of noble family, why do you generate enthusiasm for all austerities without realizing the thatness of all tathāgatas?🔽How will you fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment?”

original: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par bya snyam zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid de so sor rtogs pa
analyzed: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par bya snyam zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid de so sor rtogs pa
translated: The thatness of all tathāgatas is the thatness of all tathāgatas.🔽Having understood that these three realms are mind only, the form of the moon maṇḍala purifies and perfects his intention,

original: yin pas khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes shes nas de'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dag zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs kyis bya ba dang / de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su dag pa ye shes kyi rdo rjes byin gyis brlab pa dang /
analyzed: yin pas khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes shes nas de'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dag zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs kyis bya ba dang / de'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su dag pa ye shes kyi rdo rjes byin gyis brlab pa dang /
translated: and the vajra of pristine consciousness blesses his completely pure accumulation of merit.

original: der yang bdag gi ngo bo nyid du lhag par mos pa dang / der yang sangs rgyas kyi khams bzhugs pa dang / der yang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: der yang bdag gi ngo bo nyid du lhag par mos pa dang / der yang sangs rgyas kyi khams bzhugs pa dang / der yang sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su bsgom pa ste /
translated: that the buddha nature abides in that; and that one meditates on that as the form of the Buddha.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni kun du bzang po'i sa la 'jug pa'i tshul te /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni kun du bzang po'i sa la 'jug pa'i tshul te /
translated: This is the way to enter the stage of Samantabhadra, which is the characteristic of the complete transformation.

original: ji ltar sngon yongs su smin pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad par spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar sngon yongs su smin pa'i sems can rnams kyi don mdzad par spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The activity of benefiting sentient beings who are already matured is the reality of all the Tathagatas.

original: de mngon par ma rtogs pa ni yongs su ma shes par dka' ba spyod pa thams cad la spro ba bskyed ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de mngon par ma rtogs pa ni yongs su ma shes par dka' ba spyod pa thams cad la spro ba bskyed ces gsungs te /
translated: The non-realization of that is the non-understanding of that, and it is said that one should generate enthusiasm for all the practices of austerities.

original: dka' ba ni mi'i 'jig rten 'dir dka' ba spyod pa nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba ni mi'i 'jig rten 'dir dka' ba spyod pa nyams su len pa'o //
translated: Austerity is the practice of austerities in this human world.

original: der yang mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed la rnal 'byor pa gang mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas na /
analyzed: der yang mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed la rnal 'byor pa gang mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas na /
translated: Moreover, one should manifest the immovable samadhi. If a yogi abides in the immovable samadhi,

original: rgyal ba bzhin du dbugs rngub par mi byed /
analyzed: rgyal ba bzhin du dbugs rngub par mi byed /
translated: He did not inhale like a victor.

original: dbugs 'byin par mi byed /🔽g-yo bar mi byed /
analyzed: dbugs 'byin par mi byed / g-yo bar mi byed /
translated: He did not exhale.🔽He did not move.

original: 'gul bar mi byed /
analyzed: 'gul bar mi byed /
translated: He did not shake.

original: 'gyur bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'gyur bar mi byed cing /
translated: He did not change.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa las 'das te @19a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa las 'das te @19a * //
translated: He remained beyond the conduct of body, speech, and mind.

original: gnas so // gnas kyi khyad par de la gnas na sems can rnams kyi don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams kyis bslang bar gyur to //
analyzed: gnas so // gnas kyi khyad par de la gnas na sems can rnams kyi don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de rnams kyis bslang bar gyur to //
translated: Since he was unable to benefit sentient beings while remaining in that special state, he was roused by those Bhagavān Buddhas.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don thams cad grub pa la de rnams kyis bskul ba'i rjes thogs nyid la mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs te /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don thams cad grub pa la de rnams kyis bskul ba'i rjes thogs nyid la mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin de las bzhengs te /
translated: Then, immediately after being roused by them, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvārthasiddha arose from that immovable samādhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dud cing phyag byas nas bos te 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dud cing phyag byas nas bos te 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Bowing and prostrating to all tathāgatas, he asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de kho na nyid ni ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de kho na nyid ni ji lta bu lags /
translated: Bhagavāns, what is the suchness of the tathāgatas?

original: ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub par bgyi zhes pa ni /
translated: How should it be accomplished?

original: rnam pa gang gis nyams su blang bar bgyi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis nyams su blang bar bgyi zhes pa'o //
translated: By what aspects should it be practiced?”

original: de dag thams cad kyang slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: All of these [questions] indicate the relationship between the master and the disciple.

original: sngags spyad pa'i tshul la ye shes dang / dam tshig gi mtshan nyid dang / dbang bskur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rtogs pa dang / sems can rnams kyi don bya ba ni slob dpon la rag las pa yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: sngags spyad pa'i tshul la ye shes dang / dam tshig gi mtshan nyid dang / dbang bskur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rtogs pa dang / sems can rnams kyi don bya ba ni slob dpon la rag las pa yin no zhes ston te /
translated: It shows that the knowledge of the way of practicing mantra, the characteristics of the pledges, the conferral of empowerment, the realization of omniscient knowledge, and the performance of the welfare of sentient beings all depend on the master.

original: rang dga'i thugs thub dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa rnams la ni sngags spyad kyang dngos grub tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang dga'i thugs thub dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa rnams la ni sngags spyad kyang dngos grub tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is taught that for those who are self-willed and do not respect the guru, even if they practice mantra, they will not attain spiritual powers.

original: de ltar slob ma slob ma'i yon tan dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de ltar slob ma slob ma'i yon tan dang ldan zhing /
translated: Thus, the disciple should possess the qualities of a disciple,

original: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar nus shing /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su smin pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar nus shing /
translated: have fully ripened faculties, and be able to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: bka' stsal pa tshol ba la gcig tu brtson pa de la ni de bzhin gshegs pa snang ba'i lam du gshegs pa ji snyed pa de rnams kyis gsung dbyangs gcig gis 'di skad ces bka' stsal pa'o //

original: gsung gcig tu zhes bya ba ni gsung gcig pa nyid yin pas na gsung gcig ste /🔽thos pa gcig pa dang / don gcig pas na dbyangs gcig tu byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: gsung gcig tu zhes bya ba ni gsung gcig pa nyid yin pas na gsung gcig ste / thos pa gcig pa dang / don gcig pas na dbyangs gcig tu byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The same voice will say to them, ‘You should not seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should not seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should seek the Dharma in this way.’

original: mang po zhig gis gsung dbyangs kyang sgra gcig dang 'dra bar thos pas na gsung gcig tu bka' stsal pa ste //
analyzed: mang po zhig gis gsung dbyangs kyang sgra gcig dang 'dra bar thos pas na gsung gcig tu bka' stsal pa ste //
translated: The same voice will say to them, ‘You should not seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should not seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should not seek the Dharma in this way.’

original: gsung gcig pa zhes bya ba mgur gcig tu mngon pa byang chub pa'i rim pa nye bar ston par mdzad pa'o //🔽gal te mngon par byang chub pa gzhan gyi man ngag la ltos dgos na /
analyzed: gsung gcig pa zhes bya ba mgur gcig tu mngon pa byang chub pa'i rim pa nye bar ston par mdzad pa'o //🔽gal te mngon par byang chub pa gzhan gyi man ngag la ltos dgos na /
translated: The same voice will say to them, ‘You should seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should not seek the Dharma in this way.’🔽The same voice will say to them, ‘You should seek

original: de lta na ni bcom ldan 'das bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas slob dpon @19b med pa'i ye shes su ji ltar bzhag ce na /
analyzed: de lta na ni bcom ldan 'das bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pas slob dpon @19b med pa'i ye shes su ji ltar bzhag ce na /
translated: In that case, how can the Lord be posited as having intuitive wisdom without a teacher, since his accumulations of merit and direct intuition are complete?

original: gang 'di bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' don thams cad grub pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa ni rgyu'i gnas skabs yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi //
analyzed: gang 'di bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa' don thams cad grub pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa ni rgyu'i gnas skabs yongs su rdzogs pa yin gyi //
translated: The Lord, the bodhisattva who has accomplished all the aims and whose accumulations of merit and direct intuition are complete, is complete in the causal state,

original: de'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i gnas skabs yongs su rdzogs pa ma yin te /
translated: but not complete in the resultant state.

original: de'i phyir lung ma nod pa gzung ba rigs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung ma nod pa gzung ba rigs pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to accept that he is not omniscient.

original: gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi rnams kyi don rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir mngon par byang chub par ston pa de'i tshe slob dpon med pa'i ye shes can du gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i mi rnams kyi don rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir mngon par byang chub par ston pa de'i tshe slob dpon med pa'i ye shes can du gzhag pa yin no //
translated: But when he demonstrates full enlightenment in order to accomplish the aims of the people of Jambudvipa, then he is posited as having intuitive wisdom without a teacher.

original: ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this accomplished?

original: rang gi sems la rtog cing mnyam par zhog la zhes bya ba smos pa la /
analyzed: rang gi sems la rtog cing mnyam par zhog la zhes bya ba smos pa la /
translated: He says, “contemplate your own mind and rest in equipoise.”

original: rang gi sems yin pas rang gi sems te /
analyzed: rang gi sems yin pas rang gi sems te /
translated: It is one's own mind, because it is one's own mind.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the mental consciousness.

original: de'i so sor rtog pa ni so sor rtog pa ste don la so sor rtog pas so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i so sor rtog pa ni so sor rtog pa ste don la so sor rtog pas so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Its discernment is discernment, because it discerns objects.

original: de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid la so sor rnam par dpyad pa na /
analyzed: de yang gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid la so sor rnam par dpyad pa na /
translated: Moreover, when one analyzes the characteristics of the aggregates of form, etc.,

original: de ni gcig na'ang yul min la //
analyzed: de ni gcig na'ang yul min la //
translated: If it is one, it is not an object.

original: phra rab rdul du du ma'ang min //
analyzed: phra rab rdul du du ma'ang min //
translated: If it is many, it is not an atom.

original: de dag 'dus pa'ang ma yin te //
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa'ang ma yin te //
translated: It is not a composite,

original: 'di ltar rdul phran mi 'grub phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdul phran mi 'grub phyir //
translated: because atoms are not established.

original: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar bas na //
translated: When six are simultaneously joined,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the atom has six parts.

original: drug po dag gi go gcig na //
analyzed: drug po dag gi go gcig na //
translated: If the six are in one place,

original: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gong bu rdul phran tsam du 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the composite is only an atom.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i tshul gyis na dmigs pa dang mi ldan pas na 'di dag ni sems tsam nyid do zhes nges pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i tshul gyis na dmigs pa dang mi ldan pas na 'di dag ni sems tsam nyid do zhes nges pa yin la /
translated: Thus, by this and other methods, one ascertains that these are only mind, because they do not possess objects.

original: so sor rtog pa ni nges pa'i don 'di nyid la bsgom pa na /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa ni nges pa'i don 'di nyid la bsgom pa na /
translated: When one meditates on this very definitive meaning with discernment,

original: sems rtse gcig pa thob pa ni sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa thob pa ni sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: The attainment of one-pointedness of mind is the discernment and equipoise of mind.

original: rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par 'jog pa 'ba' zhig gis bsgrub par ma zad kyi sngags bzlas pas kyang 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par 'jog pa 'ba' zhig gis bsgrub par ma zad kyi sngags bzlas pas kyang 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Not only is it accomplished by the discernment and equipoise of one's own mind alone, but it is also taught that it is accomplished by the recitation of mantras.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pas na rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste 'di ni ngag gis kyang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pas na rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste 'di ni ngag gis kyang bsgrub par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Since it is naturally accomplished, it is naturally accomplished. This is not to be accomplished even by speech.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa kho na'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis grub pa kho na'o zhes ston to //
translated: It is taught that it is accomplished by its very nature alone.

original: ci dgar bzlas shing zhes bya ba ji srid 'dod par bzlas pas so //
analyzed: ci dgar bzlas shing zhes bya ba ji srid 'dod par bzlas pas so //
translated: Reciting as one wishes means reciting for as long as one desires.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: 'dir ni bsgom pa nyid la shin tu 'bad par bya'i bzlas brjod la ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsgom pa nyid la shin tu 'bad par bya'i bzlas brjod la ma yin no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that here one should strive only in meditation, not in recitation,

original: ci dgar bzlas shing zhes gsungs so //🔽sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni nan @20a * //
analyzed: ci dgar bzlas shing zhes gsungs so // sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni nan @20a * //
translated: it is said, Reciting as one wishes.

original: tan du bsgrub par gyis shig pa'o /
analyzed: tan du bsgrub par gyis shig pa'o /
translated: Practice means practice with perseverance.

original: // / da ni so sor rtogs par byas nas 'khor ba'i dngos po las dang nyon mongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i gzugs can gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po nges par bzlog par rnam par bsgoms nas don dam pa so sor rtogs pas rgyu mthun pa'i bdag gi ngo
analyzed: // / da ni so sor rtogs par byas nas 'khor ba'i dngos po las dang nyon mongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i gzugs can gyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po nges par bzlog par rnam par bsgoms nas don dam pa so sor rtogs pas rgyu mthun pa'i bdag gi ngo
translated: Now, having understood this, one should definitely reverse the entity that is the nature of the ripening of karma and afflictions from the things of cyclic existence. Having cultivated this, one should understand the ultimate nature of the self that is the natural outflow of the realization of the ultimate.🔽

original: bor rnam par dag pa bsgrub pa'i phyir bdag gis rtogs so zhes bya ba ston te /
analyzed: bor rnam par dag pa bsgrub pa'i phyir bdag gis rtogs so zhes bya ba ston te /
translated: Now, having understood individually, having thoroughly cultivated the definite reversal of the entity of cyclic existence, the entity having the nature of the form of the ripening of karma and afflictions, in order to establish the purification that is the nature of the natural outflow of the understanding of the ultimate, it is said, “I have realized.”

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: “I” means by myself.
