original: rtogs so zhes bya ba ni kun nas rtogs shing ji skad bstan pa bzhin du khong du chud do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtogs so zhes bya ba ni kun nas rtogs shing ji skad bstan pa bzhin du khong du chud do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Realized” means completely realized, understood just as it is taught.

original: da ni rang gi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi tshul bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag gi snying ga na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rang gi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi tshul bstan par bya ba'i phyir bdag gi snying ga na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the way of one’s own wisdom, it is said, “In my heart center,” and so on.

original: bdag gi snying ga ni rang gi sems la bya ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su dag cing gnas gyur pa /
analyzed: bdag gi snying ga ni rang gi sems la bya ste kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su dag cing gnas gyur pa /
translated: “My heart center” refers to one’s mind, the completely pure and transformed all-basis consciousness.

original: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi tshul du gyur pa la me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can rang gi sems de la bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bsags pa de la gnas pa gzugs kyi sku yongs su
analyzed: me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi tshul du gyur pa la me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid can rang gi sems de la bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bsags pa de la gnas pa gzugs kyi sku yongs su
translated: In the manner of mirror-like primordial wisdom, the mind that has the characteristic of mirror-like primordial wisdom, which has been completely accumulated as the accumulation of merit for three incalculable aeons, arises as the seed of the completely pure form body.

original: dag pa'i sa bon dang 'dra bar shar ba tsam gyis sems can gyi khams kyi rang bzhin tshim par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs de gong nas gong du rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu yin pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta🔽bu zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dag pa'i sa bon dang 'dra bar shar ba tsam gyis sems can gyi khams kyi rang bzhin tshim par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs de gong nas gong du rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu yin pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes gsungs te /
translated: By merely satisfying the nature of the realm of sentient beings with the form of conceptual thoughts, that conceptual cause of the form body increases more and more, like the moon's orb.🔽Therefore, it is said to be like the moon's orb.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang cha 'dra bar mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang cha 'dra bar mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that it is seen to be similar to the moon's orb.

original: rnal 'byor pa sems la dbang thob pa rnams la bdag dang gzhan la brten pa'i sprul pa rnams ji ltar 'dod par 'byin par 'gyur bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa sems la dbang thob pa rnams la bdag dang gzhan la brten pa'i sprul pa rnams ji ltar 'dod par 'byin par 'gyur bar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ston par mdzad pa'i phyir rigs kyi bu sems 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te
translated: For the yogis who have attained mastery over mind, emanations based on self and others are produced just as they wish.

original: / rigs zhes bya ba ni ngan pa'i skyes bu dang 'brel pa yod par zhu bar gyur pas na rigs te rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / rigs zhes bya ba ni ngan pa'i skyes bu dang 'brel pa yod par zhu bar gyur pas na rigs te rgyal rigs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The term “son of good lineage” means a son who is related to a good person, a son of good lineage, such as a member of the warrior class.

original: de gtsang zhing dag par byed la 'khor ba las skyob par byad pa'i don gyis na bu ste rigs kyi bu yin pas na rigs kyi bu'o //
analyzed: de gtsang zhing dag par byed la 'khor ba las skyob par byad pa'i don gyis na bu ste rigs kyi bu yin pas na rigs kyi bu'o //
translated: He is a son in the sense that he is pure and purifying, and he protects from cyclic existence.

original: sems 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sems 'di'o //
analyzed: sems 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sems 'di'o //
translated: This mind is naturally luminous, naturally luminous,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid kyis shin tu 'od gsal bas na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ni rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid kyis shin tu 'od gsal bas na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: because it is very luminous by nature, by essence.

original: ngo bo nyid @20b kyis dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid @20b kyis dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is naturally stainless.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sems dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni sems dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with the mind.

original: ji ltar sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis yongs su sbyangs shing gzhi dang 'brel par nye bar sbyar na sems de de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis yongs su sbyangs shing gzhi dang 'brel par nye bar sbyar na sems de de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: How is it purified? By what kind of purification is the mind connected with the basis?

original: rang gi gnas ji ltar snang bzhin du so sor snang ba 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi gnas ji ltar snang bzhin du so sor snang ba 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It becomes just so, as its own place appears, it comes to apprehend the appearance. This is the meaning.

original: don 'di nyid dpes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid dpes gsal bar bya ba'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to make this very meaning clear through an example, he says, for example, etc.

original: dper na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The word for example indicates the example.

original: dkar po ni rnam par dag pa la bya ste /
analyzed: dkar po ni rnam par dag pa la bya ste /
translated: White is to be taken as pure,

original: dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir 'di dang mthun pa'i dpe ras bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir 'di dang mthun pa'i dpe ras bstan pa yin no //
translated: because it is free from stain. The cloth is the example that corresponds to this.

original: de bas na ji ltar ras rnam par dag pa la tshon gang dang gang yin pa dang phrad par gyur pa de dang de nyid der shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar ras rnam par dag pa la tshon gang dang gang yin pa dang phrad par gyur pa de dang de nyid der shin tu gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as the pure cloth, whatever dye it comes into contact with, that very dye becomes very clear in it.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dang bral zhing /
translated: Likewise, free from all the stains of afflictions,

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems la snying rjes sems can gyi don byed par nus te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems la snying rjes sems can gyi don byed par nus te /
translated: the naturally luminous mind is able to perform the welfare of sentient beings with compassion.

original: lus dang longs spyod rnam par dag pa la sogs pa gang dang gang la gtod pa de dang de nyid der shin tu gsal bar 'gyur te 'di ni dpes bstan pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod rnam par dag pa la sogs pa gang dang gang la gtod pa de dang de nyid der shin tu gsal bar 'gyur te 'di ni dpes bstan pa'i don yin no //
translated: Whatever is directed to the pure body, enjoyments, and so forth, that very thing becomes extremely clear. This is the meaning indicated by the example.

original: bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa slar yang lung dbog pa gzhan yang sbyin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bya ba yongs su ma rdzogs pa slar yang lung dbog pa gzhan yang sbyin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to give again the prediction of the one whose activity is not yet complete,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “thereupon” and so forth.

original: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni de ma thag tu'o //
translated: The word “thereupon” means immediately.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The naturally luminous mind has been taught previously.

original: de'i rgyas par bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyas par bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Its expansion is its completion.

original: de'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva generated the mind of enlightenment again.

original: de la byang chub kyi sems ni 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas kyis kun du bzang po'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems bskyed par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la byang chub kyi sems ni 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin sangs rgyas kyis kun du bzang po'i mtshan nyid can gyi sems bskyed par gyur pa ste /
translated: Here, the enlightenment mind is the generation of the mind that has the nature of the result of the ten bodhisattva stages, the enlightenment of a buddha, which has the characteristic of being completely good.

original: byang chub kyang yin la sems kyang yin pas na byang chub kyi sems te /
analyzed: byang chub kyang yin la sems kyang yin pas na byang chub kyi sems te /
translated: It is enlightenment and it is mind, and so it is the enlightenment mind.

original: de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir lung dbog pa stsal bar gyur la /
analyzed: de bskyed par bya ba'i phyir lung dbog pa stsal bar gyur la /
translated: In order to generate that, the Buddha gave the prediction.

original: byang chub sems dpas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi lung phog pa de'i rjes thogs nyid la sems de yongs su sbyangs shing rdzogs par mdzad na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi lung phog pa de'i rjes thogs nyid la sems de yongs su sbyangs shing rdzogs par mdzad na /
translated: And the bodhisattva, immediately after the Blessed One gave the prediction, purified and perfected that mind.

original: nyid kyi thugs su chud cing bskyed pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gi tshogs nye bar dgod pa gsungs pa yin te @21a * //
analyzed: nyid kyi thugs su chud cing bskyed pa brjod par bya ba'i phyir zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gi tshogs nye bar dgod pa gsungs pa yin te @21a * //
translated: In order to express the generation of the mind that he had realized, he set forth the collection of scriptures beginning with “like a disk of the moon.”

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur sems gang gsungs pa de zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid du mthong ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur sems gang gsungs pa de zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid du mthong ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind that is like the orb of the moon is seen as the orb of the moon itself.

original: sems gang tshes gcig pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur snang ba don bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis ston ka'i tshes bco lnga'i zla ba lta bur so sor snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems gang tshes gcig pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur snang ba don bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis ston ka'i tshes bco lnga'i zla ba lta bur so sor snang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mind that appears like the orb of the moon on the first day of the month appears individually like the moon of the fifteenth day of the autumn month through the power of meditation on the meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis de la thugs su chud pa brnyes pa bsgom pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis de la thugs su chud pa brnyes pa bsgom pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to attain the realization of all the Tathagatas, he says the essence of all the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po ste thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Since it is the mind of all the Tathagatas, it is the essence of all the Tathagatas, the gnosis of omniscience.

original: sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud pa'i mtshan nyid la bya'i /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud pa'i mtshan nyid la bya'i /
translated: The generation of the mind should be understood as having the nature of realization.

original: so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la yang dag par blangs pa dang brdar brtags pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang ma yin la yang dag par blangs pa dang brdar brtags pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the characteristic of discrimination, nor is it the correct assumption or the conventional designation.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir kun du bzang po zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir kun du bzang po zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is said to be Samantabhadra because it is the wisdom of omniscience.

original: kun nas bzang ba nyid yin pas na kun du bzang po ste /
analyzed: kun nas bzang ba nyid yin pas na kun du bzang po ste /
translated: Since it is completely good, it is Samantabhadra.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is free from the stains of the afflictive and knowledge obscurations.

original: mngon sum du gyur gyis zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa nyid brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur gyis zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa nyid brnyes pa'o //
translated: It is said become manifest because it is the attainment of equality.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lhan cig mtshungs pa nyid brnyes pa ste de'i phyir legs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lhan cig mtshungs pa nyid brnyes pa ste de'i phyir legs pa ste /
translated: Because it is the attainment of equality with all the Tathagatas, therefore it is good.

original: khyad par can du sgrubs shig pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par can du sgrubs shig pa ste /
translated: It is to be accomplished as special.

original: nyams su long shig pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su long shig pa'o //
translated: It is to be experienced.

original: ci'i phyir legs par sgrubs shig ces phyogs snga ma rtog pa la de bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir legs par sgrubs shig ces phyogs snga ma rtog pa la de bstan par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Why is it to be accomplished as good? In order to show that to the opponent's conception, it is said because it is to be shown.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i sems bskyed pa ste /
translated: That is the just-explained generation of the Thought,

original: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin can gyi byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: the nature of which is the spirit of enlightenment.

original: brtan par bya ba ni 'khor ba ji srid par rgyun du bzhugs pa la ste /
analyzed: brtan par bya ba ni 'khor ba ji srid par rgyun du bzhugs pa la ste /
translated: It is to be stabilized in the continuum, to be present continuously for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro //
translated: For that reason,

original: de'i rgyud rang gi sems kyi snang ba yongs su dag pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje'i dbyibs su soms shig ces bya ba rang gi snying ga ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyud rang gi sems kyi snang ba yongs su dag pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje'i dbyibs su soms shig ces bya ba rang gi snying ga ste /
translated: in one's heart, one should imagine the form of a vajra on the moon-disk of the merit-collection, which is the appearance of one's own mind, which is completely pure.

original: rang gi sems la bsod nams kyi tshogs zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid du gzung ba'i cha shas la ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su dag pa'i rdo rje'i dbyibs su soms shig ces pa ste sgoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems la bsod nams kyi tshogs zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid du gzung ba'i cha shas la ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su dag pa'i rdo rje'i dbyibs su soms shig ces pa ste sgoms shig pa'o //
translated: In one's mind, one should imagine the form of a vajra on the part of the moon-disk that is the nature of the merit-collection, which is the completely pure form of the collection of intuition.🔽One should imagine it, one should meditate on it.

original: ji ltar bsgom par bya zhes phyogs snga ma rtog pa la sngags 'dis zhes bya ba @21b gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom par bya zhes phyogs snga ma rtog pa la sngags 'dis zhes bya ba @21b gsungs so //
translated: How should one meditate? In response to this question, [the Bhagavān] declares, With this mantra.

original: slar yang byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis thugs su chud par bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: slar yang byang chub sems dpa' nyid kyis thugs su chud par bstan pa ni bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, the understanding by the Bodhisattva himself is taught: the Bhagavat, etc.

original: lung ji skad du phog pa bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lung ji skad du phog pa bzhin rtogs pa'i phyir mthong ngo zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says “I see” because he understands just as the scripture states.

original: thugs su chud pa da dung du yang ma rdzogs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir brtan par gyis shig ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: thugs su chud pa da dung du yang ma rdzogs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir brtan par gyis shig ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that the understanding is still not complete, he says “be firm,” etc.

original: 'di'i brtan par bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis lhag par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i brtan par bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshul gyis lhag par mos par bya'o //
translated: Here, “firm” means to be devoted by way of one’s own nature.

original: ji ltar brtan par bya zhes 'dir rtog pa la sngags 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'di skad bstan te bdag gi rdo rje gang yin pa de ni bdag yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar brtan par bya zhes 'dir rtog pa la sngags 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // 'di skad bstan te bdag gi rdo rje gang yin pa de ni bdag yin la /
translated: “How should one be firm?” In this regard, he says “with this mantra,” etc.🔽This is taught: “Whatever is my vajra, that is myself;

original: bdag gang yin pa de ni rdo rje yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gang yin pa de ni rdo rje yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: whatever is myself, that is the vajra.”

original: rdo rje bdag nyid can la phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba rnams rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin na 'dir ji ltar na lus kyi rgyu med par bdag gi dngos po 'grub par 'gyur zhes phyogs snga ma
analyzed: rdo rje bdag nyid can la phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba rnams rdul phra rab 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bdag gi ngo bo nyid yin na 'dir ji ltar na lus kyi rgyu med par bdag gi dngos po 'grub par 'gyur zhes phyogs snga ma
translated: To those who say that the nature of the self is the nature of the collection of subtle particles, the opponent says, How can the entity of the self be established without a cause for the body?

original: rtog pa la de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag pa ste //
analyzed: rtog pa la de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das ma thag pa ste //
translated: Then, etc.

original: sngags bzlas pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas pa'i rjes thogs nyid la'o //
translated: The word then is immediately after the mantra recitation.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du yang dag par rtogs pa mnyam par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du mnyam par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du yang dag par rtogs pa mnyam par 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du mnyam par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The one who is fully engaged in the entire realm of space is fully engaged in the entire realm of space.

original: de lta bu su zhig yin zhes rnam par rtog pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de lta bu su zhig yin zhes rnam par rtog pa la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: To the thought Who is such a one? it is said, the realm of the vajra body, speech, and mind of all tathāgatas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku phra mo rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku phra mo rnams ni sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings so //
translated: The subtle emanation bodies of the Buddhas are the realm of the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: di rnams ci zhig tu gyur zhe na /
analyzed: di rnams ci zhig tu gyur zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is said, “the vajra being enters there.”

original: gang gi mthus shen de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi mthus shen de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: By whose power? It is said, “by the blessing of all the Tathagatas.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgra ni 'dir mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bzhi zung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgra ni 'dir mi bskyod pa la sogs pa bzhi zung ngo //
translated: The sound of all the Tathagatas here is the four pairs, Akshobhya, etc.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni mthu la bya ste /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni mthu la bya ste /
translated: Blessing is to be taken as power,

original: dper na khab len gyis lcags 'dren par nus pa bzhin du de rnams der zhugs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: dper na khab len gyis lcags 'dren par nus pa bzhin du de rnams der zhugs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: just as a magnet has the power to attract iron, so they enter there.

original: sems dpa' ni kun du bzang po'i thugs so //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni kun du bzang po'i thugs so //
translated: The being is Samantabhadra’s mind.

original: de'i steng du ye shes kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du ye shes kyi rdo rje ni rdo rje ste /
translated: Above that, the vajra of wisdom is the vajra.

original: sems dpa' dang rdo rje ni sems dpa' rdo rje'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' dang rdo rje ni sems dpa' rdo rje'o //
translated: The being and the vajra are the vajra being.

original: de yang 'di ni rdo rje sems ma'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de yang 'di ni rdo rje sems ma'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: Moreover, this is the seal of Vajrasattva.

original: @22a * // 'og nas bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi yum ste /
analyzed: @22a * // 'og nas bshad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs kyi yum ste /
translated: She is the mother of the family of all the transcendent lords, as will be explained below.

original: der de lta bu'i gzugs kyis sems dpa'i rdo rjer zhugs so //
analyzed: der de lta bu'i gzugs kyis sems dpa'i rdo rjer zhugs so //
translated: In that form, she entered into the spiritual hero's vajra.

original: yang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa 'di sngags spyad pa rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa 'di sngags spyad pa rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that this stage of manifest enlightenment is suitable for those who practice mantra, he says, Then, the transcendent lords, etc.

original: kun du bzang po'i sems bskyed pa ni dkyil 'khor du bzhugs pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin la /🔽de'i steng gi rdo rje ni rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba'i gnas su gyur pa yin no /
analyzed: kun du bzang po'i sems bskyed pa ni dkyil 'khor du bzhugs pa'i gnas su gyur pa yin la / de'i steng gi rdo rje ni rdo rje'i dbang bskur ba'i gnas su gyur pa yin no /
translated: The generation of the mind of Samantabhadra is the site of the mandala.🔽The vajra above that is the site of the consecration of the vajra.

original: da ni rdo rje dbyings rdo rje dbyings zhes ming gi dbang bskur ba stsol bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni rdo rje dbyings rdo rje dbyings zhes ming gi dbang bskur ba stsol bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: Now, the bestowal of the name consecration of the vajra element, vajradhātu, has occurred.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i khams rnams yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje'i rgyu rnams 'di yin pas na rdo rje'i dbyings zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i khams rnams yongs su gyur pa'i rdo rje'i rgyu rnams 'di yin pas na rdo rje'i dbyings zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rgyu'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The word vajra realm is a synonym for the cause, since it is the cause of the vajra, which is the transformation of the vajra-elements of the body, speech, and mind of all the Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of vajra has been explained.

original: rdo rjes mtshan pa'i ming ni rdo rje'i ming ste /
analyzed: rdo rjes mtshan pa'i ming ni rdo rje'i ming ste /
translated: The name vajra is the name of the vajra.

original: rdo rje'i ming des khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i ming des khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: It is the consecration as the Dharma King of the three realms by that vajra-name.

original: bla ma'i drin gyis gzi byin bskyed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir rigs kyi mtshan mas byang chub sems dpa' chen po don thams cad grub pa de nyid la rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad do //🔽de ni 'di nyid kyi thugs su chud pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bla ma'i drin gyis gzi byin bskyed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir rigs kyi mtshan mas byang chub sems dpa' chen po don thams cad grub pa de nyid la rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba'i sgrar bshad do // de ni 'di nyid kyi thugs su chud pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since it is connected with the generation of splendor by the grace of the guru, the name of the family is explained as the word vajra realm for that great bodhisattva, the Accomplisher of All Deeds.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the realization of just that, it is said, Then, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ni bdag lags par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku yang dag par bsdus pa'i gzugs su rang gi lus mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'di skad ston te rdo rje'i gzugs su nga rgyal gyis yongs su gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs par gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i rdul phra rab las bsgrub pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa las
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ni bdag lags par mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku yang dag par bsdus pa'i gzugs su rang gi lus mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // 'di skad ston te rdo rje'i gzugs su nga rgyal gyis yongs su gzung ba gang yin pa de nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bzhugs par gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i rdul phra rab las bsgrub pa'i rdo rje rtse lnga pa las
translated: I see the body of all the Tathagatas as my own body.🔽This means that he sees his own body as the form that is the true collection of the bodies of all the Tatha-gatas.

original: mngon par byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'i gzugs su mthong ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par byung ba'i rdo rje sems dpa'i sku'i gzugs su mthong ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught: the very same thing that is taken hold of by the pride of the vajra body is the abode of all the Tathagatas, and so he sees the form of the body of Vajrasattva, which has emerged from the five-pronged vajra that is produced from the atoms of the bodies of all the Tathagatas.

original: gnas yongs su gyur pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas na yang lung dbog pa stsol bar mdzad de /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas na yang lung dbog pa stsol bar mdzad de /
translated: Since the transformation of the basis is not yet complete, he is still granted the prophecy.

original: da bas na sems dpa' chen po de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da bas na sems dpa' chen po de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, Great Being, therefore, etc.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽gang gi phyir @22b sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdul phra rab yang dag par bsags pa'i gzugs las rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs gcig pur mthong gi mtshan dang dpe byad yongs su rdzogs pa sems can thams cad kyis blta bar bya ba'i rang bzhin sems can rnams kyi don
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don te / gang gi phyir @22b sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdul phra rab yang dag par bsags pa'i gzugs las rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs gcig pur mthong gi mtshan dang dpe byad yongs su rdzogs pa sems can thams cad kyis blta bar bya ba'i rang bzhin sems can rnams kyi don
translated: Thus, the word “thus” has the meaning of “because.”

original: byed nus pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig pur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byed nus pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku gcig pur ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the form of Vajrasattva is seen as one, from the form of the buddhas that is a collection of atoms, and not as the form of a buddha, which is able to perform the aims of sentient beings, with the complete major and minor marks that all sentient beings can see.

original: de lta bas na sems dpa'i rdo rje de rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na sems dpa'i rdo rje de rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, that vajra of the bodhisattva should be endowed with all the supreme aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad de mtshan dang dpe byad rnams ni 'khor los sgyur ba rnams la yang yod pas na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad de mtshan dang dpe byad rnams ni 'khor los sgyur ba rnams la yang yod pas na /
translated: All aspects means the major and minor marks, which are also present in the universal monarchs.

original: de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mchog ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir mchog ces bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to distinguish it from that, “supreme” is mentioned.

original: mchog ni dam pa ste yul na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang / rdzogs par ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ni dam pa ste yul na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang / rdzogs par ldan pa yongs su gzung ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The best is the highest, and it is called endowed with the best of all aspects because it is endowed with the best, the highest, the clear, and the complete.

original: de ltar gyur pa lta zhig srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa lta zhig srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is like that, is it a bodhisattva in his last existence?

original: sangs rgyas kyi skur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi skur zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha’s body is said.

original: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi sku mdun du bsgom du yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi sku mdun du bsgom du yod do zhe na /
translated: If it is said that such a Buddha’s body is to be cultivated in front,

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba gsungs so //
translated: one’s own is said.

original: bsgoms shig ces bya ba ni lhag pa'i mos pa brtan par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsgoms shig ces bya ba ni lhag pa'i mos pa brtan par gyis shig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Cultivate means make firm the superior aspiration.

original: ya th'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan pas sems can thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba'i sku rgya chen pos sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa ji lta ba bdag kyang de bzhin
analyzed: ya th'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mtshan dang dpe byad rnams kyis brgyan pas sems can thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba'i sku rgya chen pos sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa ji lta ba bdag kyang de bzhin
translated: The meaning of “yatha” and so forth is that just as all the Tathāgatas, adorned with the major and minor marks, with a vast body pleasing to the minds of all sentient beings, accomplish the welfare of all sentient beings, so also I

original: no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of no is this.

original: bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du mngon par sangs rgyas shing lhag par mos pa de nas bla mar gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal ba ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du mngon par sangs rgyas shing lhag par mos pa de nas bla mar gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la phyag 'tshal ba ni /
translated: Having become fully enlightened as all the Tathagatas, he then pays homage to the gurus, the Tathagatas.

original: 'di ni kun du bzang po'i sa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ni kun du bzang po'i sa la gnas shing /
translated: This shows that he is abiding on the stage of Samantabhadra,

original: de rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings la zhugs pas na phyag 'tshal bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings la zhugs pas na phyag 'tshal bar ston pa yin no //
translated: and that he is paying homage by entering into the Dharma-realm of those Tathagatas.

original: bos nas zhes bya ba ni 'bod pa ste /
analyzed: bos nas zhes bya ba ni 'bod pa ste /
translated: Having called out, he then says Homage to the Tathagatas!

original: 'di yang phyag 'tshal ba gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang phyag 'tshal ba gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second homage.

original: da ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la dgongs nas byin gyis brlab par gsol pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo rnams la dgongs nas byin gyis brlab par gsol pa yin te /
translated: Now, with the future generations in mind, he requests the consecration.

original: sems can sems rnam par g-yengs ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya bsgrubs nas rnam par rtog pa gzhan dag la kun du spyod par gyur pas /
analyzed: sems can sems rnam par g-yengs ba rnams sangs rgyas kyi phyag rgya bsgrubs nas rnam par rtog pa gzhan dag la kun du spyod par gyur pas /
translated: Sentient beings with distracted minds, having accomplished the Buddha's seal, engage in other conceptual thoughts.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par lhag par mos pa brjod pa'i slob dpon du gyur pas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par lhag par mos pa brjod pa'i slob dpon du gyur pas /
translated: Thus, having expressed his superior aspiration, he becomes the master.

original: slob ma mngon par @23a * //
analyzed: slob ma mngon par @23a * //
translated: The disciples are the ones who are to be trained.🔽

original: 'du byed pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de'i lus la zhugs shing byin gyis brlabs te yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed pa ni 'gal ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams de'i lus la zhugs shing byin gyis brlabs te yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The disciples are to be consecrated by the Tathagatas entering their bodies and blessing them.

original: brtan par bya ba'i phyir yi ge brgya pa bzla ba ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: brtan par bya ba'i phyir yi ge brgya pa bzla ba ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The recitation of the hundred syllable mantra for the sake of stabilizing the consecration will be explained below.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dir ye shes kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dir ye shes kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi po rnams gzung ngo //
translated: All the Tathagatas refers to the four Tathagatas Akshobhya and so forth, who are taken here as the nature of the wisdom body.

original: gang yang sems dpa' rdo rje'i gnas skabs su zhugs pa de rnams ni sprul pa mtha' yas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gang yang sems dpa' rdo rje'i gnas skabs su zhugs pa de rnams ni sprul pa mtha' yas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Those who have entered the stage of the Bodhisattva Vajra are of the nature of infinite emanations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tathagata Vajra Realm is so called because he has actualized the nature of the Tathagata, which is the Dharma body.

original: sems dpa' rdo rje der zhes bya ba thams cad sngar gyi tshul la ltos te /
analyzed: sems dpa' rdo rje der zhes bya ba thams cad sngar gyi tshul la ltos te /
translated: The Bodhisattva Vajra there refers to all of them in relation to the previous method.

original: sems dpa' rdo rjer btags pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' rdo rjer btags pa yin no //
translated: The hero is the one who is called Vajrasattva.

original: zhugs zhes bya ba ni snying ga dang / smin mtshams dang lkog ma dang spyi bo rnams su zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: zhugs zhes bya ba ni snying ga dang / smin mtshams dang lkog ma dang spyi bo rnams su zhugs pa ste /
translated: The entrance is the entrance into the heart, the forehead, the throat, and the head.

original: 'di de'i byin gyis brlabs pa'o /
analyzed: 'di de'i byin gyis brlabs pa'o /
translated: This is his consecration.

original: // / da ni dgongs pa brnyes pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: // / da ni dgongs pa brnyes pa bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to teach the attainment of the will, he says, Then, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba ni 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The Tathagata Vajradhatu means the following.

original: gang gi ming rdo rje dbyings zhes dbang bskur ba stsol ba de ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams ji ltar gshegs ba de bzhin du gshegs shing sangs rgyas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi ming rdo rje dbyings zhes dbang bskur ba stsol ba de ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams ji ltar gshegs ba de bzhin du gshegs shing sangs rgyas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The one who is consecrated with the name Vajradhatu is the Tathagata, because he has gone and become a Buddha just as the former Buddhas went.

original: skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe na zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs pa'i rjes thogs nyid yin gyi dus gzhan pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma de nyid kyi tshe na zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs pa'i rjes thogs nyid yin gyi dus gzhan pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: At that very moment means immediately after the prophecy, not at another time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni kun du bzang po'i sems bskyed pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya ba ni kun du bzang po'i sems bskyed pa'o ;
translated: The “gnosis of the sameness of all tathāgatas” is the generation of the mind of Samantabhadra.

original: / de ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: / de ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ste /
translated: That is the full awakening,

original: de brnyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de brnyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of “he attained.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad do //
translated: Since he is a tathāgata and also all, he is all tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni ye shes kyi rdo rje ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni ye shes kyi rdo rje ste /
translated: The vajra of all tathāgatas is the vajra of gnosis,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: which is located on the moon disc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje yang yin la mnyam pa nyid kyis ye shes kyang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje yang yin la mnyam pa nyid kyis ye shes kyang yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Since he is the vajra of all tathāgatas and also the gnosis of sameness, he is the gnosis of the sameness of the vajra of all tathāgatas.

original: de nyid ni phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni phyag rgya ste /
translated: That itself is the seal,

original: mtshan ma yin pas rdo rje mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyag @23b rgya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma yin pas rdo rje mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyag @23b rgya'o //
translated: since it is the sign, it is the seal of the gnosis of the sameness of the vajra.

original: de nyid ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang gzhan mu stegs pa rnams kyis yongs su mi shes pas na gsang ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang gzhan mu stegs pa rnams kyis yongs su mi shes pas na gsang ba'o //
translated: That itself is secret, since it is not known by the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and others, the tīrthikas.

original: 'di nyid ni dam tshig ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ni dam tshig ste /
translated: This itself is the commitment,🔽the occasion of manifest enlightenment.

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i gnas skabs yin la der zhugs pas /
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i gnas skabs yin la der zhugs pas /
translated: Having entered there,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i gsang ba'i dam tshig tu zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya'i gsang ba'i dam tshig tu zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: he is said to have entered the commitment of the secret seal of the gnosis of the equality of all the vajras of the tathāgatas.

original: de brnyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de brnyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he has attained that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings su zhugs pa dang / rdo rje'i bdag nyid can nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos mnyam pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings su zhugs pa dang / rdo rje'i bdag nyid can nyid do //
translated: The equality of the dharmas of all the tathāgatas is the entry into the realm of the vajra body, speech, and mind of the tathāgatas, and the vajra nature itself.

original: chos mnyam pa nyid kho na ni ye shes te /
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid kho na ni ye shes te /
translated: The equality of the dharmas itself is gnosis.

original: de rtogs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de rtogs pa ni mngon sum du mdzad pa'o //
translated: The realization of that is the direct realization.

original: ye shes rtogs pa des na rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ye shes rtogs pa des na rang bzhin gyis dag pa nyid yin no //
translated: By that realization of gnosis, he is naturally pure.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: 'dus byas kyi grong khyer thams cad 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid kyis glo bur gyi dri ma rnams dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi grong khyer thams cad 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid can stong pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi rdo rje'i ngo bo nyid kyis glo bur gyi dri ma rnams dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis dag pa ste /
translated: It is naturally pure, because it is free from adventitious defilements by the very essence of the vajra of the gnosis of emptiness, which has the characteristic of destroying all the cities of conditioned existence.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa la gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dben pa la gnas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the abode of natural emptiness, which means the abode of natural emptiness, that is, the natural emptiness of the very essence of all things.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mnyam pa nyid ni /
translated: The sameness of all tathāgatas is

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i mnyam pa nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i mnyam pa nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: the three kinds of sameness as explained above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing ye shes kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing ye shes kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa yin te /
translated: By the sameness of all tathāgatas, it is the source of gnosis, naturally luminous.

original: rang bzhin zhe pa ngo bo nyid kyis 'od gsal zhing dri ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi yul dang ldan pa'i ye shes ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhe pa ngo bo nyid kyis 'od gsal zhing dri ma med pa stong pa nyid kyi yul dang ldan pa'i ye shes ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The nature is naturally luminous, stainless, and endowed with the object of emptiness. Gnosis is naturally luminous gnosis.

original: de'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa ni skyed pa'i gnas su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa ni skyed pa'i gnas su gyur pa ste /
translated: The source of that is the source of generation.

original: mnyam pa nyid bzhi pa brnyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid bzhi pa brnyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “attains the fourth equality” is the equality of the major and minor marks.

original: mnyam pa nyid bzhi pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyi mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid bzhi pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad kyi mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The fourth equality is the equality of the major and minor marks,

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes gang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes gang bshad pa'o //
translated: which is what is explained as “endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.”

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par gyur pa de'i phyir 'di rnams kyi rnam grangs kyi yul du gyur par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu'i yon tan dang ldan par gyur pa de'i phyir 'di rnams kyi rnam grangs kyi yul du gyur par bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because he is endowed with such qualities, in order to demonstrate that he is the object of their enumeration, he says “tathāgata,” and so on.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas de rnams ji ltar gshegs pa de bzhin du gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas de rnams ji ltar gshegs pa de bzhin du gshegs pa ste /
translated: He goes thus as the buddhas of the past went.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “buddha” is that he is the one who has gone thus.

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' gang la yang don gyi phyogs gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa @24a * //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' gang la yang don gyi phyogs gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa @24a * //
translated: If a bodhisattva were to ask, “What is the meaning of ‘tathāgata’?”

original: zhes bya bar srid pas de'i phyir dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar srid pas de'i phyir dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he is called an arhat.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pas na dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pas na dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: He is worthy of offerings from all who have desire, thus he is an arhat.

original: yang na khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal por 'os pa yin pas na dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: yang na khams gsum gyi chos kyi rgyal por 'os pa yin pas na dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: Or, he is worthy of being the Dharma King of the three realms, thus he is an arhat.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams kyang phal cher 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu'i dbang phyug rnams kyang phal cher 'dod chags dang bral ba yin pas /
translated: The lords of the ten bodhisattva stages are mostly free from desire.

original: de rnams kyang dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis brjod du rung bas /
analyzed: de rnams kyang dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis brjod du rung bas /
translated: They are also suitable to be called arhats.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes gsungs te yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par kun nas rdzogs par sangs rgyas su thugs su chud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o gyur to zhes
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes gsungs te yang dag cing phyin ci ma log par kun nas rdzogs par sangs rgyas su thugs su chud pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o gyur to zhes
translated: Therefore, he is called a perfect buddha. Because he fully understands and realizes the perfect and unmistaken, he is called a tathagata, an arhat, a perfectly enlightened one.

original: bya ba ni 'khrungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba ni 'khrungs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus have I heard means he was born.

original: sngar mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su rdo rje dbyings rdo rje dbyings zhes rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar gyur pa yin la da ni sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor rdzogs nas byin gyis brlabs pa mdzad de /
analyzed: sngar mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su rdo rje dbyings rdo rje dbyings zhes rdo rje ming gi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar gyur pa yin la da ni sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor rdzogs nas byin gyis brlabs pa mdzad de /
translated: Previously, when he was not yet fully enlightened, he was empowered by the vajra name empowerment, vajra space, vajra space, and so on. Now, after completing the yoga of buddhahood, he is blessed.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su yang bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal por rdo rje rin po che'i dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su yang bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal por rdo rje rin po che'i dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar bstan pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that he is empowered at the time of buddhahood by the empowerment of the vajra jewel, the unsurpassed king of the Dharma, it says, “Then,” and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu'o //
translated: “ Then” means immediately after.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “ All tathāgatas” are Akṣobhya and so on.

original: sngar dbang bskur zin pa'i phyir slar yang dbang bskur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngar dbang bskur zin pa'i phyir slar yang dbang bskur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since he was previously empowered, it is applied that he is empowered again.

original: gang nas byon zhe na gang du sngar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sems dpa' de las zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang nas byon zhe na gang du sngar bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sems dpa' de las zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: From where did he come?  From the heart of all the Tathagatas,  is what is said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad gzung la sems dpa' zhes smos pa ni kun du bzang po'i sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba ni 'dir bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad gzung la sems dpa' zhes smos pa ni kun du bzang po'i sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas means here the Lord Vairocana.  Heart refers to Samantabhadra's generation of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: rdo rje smos pa ni de'i steng na yod pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje smos pa ni de'i steng na yod pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje'o //
translated: The word vajra refers to the knowledge-vajra above that.

original: byung nas zhes bya ba ni 'thon pa'o //
analyzed: byung nas zhes bya ba ni 'thon pa'o //
translated: Having come means having emerged.

original: sangs rgyas lda'i cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba yin no zhe na /🔽de bstan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lda'i cod pan gyi dbang bskur ba yin no zhe na / de bstan pa'i phyir nam mkha'i snying po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If it is asked, What is the consecration of the crown of the Buddhas?🔽In order to teach that, it is said,

original: nam mkha' nyid snying po ste skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' snying po'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' nyid snying po ste skye ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' snying po'o //
translated: the heart of space, etc.  The heart of space is the abode of the origination, because space is the essence.

original: nam mkha'i snying po nyid ni nor bu rin po che chen po yin pas nam mkha'i snying po'i nor bu rin po che chen po ste nor bu'i rang bzhin gyi rin po che yin @24b pas na nor bu rin po che'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po nyid ni nor bu rin po che chen po yin pas nam mkha'i snying po'i nor bu rin po che chen po ste nor bu'i rang bzhin gyi rin po che yin @24b pas na nor bu rin po che'o //
translated: Since Akashagarbha is a great precious gem, it is the great precious gem of Akashagarbha. Since it is a precious gem that is the nature of a gem, it is a precious gem.

original: nor bu rin po che yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na nor bu rin po che chen po ste /
analyzed: nor bu rin po che yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na nor bu rin po che chen po ste /
translated: Since it is a precious gem and it is great, it is a great precious gem.

original: des dbang bskur ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su ni sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan rgyur gyur pas dbang bskur bar bstan la /
analyzed: des dbang bskur ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad la byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs su ni sangs rgyas lnga'i dbu rgyan rgyur gyur pas dbang bskur bar bstan la /
translated: The empowerment conferred by that is the empowerment conferred on the Bhagavat Vairochana when he was a bodhisattva, which is taught to be the cause of the crown of the five buddhas.

original: da ltar sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su ni 'bras bur gyur pa nam mkha'i snying po'i nor bu rin po che chen pos dbang bskur ba ni de gnyi ga brnyes par ston pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar sangs rgyas pa'i gnas skabs su ni 'bras bur gyur pa nam mkha'i snying po'i nor bu rin po che chen pos dbang bskur ba ni de gnyi ga brnyes par ston pa yin te /
translated: Now, at the time of his buddhahood, the empowerment conferred by the great precious gem of Akashagarbha is taught to be the result of both of those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor bsgrubs pas chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur bar 'os pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba byin pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rnal 'byor bsgrubs pas chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur bar 'os pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin pa'i phyir bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba byin pa yin no //
translated: Since he has accomplished the practice of the Buddha, he is fit to be consecrated as the king of Dharma, and thus he is given the consecration as the unsurpassed king of Dharma.

original: chos kyi rgyal po de'i chos kyi mdzod gtang bar bya ba'i phyir kun du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po de'i chos kyi mdzod gtang bar bya ba'i phyir kun du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to entrust the Dharma treasury of that king of Dharma, he says, “Avalokiteśvara,” and so on.

original: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i sems can la gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
analyzed: skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba'i sems can la gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs so //
translated: He is called Avalokiteśvara because he looks upon sentient beings to be trained according to their fortune.

original: de la dbang por gyur cing bdag por gyur pas na kun du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: de la dbang por gyur cing bdag por gyur pas na kun du spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'o //
translated: Since he is the lord and master of that, he is the all-seeing lord.

original: de'i chos rnams la mkhyen pa ni chos kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: de'i chos rnams la mkhyen pa ni chos kyi ye shes te /
translated: His knowledge of those dharmas is the knowledge of phenomena.

original: theg pa gsum gyis rnam par dbye bas yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyis rnam par dbye bas yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment by way of the division into the three vehicles.

original: de bskyed pa ni chos kyi mdzod gtad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bskyed pa ni chos kyi mdzod gtad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The generation of that is the meaning of “entrusting the Dharma treasury.”

original: da ni chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba brnyes shing chos kyi mdzod shin tu thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba brnyes shing chos kyi mdzod shin tu thugs su chud nas /
translated: Now, having attained the consecration as Dharma King and having fully understood the treasury of Dharma,

original: mchod pa'i bya ba rdzogs par bya ba la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mchod pa'i bya ba rdzogs par bya ba la sbyar bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: in order to apply oneself to the activity of completing the worship, [the Bhagavān] declares, “all the activities of all the Tathāgatas,” and so on.

original: sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa mtha' dag gi don gyi las mdzad pa ni thams cad kyi phrin las so //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs ma lus pa mtha' dag gi don gyi las mdzad pa ni thams cad kyi phrin las so //
translated: The activity for the sake of the entire host of sentient beings is all activities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad de de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad de de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad nyid do //
translated: All the activities of all the Tathāgatas are the nature of all the activities of all the Tathāgatas, and so it is the nature of all the activities of all the Tathāgatas.

original: de la bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi go 'phang thob par mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni sngon gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi go 'phang thob par mdzad nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having been placed in that, means having attained the state of the former Buddhas.

original: da ni gnas dang gdan gang la bzhugs nas de'i phrin las de mdzad pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ri rab kyi rtse mo gang na ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'og min gyi gnas su sngon gyi dus su bya ba rnams mdzad nas chos kyi rgyal po'i seng ge'i gdan la @25a * //
analyzed: da ni gnas dang gdan gang la bzhugs nas de'i phrin las de mdzad pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ri rab kyi rtse mo gang na ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'og min gyi gnas su sngon gyi dus su bya ba rnams mdzad nas chos kyi rgyal po'i seng ge'i gdan la @25a * //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate where he resides and on what seat he performs that enlightened activity, the text says “on the peak of Mount Meru,” and so on.

original: bzhugs par bya ba'i phyir 'go min nas ri rab tu gshegs so zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rdo rje rnams dang nor bu rnams dang rin po che rnams ni /
analyzed: bzhugs par bya ba'i phyir 'go min nas ri rab tu gshegs so zhes bya ba'i don to // rdo rje rnams dang nor bu rnams dang rin po che rnams ni /
translated: Having performed his activities in the Akaniṣṭha realm in the past, in order to sit on the lion throne of the Dharma King, he goes from Akaniṣṭha to Meru, this is the meaning.🔽The vajras, jewels, and gems

original: rdo rje dang nor bu dang rin po che ste /
analyzed: rdo rje dang nor bu dang rin po che ste /
translated: are the vajra, the jewel, and the gem.

original: rdo rje ni nor bu rdo rje'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni nor bu rdo rje'o //
translated: The vajra is the vajra jewel.

original: nor bu ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o //
analyzed: nor bu ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu'o //
translated: The jewel is the wish-fulfilling jewel.

original: rin po che ni padma r'a ga la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: rin po che ni padma r'a ga la sogs pa'o//
translated: The gem is the padmarāga, and so on.

original: de rnams kyis rtse mo brgyan pa'i khang bu brtsegs pa rtse mo rdo rje dang nor bu dang rin po che las byas pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rtse mo brgyan pa'i khang bu brtsegs pa rtse mo rdo rje dang nor bu dang rin po che las byas pa ste /
translated: The peak of the palace adorned with those is the peak made of vajra, jewel, and gem.

original: khang bu brtsegs pa ni khang bzangs la bya'o //
analyzed: khang bu brtsegs pa ni khang bzangs la bya'o //
translated: The palace is a mansion.

original: gshegs pa ni bshud pa'o //
analyzed: gshegs pa ni bshud pa'o //
translated: To enter is to go.🔽This vajra realm of the tathagatas is the abode of all tathagatas, and because the manifest enlightenment of all tathagatas is the same, and because the assembly and dharma body are the same, all tathagatas are the same.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khong su gtogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par byang chub pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / tshogs dang chos kyi sku mtshungs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de sngar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang rgyu gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis byin gyis brlab la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi khong su gtogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon par byang chub pa mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / tshogs dang chos kyi sku mtshungs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de sngar gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang rgyu gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis byin gyis brlab la /
translated: Previously, they were blessed by the essence of the same cause as the tathagatas.

original: da ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang rgyud tha dad par byin gyis brlabs shing /
analyzed: da ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang rgyud tha dad par byin gyis brlabs shing /
translated: Now, they are blessed as having the same continuum as all tathagatas.

original: de'i tshul gyis brtan par byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshul gyis brtan par byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are stabilized in that way.

original: de nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs par 'os te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs par 'os te /
translated: For that very reason, they are worthy to sit on the lion throne of all tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la seng ge yang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang yin la seng ge yang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge ste /
translated: Since he is all the Tathagatas and also a lion, he is the Lion of all the Tathagatas.

original: sems can thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i don gyis so //
translated: This is because he has the meaning of being victorious over all sentient beings.

original: de rnams kyi gdan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gdan ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan no //
translated: The seat of those is the Lion Seat of all the Tathagatas.

original: yang nas seng ges mtshan pa'i gdan ni seng ge'i gdan te /
analyzed: yang nas seng ges mtshan pa'i gdan ni seng ge'i gdan te /
translated: Or, the seat marked with a lion is the Lion Seat.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi seng ge'i gdan no //
translated: Since it is the Lion Seat of all the Tathagatas, it is the Lion Seat of all the Tathagatas.

original: zhal kun du bstan pa ni zhal bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: zhal kun du bstan pa ni zhal bzhi pa'o //
translated: Facing in all directions is the Four-faced.

original: bzhag par gyur to zhes pa ni 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: bzhag par gyur to zhes pa ni 'jog pa'o //
translated: The state of being placed is the placing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid du bzhag nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nyid du bzhag nas /
translated: Having placed the Tathagata Vajradhatu as all the Tathagatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams rang nyid ci zhig mdzad cing mtshan ji skad btags she na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de rnams rang nyid ci zhig mdzad cing mtshan ji skad btags she na /
translated: what did those Tathagatas do themselves and what names were given to them?

original: don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this meaning,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu'o //
translated: Then means immediately.

original: mtshan ji skad bya zhes ji skad du smras pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @25b te ;
analyzed: mtshan ji skad bya zhes ji skad du smras pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs @25b te ;
translated: As to the name, etc. , he asks, “What is the name of this samadhi? ” The Tathagata Akṣobhya, etc.

original: 'jig rten gsum rnam par 'jig tu zin kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum rnam par 'jig tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though the three worlds are destroyed,

original: 'di la g-yo ba cung zad kyang mi mnga' bas mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la g-yo ba cung zad kyang mi mnga' bas mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: he is not moved in the least, so he is Akṣobhya.

original: 'di las rin po che rnams 'byung bas na rin chen 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di las rin po che rnams 'byung bas na rin chen 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since jewels come forth from him, he is called Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: phyag rgya la sogs pa rin po che rnams de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya la sogs pa rin po che rnams de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the jewels such as the seal come forth from him.

original: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang bo'i rgyal po yin pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i rgyal po ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang bo'i rgyal po yin pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i rgyal po ste /
translated: Since he is the king of Avalokiteśvara, he is Avalokiteśvara-rāja,

original: de'i mgo la bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mgo la bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he resides on his head.

original: bsams pa tsam gyis don yod cing gdon mi za bar don thams cad 'grub pa 'di la mnga' bas na gdon mi za bar 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis don yod cing gdon mi za bar don thams cad 'grub pa 'di la mnga' bas na gdon mi za bar 'grub pa'o //
translated: Since he has the power to accomplish all aims just by thinking of him, and to accomplish all aims without fail, he is Amogha-siddhi.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad ni ye shes bzhi'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad ni ye shes bzhi'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: All the Tathagatas who are fully enlightened have the nature of the four knowledges.

original: thams cad kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi me long lta bu'i ye shes ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: The mirror-like knowledge of all of them appears as Akshobhya,

original: mar me'i 'od dang 'dra bar gdul bya rnams kyi rgyud la cig car snang ba yin no //
analyzed: mar me'i 'od dang 'dra bar gdul bya rnams kyi rgyud la cig car snang ba yin no //
translated: like the light of a lamp, appearing simultaneously in the mind-streams of those to be trained.

original: de bzhin du mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni rin chen 'byung ba nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes ni rin chen 'byung ba nyid du snang ngo //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of equality appears as Ratnasambhava.

original: de bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni snang ba mtha' yas nyid du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni snang ba mtha' yas nyid du'o //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of individual investigation appears as Amitabha.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni gdon mi za ba nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i ye shes ni gdon mi za ba nyid du snang ngo //
translated: The knowledge of performing activities appears as Amoghasiddhi.

original: de lta bas na der de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du so so nas bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na der de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du so so nas bdag nyid byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the passage “there all the Tathagatas individually bless themselves” teaches this.

original: bdag nyid ces smos pa ni sngar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir de rnams bdag nyid kyi byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa mdzad do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces smos pa ni sngar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i phyir de rnams bdag nyid kyi byin gyis rlob pa la sogs pa mdzad do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir yin la /
translated: The term “himself” is mentioned in order to teach that they perform the consecration, etc. of themselves, because they have already attained manifest, complete enlightenment.

original: gang yang gzod mngon par sangs rgyas pa rnams la ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa mdzad do zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang gzod mngon par sangs rgyas pa rnams la ni sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa la sogs pa mdzad do zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: And it teaches that the former Buddhas perform the consecration, etc. of those who have just attained manifest, complete enlightenment.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rang nyid kyi rgyud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rang nyid kyi rgyud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Himself” means “in his own continuum.”

original: byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab pa la sogs pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: “Having consecrated” means “having performed the consecration, etc.”

original: da ni rigs dang 'brel pas byang chub pa 'di mdzad par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rigs dang 'brel pas byang chub pa 'di mdzad par bstan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach that he performs this enlightenment through his connection with the lineage, he says, “The Lord Shakyamuni,” etc.

original: sh'akya rnams kyi nang na thub pa yin pas na sh'akya thub pa'o //
analyzed: sh'akya rnams kyi nang na thub pa yin pas na sh'akya thub pa'o //
translated: He is a sage among the Shakyas, thus he is a Shakyamuni.

original: yang na sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa'o //
translated: Or else, he is the Muni because he is endowed with the body, speech and mind of a Muni.

original: thams cad mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The equality of all things is thusness.

original: dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: It is the emptiness of all things.

original: rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud pa ste /🔽shin tu rtogs @26a * //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud pa ste / shin tu rtogs @26a * //
translated: The full understanding is the realization.

original: pas na rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: pas na rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is full because it is complete.

original: phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni phyogs thams cad mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba ni phyogs thams cad mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: The equality of all directions is the sameness of all directions.

original: de la dmigs pa ni lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: The surpassing faith is the object of that.

original: phyogs bzhir bzhugs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'di nyid bzhugs zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: phyogs bzhir bzhugs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'di nyid bzhugs zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The abiding in the four directions is the abiding of this very Bhagavān Śākyamuni.

original: yang na ri rab kyi ngos la nyi ma shar ba dang nub pas phyogs kyi cha rnam par bzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na ri rab kyi ngos la nyi ma shar ba dang nub pas phyogs kyi cha rnam par bzhag pa yin la /
translated: Or else, the directions are established by the rising and setting of the sun on the sides of Mount Meru.

original: 'char ba dang nub pa gang yang ngos thams cad la yod pas na kun rdzob tu yang phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'char ba dang nub pa gang yang ngos thams cad la yod pas na kun rdzob tu yang phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: Since the rising and setting are in all directions, it is the same in all directions even conventionally.

original: da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags spyod pa'i tshul la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba nus shing dgos pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: da ni de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngags spyod pa'i tshul la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba nus shing dgos pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du ston te /
translated: Now, then, from “thereupon” and so forth, it shows the power of turning the wheel of Dharma in the way of mantra, and the completion of the necessary purposes.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon pa ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ring po ma lon pa ni mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag pa'o //
translated: Not long after perfect buddhahood is the state of having just attained perfect buddhahood.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kun du bzang po ni kun du bzang po'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs kun du bzang po ni kun du bzang po'i thugs mnga' ba ste /
translated: The mind of all the tathāgatas is Samantabhadra, the mind of Samantabhadra.

original: 'dis ni dam tshig mkhyen pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dam tshig mkhyen pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows the knowledge of the commitments.

original: dam tshig mkhyen pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dam tshig mkhyen pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is there the knowledge of the commitments,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang bskur ba brnyes par yang bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nam mkha' las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dbang bskur ba brnyes par yang bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi nam mkha' las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that he has received the empowerment as explained, he says, “arisen from the space of all tathāgatas,” and so on.
